Title: Data Scientist AI
HTML:
CIMSOLUTIONS AI is een nieuwe business unit van CIMSOLUTIONS. Onze missie is het leveren van innovatieve softwareproducten en oplossingen met de hoogste business value voor het bedrijfsleven en de overheid, gebaseerd op Artificial Intelligence en Data Science. We bevinden ons in een spannende fase van groei en expansie, en we zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde en ambitieuze Data Scientist AI die ons kan helpen om ons doel te realiseren.


Als Data Scientist AI ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vergaren van waardevolle inzichten uit Data door geavanceerde analysetechnieken toe te passen. Daarnaast ben je in staat om deze resultaten helder te presenteren. Je identificeert meerdere gegevensbronnen en zorgt voor consistentie van gegevenssets. Je benut passende wiskundige modellen, selecteert en optimaliseert AI/ML algoritmes om bedrijfswaarde te leveren door middel van vergaarde inzichten. Je bent bedreven in het identificeren van patronen en het aanbevelen van toepassingen voor de gegevens.


Wat breng jij mee?

  • Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding met een sterk ICT-component;
  • Ervaring met het structureren en analyseren van grote hoeveelheden data om daarin relevante inzichten te ontdekken;
  • Kennis van gangbare AI/ML algoritmes, data verwerkerings- en analyse-technieken, en/of andere statistische methodes;
  • Kennis van Python, R, Matlab en/of Julia (of vergelijkbaar) en respectievelijke ML libraries (zoals TensorFlow, Keras, SKLearn, Caffe, Torch, Flux);
  • Kennis van en ervaring met databasetechnologieën zoals SQL/NoSQL of vergelijkbaar;
  • Ervaring met het visualiseren van data met behulp van de laatste state-of-the-art technologieën;
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels;
  • Een geldig rijbewijs B.


Wat bieden wij?

  • Een business unit gericht op AI, waarin jij jouw ambities en visie voor AI samen met andere specialisten in ons AI team kunt realiseren en delen.
  • Een stimulerende en innovatieve werkomgeving die oplossingsgericht met je meedenkt.
  • Naast een dienstverband voor onbepaalde tijd, een max. salaris van € 8.000, bonusregeling, leaseauto, pensioenregeling en maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding;
  • € 5.000,- opleidingsbudget en daarnaast 5-10 dagen studietijd;
  • Kennissessies met o.a. SIG Data Analytics en Competence Center Data Analyse, Big data en BI
  • 25 vakantiedagen en snel oplopend tot 28 vakantiedagen per jaar;
  • Het aan- of verkopen van vakantiedagen;
  • Regelmatig sociale uitjes zoals sportdagen, weekendjes weg en gezellige borrels.


Waarom werken voor CIMSOLUTIONS?

Werken bij CIMSOLUTIONS betekent werken bij een dynamische, financieel gezonde organisatie. CIMSOLUTIONS is een middelgroot bedrijf, hetgeen tot uiting komt in de persoonlijke aandacht voor onze medewerkers en onze platte organisatiestructuur. We bieden jou persoonlijke ontwikkeling aan en zo werk je aan jouw carrière. Learn, create and make it work is niet alleen onze slogan, maar is ons DNA. Als Data Scientist kun je doorgroeien naar diverse rollen, zoals Data Science Consultant.


Als jij de juiste persoon bent om ons AI team te versterken en een belangrijke rol in de ontwikkeling van onze AI producten, aarzel dan niet om te solliciteren. Stuur je cv en motivatiebrief naar recruitment@cimsolutions.nl of bel naar 0499 – 366 000 of bezoek onze website www.cimsolutions.nl/Werken-bij.

Title: Internship Data Scientist - Data Pipeline Development
Description:
Company Description

Syngenta is a leading developer and producer of seeds. We bring farmers more vigorous, stronger, resistant plants, including innovative hybrid varieties and biotech crops that can thrive even in challenging growing conditions. Each of our 28,000 employees in more than 90 countries work together to solve one of humanity’s most pressing challenges: growing more food with fewer resources. A diverse workforce and an inclusive workplace environment are enablers of our ambition to be the most collaborative and trusted team in agriculture.

Job Description

As a result of a new opening in the team, we seek a motivated and enthusiastic student based in the Netherlands for a 4-6 months internship.

Internship: Data Scientist – Data Pipeline Development

Into Action

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Master Student in Data Scientist to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for developing a robust data pipeline that consolidates various data sources for efficient querying and analysis. This role involves a mix of data engineering, data analysis, and software development skills.

The Challenge

You will design and implement scalable data pipelines to consolidate data from multiple sources and

ensure the integrity, reliability, and timely availability of data. Furthermore, you will develop processes for data modeling, mining, and production and identify opportunities to optimize data flow and collection.

You will work closely with data analysts team, applied teams and other stakeholders to understand their data requirements. You will Implement systems for tracking data quality and consistency.

You will optimize data retrieval and develop dashboards and reports for end users.

Qualifications

Your Profile


You're currently studying a Master’s in the direction of Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, or related field.
You're living in The Netherlands.
Strong programming skills in Python, R, SQL, and experience with scripting languages.
Familiarity with AWS cloud and AWS services
Proficiency in relational SQL and NoSQL databases
Experience with data visualization tools: Tableau, D3.js, GGplot, etc.
Familiarity with machine learning frameworks (like Keras or PyTorch) and libraries (like scikit-learn).
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Excellent communication and teamwork skills.


Your Chance!

Are you ready to grow your career with us?

If you recognize yourself in this profile and would like to apply for this position, please apply on-line via www.syngenta.com. If you would like to have more information about this vacancy please contact our recruiter Silvana van den Elzen via Silvana.van_den_elzen@syngenta.com or +31 6 82426074.

Title: Medior ML engineer / Data Scientist
Description:
people at the heart of everything we do

Working at Randstad is unlike working at any organization. Because at Randstad we put people at the heart of everything we do. This goes for our clients, our talent, our employees and society. We combine our passion for people with the power of today’s technologies. This helps us support people and organizations in realizing their true potential. Learn more about our mission, history and values on our website: www.randstad.com




how you will contribute

As a Machine Learning Engineer / Data Scientist you will create brand new insights into the global world of work. We use the latest ML and AI techniques to deliver highly accurate models for supporting a variety of business applications and processes, including market demand, talent supply, career patterns, salaries and rates, and pricing.

The focus in this role will be working on our global taxonomy program, that is supporting our systems landscape worldwide. In this program we are creating and maintaining information on all kinds of vital elementary data concepts, such as jobs, occupations, skills, certificates, education and more. We are using the latest ML technology and LLMs to create our models, and present the results via ML pipelines with a balanced set of microservices.

You will be a part of an international and agile team of highly skilled specialists, including data scientists, ML engineers, data engineers, and data analysts. We have a major research background and are publishing some of our greatest work in academic papers.

You will work closely with other colleagues within the Randstad ecosystem, especially in the various global projects. The impact of your work depends not only on the quality of your products, but especially on your ability to communicate the value and proof of concept of your models and analyses.




what you will be doing

building Machine Learning (ML) models: preparing data from a wide variety of internal and external data sources; creating and evaluating ML models, primarily in the NLP domain, based a.o. on open source LLMs and GenAI;

● building ML pipelines that automate the training and deployment of models

● defining and appropriating work to the product backlog

● training and coaching junior team members

● collaborating within the data science community within the Randstad ecosystem, on sharing best practices, harmonizing ML models, and grow collective data science skills




who will you work with

Our global data science team helps our customers make better hiring decisions and helps talent advance in their career paths. We help people find work by creating new insights into the dynamics of the global labor market and integrate those insights into customer- and talent-focused data products. We build and deploy machine learning models and tell stories with those insights. As an example - we create clarity where there are gaps in diversity, what a talent's next job might be, how market conditions should influence a hiring strategy, where we predict demand will go, and much more.




what you will bring

● Masters degree in Computer science / Data Science, or related technical studies (M.Sc. or equivalent experience)

● min. 2 to 3 years work experience as a ML engineer or data scientist with strong engineering skills

● machine learning (ML) platform: excellent working knowledge of analytical, AI and ML stacks on cloud platforms, preferably on Google Cloud Platform (incl. BigQuery, AI & ML stack) or comparable platforms

● coding: high proficiency in Python (incl. relevant libraries and packages) and SQL

● ML engineering: experience with the creation of ML pipelines and ML Ops related techniques

● ML modeling: relevant experience with NLP, LLMs, and working with the set of tools needed to build models on large and complex datasets (preferably in applied and research setting)




what’s in it for you

We put people at the heart of everything we do. Our employment conditions reflect this;

● competitive salary

● an additional flexible benefit budget

● attractive bonus scheme

● option to take part in Randstad's success through our employee Share Purchase Plan

● option to go on a sabbatical leave or buy extra holidays

● flexible working hours in the office or hybrid]

● attractive mobility arrangements

● opportunity to give back to local communities through paid volunteering leave

● a generous budget to set up your home office space and a net internet allowance]

● growth and development opportunities in a fast changing global environment

● working with great people and being part of a network where everyone wants you to succeed

● an environment where differences are understood, valued and celebrated




We want our teams and talent to reflect the rich diversity of the societies we serve. We thrive for an environment of belonging, safety and confidence. So everyone can bring their whole selves to work and flourish. Learn more about equity, diversity, inclusion and belonging at randstad here.




If you recognize yourself in the profile above, we invite you to apply for this role.

For more information you can reach out to our recruitment business partner Jenny Roberts .

The recruitment procedure consists of a screening and at least two interviews. Later in the process, an (online) assessment and a job offer conversation take place

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer

Overview:

We are seeking a talented Machine Learning Engineers to design and deploy scalable machine learning solutions and data pipelines. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to transform data into actionable insights and drive business outcomes.

Key Responsibilities:

Develop and maintain data pipelines using Python and tools like Apache Airflow and Kafka.
Build, train, and deploy machine learning models for production environments.
Conduct software testing and ensure the reliability of ML solutions.
Manage relational and NoSQL databases for efficient data storage and querying.
Implement CI/CD pipelines and use Docker/Kubernetes for deployment.
Utilize cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud) for infrastructure management.
Document workflows and best practices for data engineering and ML processes.

Requirements:

Experience: 5+ years in data engineering and machine learning roles.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in Python, Pandas, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, Airflow, and Kafka.
Methodologies: Experience with Agile, Scrum, and DevOps (CI/CD pipeline management).
Tools: Strong experience with Docker/Kubernetes and cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, or GCP).
Additional Experience: Knowledge of simulations, optimization algorithms, and real-time data streaming is a plus.

We are seeking a talented Machine Learning Engineers to design and deploy scalable machine learning solutions and data pipelines. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to transform data into actionable insights and drive business outcomes.

Title: Data Science Internship
Description:
Introduction

Do you want to be part of a global revolution in food & feed? We are looking for a Data Science Intern to support our team in collecting, analysing, and linking data across different business processes. This internship is an excellent opportunity for students or recent graduates to gain hands-on experience in SQL querying, exploratory data analysis, and machine learning while working closely with industry professionals.

What will your mission be?

Your mission as a Data Science Intern is to gain hands-on experience in data collection, analysis, and machine learning. You will develop innovative solutions and contribute to data-driven decision-making while working in a collaborative environment. By bridging the gap between academic knowledge and practical application, you will prepare yourself for a successful career in data science and analytics.

What will be your responsibilities?

In this role, you will gather and query data from multiple tables in our relational databases using SQL, develop and implement strategies to connect data from different business processes, and ensure consistency and accuracy across datasets. You will perform in-depth exploratory data analysis to uncover trends and generate insights that support business decisions. Additionally, you will validate hypotheses using the collected data and apply machine learning algorithms, including model training, evaluation, and optimization. Collaboration is key, as you will work closely with business analysts, data engineers, and other stakeholders to ensure data quality and alignment with business needs. Finally, you will present your findings, analysis, and model results clearly to both technical and non-technical team members.

Who are you?


Currently pursuing or recently completed a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree (in the Netherlands) in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, or a related field.
Proficient in SQL for data extraction and manipulation.
Experienced with Python for data analysis and scripting (knowledge of libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib, etc.).
Basic understanding of data exploration techniques and statistical analysis.
Knowledge of machine learning concepts is a plus.
Ability to think critically and develop innovative approaches for data integration and analysis.
Strong focus on data quality and consistency, with an eye for identifying discrepancies.
Effective communication of findings and insights to team members with varying technical expertise.
Eagerness to learn and apply new techniques in the data science field.


What do we promise?

Join our dynamic and inspiring team as we redefine the future of food and feed! Experience the thrill of being a game changer in an environment that thrives on innovation and sustainability. Take charge of your growth in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment where every day brings new opportunities for development.

Interested?

Excited to join us? Take the first step towards something extraordinary and apply now. Let's revolutionize the future of food together!

About Us

Protix is an organisation that focuses on the ingredient of the future: insects. By specializing in breeding the Black Soldier Fly – specifically the larvae – Protix ensures a future-proof source of an important ingredient: protein. With the use of artificial intelligence, high-tech applications, improvements in genetics and robotics, Protix ensures the return of the natural balance in our food chain.

Ready to be part of something extraordinary? Apply now and let's revolutionize the future of food together!

Protix - How we do it

Protix - What we do

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
My Client based in Groningen have opened a vacancy for a Medior Data Scientist with Azure experience, please see the key responsibilities and requirements below.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop and deploy machine learning models using Azure Machine Learning, Azure Databricks, or other Azure services.
Build and maintain scalable data pipelines using Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse Analytics, and other cloud tools.
Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and correlations that provide valuable business insights.
Collaborate with stakeholders to define business requirements and translate them into analytical solutions.
Work with cloud-based storage services such as Azure Blob Storage and Azure Data Lake to manage and process large volumes of data.
Create visualizations and dashboards using Azure Power BI to communicate findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.




Requirements:

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, or a related field.
Proven experience working as a Data Scientist, with a focus on Azure cloud services.
Strong expertise in Azure Machine Learning, Azure Databricks, Azure Data Factory, and Azure Synapse Analytics.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, and SQL.
Experience with machine learning algorithms, predictive modeling, and statistical analysis.
Familiarity with cloud computing concepts and Azure storage services like Blob Storage and Data Lake.
Experience with data visualization tools like Azure Power BI or similar.




Salary Package:

Up to €65,000 per annum
Flexible Hybrid working
Full access to Data Science learning and development tools

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist - Amsterdam, 2 days per week in the office




About our Team




LexisNexis Legal & Professional, which serves customers in more than 150 countries with 11,800 employees worldwide, is part of RELX, a global provider of information-based analytics and decision tools for professional and business customers. Our company has been a long-time leader in deploying AI and advanced technologies to the legal market to improve productivity and transform the overall business and practice of law, deploying ethical and powerful generative AI solutions with a flexible, multi-model approach that prioritizes using the best model from today’s top model creators for each individual legal use case.




About the Role




As a Data Scientist, you will extract insights from large, complex datasets using diverse analysis techniques. You'll use data preparation, modeling, and visualization to solve intricate business problems.




Extracts knowledge and insights from high volume, high dimensional data in order to investigate complex business problems through a range of data preparation, modeling, analysis and/or visualization techniques, which may include statistical analysis, predictive modeling and pattern recognition | Typically uses existing data platforms and tools (ERP/CRM systems, relational or NoSQL databases, data analysis and visualization software) but may also use object-oriented programming to develop own scripts and visualizations.




A Data Scientist II should have a basic understanding of best-practice and can execute the methods for projects with supervision. Individuals in this role will continue to provide support to the Data Scientist team members and also begin to lead some analytic efforts.







Responsibilities




Extracting knowledge and insights from high volume, high dimensional data
Investigating complex business problems through data preparation, modeling, and analysis
Utilizing statistical analysis, predictive modeling, and pattern recognition techniques
Using existing data platforms and tools for data analysis and visualization
Developing own scripts and visualizations using object-oriented programming
Providing support to senior Data Scientists and leading some analytic efforts
Pulling data, cleaning data, and maintaining datasets and models
Participating in result presentation to internal stakeholders




Requirements




Hold at least a bachelor's degree in a relevant field
Have a solid background of relevant work experience or a master's degree in a related field.
Be experienced in NLP and classic machine learning frameworks (pandas, scikit, etc)
Possess good SQL skills and practical knowledge of XML
Demonstrate a basic understanding of best practices in data science
Be able to execute methods for projects with supervision
Have practical experience with ERP/CRM systems, relational or NoSQL databases
Be capable of utilizing data analysis and visualization software




Work in a way that works for you




We promote a healthy work/life balance across the organisation. We offer an appealing working prospect for our people. With numerous wellbeing initiatives, shared parental leave, study assistance and sabbaticals, we will help you meet your immediate responsibilities and your long-term goals.




Working flexible hours - flexing the times when you work in the day to help you fit everything in and work when you are the most productive




Working for you




We know that your well-being and happiness are key to a long and successful career. These are some of the benefits we are delighted to offer:




Dutch Share Purchase Plan
Annual Profit Share Bonus
Comprehensive Pension Plan
Home, office or commuting allowance
Generous vacation entitlement and option for sabbatical leave
Maternity, Paternity, Adoption and Family Care leave
Flexible working hours
Personal Choice budget
Variety of online training courses and career roadshows
Wellbeing programs and gym facility in the office
Internal communities and networks
Various employee discounts
Recruitment introduction reward
Work from anywhere
Employee Assistance Program (global)
Annual Event




About the Business




LexisNexis Legal & Professional® provides legal, regulatory, and business information and analytics that help customers increase their productivity, improve decision-making, achieve better outcomes, and advance the rule of law around the world. As a digital pioneer, the company was the first to bring legal and business information online with its Lexis® and Nexis® services.

Title: Research Engineer - Machine Learning
Description:
Our client, a leading Algorithmic Trading firm, are hiring a machine learning engineer to work alongside a Quantitative Trader who has recently joined the firm.




Responsibilities:

Developing data pipelines for collecting, processing, and analyzing diverse datasets.
Design and implement deep learning architectures for large volumes of data.
Conduct experiments and tests to evaluate model performance.
Contribute to optimizing and fine-tuning existing machine learning models.
Build pipelines for monitoring, managing and constantly improving production ML/DL models.




Qualifications:

A bachelors, masters, or PhD (complete) degree or equivalent from a top university, with 2-6 years of experience.
Prior experience with training, building, and deploying large scale deep learning models is mandatory.
Prior experience designing and implementing sequence and time series models is required.
Experience with Git, CI/CD pipelines and MLOps for automating model deployments.
Skilled in using Linux, SQL, Git, and BASH scripting.
Strong knowledge of Python and hands-on (Pytorch/Tensorflow).




For more info, apply below or email Tom via tom@qenexus.com

Title: Freelance Data Scientist
Description:
Freelance Data Scientist – 6-Month Contract (Hybrid, Utrecht)




Contract Details:

Duration: 6 months Initially

Engagement: Freelance/Contract

Location: Utrecht, Hybrid

Hours: 40




We are seeking an experienced Freelance Data Scientist for a 6-month hybrid role based in Utrecht. This is an exciting opportunity to work with a leading omnichannel retail organization that operates on a large scale, leveraging data science to drive business impact.




About the Role -

Recently our customers data science team has made significant strides in implementing data-driven solutions. They have successfully delivered and analyzed initial products and are now focused on optimizing and expanding these successes.




As a Data Scientist, you will work to develop, implement, and optimize machine learning models and data-driven solutions that contribute directly to business growth and customer engagement.




Required Skills & Experience

Proven experience in machine learning, deep learning, and advanced data analysis techniques.
Strong expertise in Python, R, and SQL for data processing and model development.
Hands-on experience with cloud platforms (AWS or Azure).
Familiarity with MLOps frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or MLflow.
Experience working with Databricks and other big data processing tools.
Ability to translate complex data findings into actionable business insights.




If you are a Freelance Data Scientist and available for a new project in the Netherlands, please get in touch by sending your CV to Oscar.Bridgman@vividresourcing.com, or call me on +31 (0) 20 888 8400.

Title: Data Scientist AI
HTML:
CIMSOLUTIONS AI is een nieuwe business unit van CIMSOLUTIONS. Onze missie is het leveren van innovatieve softwareproducten en oplossingen met de hoogste business value voor het bedrijfsleven en de overheid, gebaseerd op Artificial Intelligence en Data Science. We bevinden ons in een spannende fase van groei en expansie, en we zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde en ambitieuze Data Scientist AI die ons kan helpen om ons doel te realiseren.


Als Data Scientist AI ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vergaren van waardevolle inzichten uit Data door geavanceerde analysetechnieken toe te passen. Daarnaast ben je in staat om deze resultaten helder te presenteren. Je identificeert meerdere gegevensbronnen en zorgt voor consistentie van gegevenssets. Je benut passende wiskundige modellen, selecteert en optimaliseert AI/ML algoritmes om bedrijfswaarde te leveren door middel van vergaarde inzichten. Je bent bedreven in het identificeren van patronen en het aanbevelen van toepassingen voor de gegevens.


Wat breng jij mee?

  • Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding met een sterk ICT-component;
  • Ervaring met het structureren en analyseren van grote hoeveelheden data om daarin relevante inzichten te ontdekken;
  • Kennis van gangbare AI/ML algoritmes, data verwerkerings- en analyse-technieken, en/of andere statistische methodes;
  • Kennis van Python, R, Matlab en/of Julia (of vergelijkbaar) en respectievelijke ML libraries (zoals TensorFlow, Keras, SKLearn, Caffe, Torch, Flux);
  • Kennis van en ervaring met databasetechnologieën zoals SQL/NoSQL of vergelijkbaar;
  • Ervaring met het visualiseren van data met behulp van de laatste state-of-the-art technologieën;
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels;
  • Een geldig rijbewijs B.


Wat bieden wij?

  • Een business unit gericht op AI, waarin jij jouw ambities en visie voor AI samen met andere specialisten in ons AI team kunt realiseren en delen.
  • Een stimulerende en innovatieve werkomgeving die oplossingsgericht met je meedenkt.
  • Naast een dienstverband voor onbepaalde tijd, een max. salaris van € 8.000, bonusregeling, leaseauto, pensioenregeling en maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding;
  • € 5.000,- opleidingsbudget en daarnaast 5-10 dagen studietijd;
  • Kennissessies met o.a. SIG Data Analytics en Competence Center Data Analyse, Big data en BI
  • 25 vakantiedagen en snel oplopend tot 28 vakantiedagen per jaar;
  • Het aan- of verkopen van vakantiedagen;
  • Regelmatig sociale uitjes zoals sportdagen, weekendjes weg en gezellige borrels.


Waarom werken voor CIMSOLUTIONS?

Werken bij CIMSOLUTIONS betekent werken bij een dynamische, financieel gezonde organisatie. CIMSOLUTIONS is een middelgroot bedrijf, hetgeen tot uiting komt in de persoonlijke aandacht voor onze medewerkers en onze platte organisatiestructuur. We bieden jou persoonlijke ontwikkeling aan en zo werk je aan jouw carrière. Learn, create and make it work is niet alleen onze slogan, maar is ons DNA. Als Data Scientist kun je doorgroeien naar diverse rollen, zoals Data Science Consultant.


Als jij de juiste persoon bent om ons AI team te versterken en een belangrijke rol in de ontwikkeling van onze AI producten, aarzel dan niet om te solliciteren. Stuur je cv en motivatiebrief naar recruitment@cimsolutions.nl of bel naar 0499 – 366 000 of bezoek onze website www.cimsolutions.nl/Werken-bij.

  • Ervaring met het structureren en analyseren van grote hoeveelheden data om daarin relevante inzichten te ontdekken;
  • Kennis van gangbare AI/ML algoritmes, data verwerkerings- en analyse-technieken, en/of andere statistische methodes;
  • Kennis van Python, R, Matlab en/of Julia (of vergelijkbaar) en respectievelijke ML libraries (zoals TensorFlow, Keras, SKLearn, Caffe, Torch, Flux);
  • Kennis van en ervaring met databasetechnologieën zoals SQL/NoSQL of vergelijkbaar;
  • Ervaring met het visualiseren van data met behulp van de laatste state-of-the-art technologieën;
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels;
  • Een geldig rijbewijs B.


Wat bieden wij?

  • Een business unit gericht op AI, waarin jij jouw ambities en visie voor AI samen met andere specialisten in ons AI team kunt realiseren en delen.
  • Een stimulerende en innovatieve werkomgeving die oplossingsgericht met je meedenkt.
  • Naast een dienstverband voor onbepaalde tijd, een max. salaris van € 8.000, bonusregeling, leaseauto, pensioenregeling en maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding;
  • € 5.000,- opleidingsbudget en daarnaast 5-10 dagen studietijd;
  • Kennissessies met o.a. SIG Data Analytics en Competence Center Data Analyse, Big data en BI
  • 25 vakantiedagen en snel oplopend tot 28 vakantiedagen per jaar;
  • Het aan- of verkopen van vakantiedagen;
  • Regelmatig sociale uitjes zoals sportdagen, weekendjes weg en gezellige borrels.


Waarom werken voor CIMSOLUTIONS?

Werken bij CIMSOLUTIONS betekent werken bij een dynamische, financieel gezonde organisatie. CIMSOLUTIONS is een middelgroot bedrijf, hetgeen tot uiting komt in de persoonlijke aandacht voor onze medewerkers en onze platte organisatiestructuur. We bieden jou persoonlijke ontwikkeling aan en zo werk je aan jouw carrière. Learn, create and make it work is niet alleen onze slogan, maar is ons DNA. Als Data Scientist kun je doorgroeien naar diverse rollen, zoals Data Science Consultant.


Als jij de juiste persoon bent om ons AI team te versterken en een belangrijke rol in de ontwikkeling van onze AI producten, aarzel dan niet om te solliciteren. Title: Data Scientist AI
HTML:

We bevinden ons in een spannende fase van groei en expansie, en we zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde en ambitieuze Data Scientist AI die ons kan helpen om ons doel te realiseren.


Als Data Scientist AI ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vergaren van waardevolle inzichten uit Data door geavanceerde analysetechnieken toe te passen. Daarnaast ben je in staat om deze resultaten helder te presenteren. Je identificeert meerdere gegevensbronnen en zorgt voor consistentie van gegevenssets. Je benut passende wiskundige modellen, selecteert en optimaliseert AI/ML algoritmes om bedrijfswaarde te leveren door middel van vergaarde inzichten. Je bent bedreven in het identificeren van patronen en het aanbevelen van toepassingen voor de gegevens.

Title: Machine Learning Scientist II - Content Intelligence Team
Description:
About Us: At Booking.com, data drives our decisions. Technology is at our core. And innovation is everywhere. But our company is more than datasets, lines of code or A/B tests. We’re the thrill of the first night in a new place. The excitement of the next morning. The friends you encounter. The journeys you take. The sights you see. And the memories you make. Through our products, partners and people, we make it easier for everyone to experience the world.

Leadership/Team Quote:

The Content Intelligence team builds the Content Intelligence Platform by consuming millions of images and textual inputs every day, and then enriching it with ML capabilities. Eventually, these will serve downstream applications and personalize our customers' experience (think of a way to choose and surface the right images and reviews when customers book their next vacation).

Moreover the team is taking a key role in the new GenAI project - The AI Trip Planner.

Role Description:

As a machine learning scientist, your work will focus on building, training and deploying content models (Computer vision, NLP and Generative AI) using the most advanced technologies and models.

You will be responsible for identifying and proposing the most appropriate data sources and modeling techniques to solve complex problems and drive business value.

Key Job Responsibilities and Duties:


Explore and apply state-of-the-art techniques in multimodal machine learning.
Train innovative ML models (NLP, CV, LLM-finetuning…), build algorithms, and engineering approaches to drive business impact..
Coding skills: ensure implementation of reusable frameworks (clean and scalable code).
Conduct data analysis with detailed metrics to evaluate model’s performance, labels quality, features exploration.
Work closely with machine learning engineers to ensure the model's latency/throughput meets product requirements and ensure deployment of your model to production.
Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams: Collaborate with product managers, data scientists, and analysts to understand business requirements and translate them into machine learning solutions.



Qualifications & Skills:


Advanced knowledge and experience in Computer Vision and Natural Language Processing, engineering aspects of developing ML and Generative AI models at scale.
Experience designing and executing end-to-end research and development plans and generating impact through large-scale machine learning model development. Preferably evidenced by peer-reviewed publication, patents, open sourced code or the like.
Relevant work or academic experience (MSc + 5 years of working experience, or PhD + 3 years of working experience), involved in the application of Machine Learning to business problems.
Masters degree, PhD or equivalent experience in a quantitative field (e.g. Computer Science, Engineering Mathematics, Artificial Intelligence, Physics, etc.).
Experience on multiple machine learning facets: working with large data sets, model development, statistics, experimentation, data visualization, optimization, software development.
Experience collaborating cross functionally in the development of machine learning products (e.g. Developers, UX specialists, Product Managers, etc.).
Strong working knowledge of Python, Java, Kafka, Hadoop, SQL, and Spark or similar technologies. Working experience with version control systems.
Excellent English communication skills, both written and verbal.
Successfully driving technical, business and people related initiatives that improve productivity, performance and quality while communicating with stakeholders at all levels
Leading by example, gaining respect through actions, not your title. Developing your team and motivating them to achieve their goals. Providing feedback timely and managing your key team performance indicators



Benefits & Perks - Global Impact, Personal Relevance:

Booking.com’s Total Rewards Philosophy is not only about compensation but also about benefits. We offer a competitive compensation and benefits package, as well unique-to-Booking.com benefits which include:


Annual paid time off and generous paid leave scheme including: parent, grandparent, bereavement, and care leave
Hybrid working including flexible working arrangements, and up to 20 days per year working from abroad (home country)
Industry leading product discounts - up to 1400 per year - for yourself, including automatic Genius Level 3 status and Booking.com wallet credit



Diversity, Equity and Inclusion (DEI) at Booking.com:

Diversity, Equity & Inclusion have been a core part of our company culture since day one. This ongoing journey starts with our very own employees, who represent over 140 nationalities and a wide range of ethnic and social backgrounds, genders and sexual orientations.

Take it from our Chief People Officer, Paulo Pisano: “At Booking.com, the diversity of our people doesn’t just build an outstanding workplace, it also creates a better and more inclusive travel experience for everyone. Inclusion is at the heart of everything we do. It’s a place where you can make your mark and have a real impact in travel and tech.”

We ensure that colleagues with disabilities are provided the adjustments and tools they need to participate in the job application and interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.

Application Process:

This section should provide:


Let’s go places together: How we Hire
This role does not come with relocation assistance.



Booking.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We strive to move well beyond traditional equal opportunity and work to create an environment that allows everyone to thrive.

Pre-Employment Screening

If your application is successful, your personal data may be used for a pre-employment screening check by a third party as permitted by applicable law. Depending on the vacancy and applicable law, a pre-employment screening may include employment history, education and other information (such as media information) that may be necessary for determining your qualifications and suitability for the position.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Bedrijfsomschrijving

Een positieve toekomst voor iedereen, daar werken we bij Sopra Steria aan. Met meer dan 56.000 collega’s in 30 landen zijn we Europa’s toonaangevende aanbieder van digitale oplossingen. Wij geloven dat het niet alleen technologie is die transformatie aandrijft, maar dat mensen de kern vormen van verandering. Daarom staan mensen centraal in alles wat we doen, zowel individueel als in teamverband. De wereld is hoe we haar vormgeven. Laten we haar samen vormgeven.

Vacatureomschrijving

Grote datasets bevatten waardevolle inzichten. Als data scientist zul je deze inzichten ontsluiten met behulp van je vaardigheid in programmeertalen zoals Python en R, evenals visualisatietools zoals Tableau en Power BI. Je zult deze inzichten communiceren naar stakeholders, zodat we die data kunnen omzetten in actie. Van jou wordt verwacht dat je de meest efficiënte oplossing analyseert en identificeert, terwijl je aandacht besteedt aan de details. Onze data scientists zijn bedreven in Hadoop & Spark, en cloudplatformen zoals AWS en Azure. Deze tools, gecombineerd met jouw data-expertise, zouden het bouwen van voorspellende modellen, het uitvoeren van hypothesetests en het doen van verkennende data-analyse tot een tweede natuur moeten maken.

Als Data Scientist bij Sopra Steria duik je de wereld van Kunstmatige Intelligentie (AI) in. Je past je vaardigheden toe op echte scenario's en in verschillende domeinen, zoals de ontdekking en analyse van betalingsstromen bij overheidsinstanties, fraudedetectie bij banken, de ontwikkeling van aanbevelingssystemen in de retailsector en de optimalisatie van toeleveringsketens.

We zijn actief in thema's zoals Natural Language Processing (NLP), Computer Vision, Machine Learning Operations (MLOps), AIOps en Uitlegbare AI (XAI). Je zult de ontwikkeling en implementatie van oplossingen met Machine Learning & Deep Learning bij onze klanten uitvoeren en de kwaliteit en prestaties van bestaande voorspellende modellen beoordelen, tot en met het in productie brengen en het behouden van deze modellen.

Functie-eisen

We zijn op zoek naar gepassioneerde collega’s die graag de grenzen van digitale transformatie en technologieconsulting verleggen. Bij Sopra Steria krijg je de kans om je vaardigheden verder te ontwikkelen in een constructieve, samenwerkende teamomgeving, waarbij je werkt aan impactvolle projecten die verandering teweegbrengen voor onze klanten. Als je gedijt in een uitdagende omgeving en voldoet (tenzij anders vermeld) aan de meeste kwalificaties hieronder, kijken we uit naar je sollicitatie!

Type dienstverband: Hybride

Locatie: Nieuwegein

Aantal contracturen: 32-40 uur per week

Contracttype: Vast

Opleiding: Je hebt een HBO- of WO-opleiding afgerond in de richting van IT

Talen: Nederlands (vereist) en Engels

Ervaring in de meeste van de volgende Data Science technieken:


Begeleide en onbegeleide leeralgoritmes
Diepgaande leertechnieken
Anomaliedetectie
Aanbevelingssystemen
Natuurlijke taalverwerking
Computer vision en reinforcement learning
Autoencoders, transformers, voorspellingen


Ervaring in een van de volgende programmeertalen:


Python
R


Ervaring in het in productie brengen van Data Science-oplossingen/software (Azure, AWS, GCP, Kubernetes, Docker, etc.)

Ervaring met het bouwen en implementeren van geavanceerde analytische oplossingen en het kunnen leveren van referentiecases

Diepgaande kennis van open-source software en bibliotheken in Python en/of R voor machine- en deep learning

Ervaring met big data en platforms zoals Azure Machine Learning Services en Amazon SageMaker is een voordeel.

Aanvullende informatie

Als onderdeel van een van Europa’s grootste aanbieders van digitale oplossingen profiteer je van uitgebreide carrièremogelijkheden, zowel lokaal als internationaal. Bij de Sopra Steria Academy maak je deel uit van een dynamisch netwerk van 56.000 professionals in verschillende stadia van hun loopbaan. Je wordt onderdeel van een toonaangevende techspeler in Europa, erkend voor zijn consultancy, digitale diensten en softwareontwikkeling.

Binnen de area Data creëren wij duurzame waarde bij onze klanten op het gebied van data. Wij helpen bedrijven om wendbaar te blijven in de transitie door data en techniek onderdeel te laten zijn van zowel de dagelijkse operatie als de strategische besluitvorming. Hiermee helpen wij onze klanten de verandering voor te zijn met behulp van data. Het is onze ambitie om organisaties te laten excelleren met data. Je werkt in een hightech omgeving met focus op kennis en innovatie, een open no-nonsense bedrijfscultuur met ruimte voor eigen initiatief. De area bestaat uit 5 practices: Data Governance & Data Management, Data Visualisation, Data Science & AI, Data Engineering & Data Migrations en Spatial Intelligence. Elk met een duidelijke signatuur en focus op inhoud en bijbehorende solution. Binnen deze area zijn ruim 170 professionals werkzaam in een voor hen logische en passende vakinhoudelijke practice.

Onze medewerkers staan bekend om hun gedurfde keuzes en het leveren van resultaten. Werk samen met hooggekwalificeerde professionals die voorop lopen in bedrijfs-softwareoplossingen en innovatie bij Europa's toonaangevende aanbieder van digitale diensten.

Wij bieden een aantrekkelijk arbeidsvoorwaardenpakket, waaronder:


Locatie onafhankelijk en flexibel werken;
Onbeperkte ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden;
Een laptop, telefoon en thuiskantoor;
Een aantrekkelijk salaris;
Keuze tussen een bedrijfsauto of een mobiliteitsbudget;
De mogelijkheid om je eigen voordelen aan te passen via Flex Benefits:
Vakantiegeld en winstdeling;
27 verlofdagen (20 wettelijke en 7 bovenwettelijke vakantiedagen).

______

Sopra Steria is een werkgever die gelijke kansen biedt. Alle gekwalificeerde sollicitanten worden in aanmerking genomen voor een job zonder rekening te houden met leeftijd, afkomst, nationaliteit, huidskleur, verlof voor familie- of medische zorg, geslachtsidentiteit of -uitdrukking, genetische informatie, immigratiestatus, burgerlijke staat, medische toestand, nationale herkomst, fysieke of mentale handicap, politieke voorkeur, beschermde veteranen- of militaire status, ras, etniciteit, religie, geslacht (inclusief zwangerschap), seksuele geaardheid of enig ander kenmerk dat wordt beschermd door toepasselijke lokale wetten, voorschriften en verordeningen. We koesteren een werkomgeving die inclusief is en alle verschillen respecteert.
Show more

Title: Data Science Internship
Description:
Introduction

Do you want to be part of a global revolution in food & feed? We are looking for a Data Science Intern to support our team in collecting, analysing, and linking data across different business processes. This internship is an excellent opportunity for students or recent graduates to gain hands-on experience in SQL querying, exploratory data analysis, and machine learning while working closely with industry professionals.

What will your mission be?

Your mission as a Data Science Intern is to gain hands-on experience in data collection, analysis, and machine learning. You will develop innovative solutions and contribute to data-driven decision-making while working in a collaborative environment. By bridging the gap between academic knowledge and practical application, you will prepare yourself for a successful career in data science and analytics.

What will be your responsibilities?

In this role, you will gather and query data from multiple tables in our relational databases using SQL, develop and implement strategies to connect data from different business processes, and ensure consistency and accuracy across datasets. You will perform in-depth exploratory data analysis to uncover trends and generate insights that support business decisions. Additionally, you will validate hypotheses using the collected data and apply machine learning algorithms, including model training, evaluation, and optimization. Collaboration is key, as you will work closely with business analysts, data engineers, and other stakeholders to ensure data quality and alignment with business needs. Finally, you will present your findings, analysis, and model results clearly to both technical and non-technical team members.

Who are you?


Currently pursuing or recently completed a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree (in the Netherlands) in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, or a related field.
Proficient in SQL for data extraction and manipulation.
Experienced with Python for data analysis and scripting (knowledge of libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib, etc.).
Basic understanding of data exploration techniques and statistical analysis.
Knowledge of machine learning concepts is a plus.
Ability to think critically and develop innovative approaches for data integration and analysis.
Strong focus on data quality and consistency, with an eye for identifying discrepancies.
Effective communication of findings and insights to team members with varying technical expertise.
Eagerness to learn and apply new techniques in the data science field.


What do we promise?

Join our dynamic and inspiring team as we redefine the future of food and feed! Experience the thrill of being a game changer in an environment that thrives on innovation and sustainability. Take charge of your growth in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment where every day brings new opportunities for development.

Interested?

Excited to join us? Take the first step towards something extraordinary and apply now. Let's revolutionize the future of food together!

About Us

Protix is an organisation that focuses on the ingredient of the future: insects. By specializing in breeding the Black Soldier Fly – specifically the larvae – Protix ensures a future-proof source of an important ingredient: protein. With the use of artificial intelligence, high-tech applications, improvements in genetics and robotics, Protix ensures the return of the natural balance in our food chain.

Ready to be part of something extraordinary? Apply now and let's revolutionize the future of food together!

Protix - How we do it

Protix - What we do

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
My Client based in Groningen have opened a vacancy for a Medior Data Scientist with Azure experience, please see the key responsibilities and requirements below.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop and deploy machine learning models using Azure Machine Learning, Azure Databricks, or other Azure services.
Build and maintain scalable data pipelines using Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse Analytics, and other cloud tools.
Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and correlations that provide valuable business insights.
Collaborate with stakeholders to define business requirements and translate them into analytical solutions.
Work with cloud-based storage services such as Azure Blob Storage and Azure Data Lake to manage and process large volumes of data.
Create visualizations and dashboards using Azure Power BI to communicate findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.




Requirements:

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, or a related field.
Proven experience working as a Data Scientist, with a focus on Azure cloud services.
Strong expertise in Azure Machine Learning, Azure Databricks, Azure Data Factory, and Azure Synapse Analytics.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, and SQL.
Experience with machine learning algorithms, predictive modeling, and statistical analysis.
Familiarity with cloud computing concepts and Azure storage services like Blob Storage and Data Lake.
Experience with data visualization tools like Azure Power BI or similar.




Salary Package:

Up to €65,000 per annum
Flexible Hybrid working
Full access to Data Science learning and development tools

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Job Description

Our customers have a growing need for meaningful data to make responsible decisions. Ipsos helps with this by finding out what motivates consumers and companies and by processing, analysing and reporting all the data collected. The Data Team focuses on data collection, data processing, data analysis, data science and data visualization.

Would you like to have a challenging role in the Data Team of one of the most innovative research agencies? Are you a data wizard who likes to get to the bottom of everything? Are you driven to work with the research teams to provide our clients with the right insights? Are you intelligent, self-employed? Then you are the reinforcement we are looking for in our Data Team.

Our organization

Ipsos employs professionals who have a natural intellectual curiosity. We have a passion for what drives people. For us, research is more than just information. We are always looking for new ways to work with our customers to find solutions that matter.

We work with wonderful customers and strong brands worldwide. As an organization, we are in full swing with a growing portfolio.

For our Data Team, we are looking for an experienced and enthusiastic

Data Scientist / Analyst

As a Data Scientist / Analyst at Ipsos, you will provide a valuable contribution to our clients' business by providing insights into consumer attitudes and behavior based on data from various sources.

The Following Activities Are Part Of Your Duties


Performing complex statistical analyses and prediction models for market research
Active participation in the research projects with advice, analysis and other support
Performing checks on the results before delivery to the research team
Unlocking research data, social media and customer data, structured and unstructured
Clear visualization and communication of the results to internal and/or external customers
Contribute to the renewal and improvement of existing structures and processes


Your qualities


Experience with databases, data analytics, data science and scripting on various platforms such as SQL, SPSS/SAS, R, Python, Git or similar packages.
A statistical background and affinity with research methods and techniques such as regression, segmentation, data fusion; Experience in survey research is an advantage
Academic working and thinking level.
Able to convey complex problems with simple words
Pragmatic, precise and creative. It's okay to be out-of-the-box


Your Skills


Skilled in learning software packages
Proactive, with an eye for detail
Flexible and able to handle deadlines well
Team player, with a drive to deliver results together
Good command of Dutch and English
Preferably available full-time, but at least 32 hours


What We Offer You


An international organization with many opportunities for personal growth and development.
A close-knit and diverse data team, the perfect mix of informal and professional, combining all facets of data collection and data processing
Strong and innovative research solutions to help our customers.
A working environment where there is plenty of room for your own input and fresh ideas. We appreciate it when you show character and make your voice heard.
A dynamic, open and informal working environment where everything revolves around our passion for customers and market research.
Collaboration with a driven group of colleagues who are known for their expertise, team spirit, intellectual curiosity and love for the profession.
An introduction program that ensures that you get off to a flying start and are settled in no time.
Regular drinks and inspiration sessions
A laptop, and with it the flexibility to work from home every now and then.


Have we piqued your interest?

Then we would like to get in touch with you. Send us your CV and cover letter (with a clear motivation why you are suitable for this role) by clicking on the application button. Preferably as soon as possible, but no later than March 2, 2025.

Do you have additional questions? Contact us at: recruitment.netherlands@ipsos.com .

For more information about Ipsos, visit www.ipsos.com/nl-nl

Follow us on LinkedIn: Ipsos-Netherlands

About Us

Ipsos is one of the world’s largest research companies and currently the only one primarily managed by researchers, ranking as a #1 full-service research organization for four consecutive years . With over 75 different data-driven solutions, and presence in 90 markets, Ipsos brings together research, implementation, methodological, and subject-matter experts from around the world, combining thematic and technical experts to deliver top-quality research and insights. Simply speaking, we help the biggest companies solve some of their biggest problems, serving more than 5000 clients across the globe by providing research, data, and insights on their target markets. And we’re proud to share we’ve received our Great Place to Work Certification in 2022 & 2023!
Show more

  • A close-knit and diverse data team, the perfect mix of informal and professional, combining all facets of data collection and data processing
  • Strong and innovative research solutions to help our customers.
  • A working environment where there is plenty of room for your own input and fresh ideas. We appreciate it when you show character and make your voice heard.
  • A dynamic, open and informal working environment where everything revolves around our passion for customers and market research.
  • Collaboration with a driven group of colleagues who are known for their expertise, team spirit, intellectual curiosity and love for the profession.
  • An introduction program that ensures that you get off to a flying start and are settled in no time.
  • Regular drinks and inspiration sessions
  • A laptop, and with it the flexibility to work from home every now and then.

Have we piqued your interest?

Then we would like to get in touch with you. Send us your CV and cover letter (with a clear motivation why you are suitable for this role) by clicking on the application button. Preferably as soon as possible, but no later than March 2, 2025.

Do you have additional questions? Contact us at: recruitment.netherlands@ipsos.com .

For more information about Ipsos, visit www.ipsos.com/nl-nl

Follow us on LinkedIn: Ipsos-Netherlands

About Us

Ipsos is one of the world’s largest research companies and currently the only one primarily managed by researchers, ranking as a #1 full-service research organization for four consecutive years . With over 75 different data-driven solutions, and presence in 90 markets, Ipsos brings together research, implementation, methodological, and subject-matter experts from around the world, combining thematic and technical experts to deliver top-quality research and insights. Simply speaking, we help the biggest companies solve some of their biggest problems, serving more than 5000 clients across the globe by providing research, data, and insights on their target markets. And we’re proud to share we’ve received our Great Place to Work Certification in 2022 & 2023!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist - Amsterdam, 2 days per week in the office




About our Team




LexisNexis Legal & Professional, which serves customers in more than 150 countries with 11,800 employees worldwide, is part of RELX, a global provider of information-based analytics and decision tools for professional and business customers. Our company has been a long-time leader in deploying AI and advanced technologies to the legal market to improve productivity and transform the overall business and practice of law, deploying ethical and powerful generative AI solutions with a flexible, multi-model approach that prioritizes using the best model from today’s top model creators for each individual legal use case.




About the Role




As a Data Scientist, you will extract insights from large, complex datasets using diverse analysis techniques. You'll use data preparation, modeling, and visualization to solve intricate business problems.




Extracts knowledge and insights from high volume, high dimensional data in order to investigate complex business problems through a range of data preparation, modeling, analysis and/or visualization techniques, which may include statistical analysis, predictive modeling and pattern recognition | Typically uses existing data platforms and tools (ERP/CRM systems, relational or NoSQL databases, data analysis and visualization software) but may also use object-oriented programming to develop own scripts and visualizations.




A Data Scientist II should have a basic understanding of best-practice and can execute the methods for projects with supervision. Individuals in this role will continue to provide support to the Data Scientist team members and also begin to lead some analytic efforts.







Responsibilities




Extracting knowledge and insights from high volume, high dimensional data
Investigating complex business problems through data preparation, modeling, and analysis
Utilizing statistical analysis, predictive modeling, and pattern recognition techniques
Using existing data platforms and tools for data analysis and visualization
Developing own scripts and visualizations using object-oriented programming
Providing support to senior Data Scientists and leading some analytic efforts
Pulling data, cleaning data, and maintaining datasets and models
Participating in result presentation to internal stakeholders




Requirements




Hold at least a bachelor's degree in a relevant field
Have a solid background of relevant work experience or a master's degree in a related field.
Be experienced in NLP and classic machine learning frameworks (pandas, scikit, etc)
Possess good SQL skills and practical knowledge of XML
Demonstrate a basic understanding of best practices in data science
Be able to execute methods for projects with supervision
Have practical experience with ERP/CRM systems, relational or NoSQL databases
Be capable of utilizing data analysis and visualization software




Work in a way that works for you




We promote a healthy work/life balance across the organisation. We offer an appealing working prospect for our people. With numerous wellbeing initiatives, shared parental leave, study assistance and sabbaticals, we will help you meet your immediate responsibilities and your long-term goals.




Working flexible hours - flexing the times when you work in the day to help you fit everything in and work when you are the most productive




Working for you




We know that your well-being and happiness are key to a long and successful career. These are some of the benefits we are delighted to offer:




Dutch Share Purchase Plan
Annual Profit Share Bonus
Comprehensive Pension Plan
Home, office or commuting allowance
Generous vacation entitlement and option for sabbatical leave
Maternity, Paternity, Adoption and Family Care leave
Flexible working hours
Personal Choice budget
Variety of online training courses and career roadshows
Wellbeing programs and gym facility in the office
Internal communities and networks
Various employee discounts
Recruitment introduction reward
Work from anywhere
Employee Assistance Program (global)
Annual Event




About the Business




LexisNexis Legal & Professional® provides legal, regulatory, and business information and analytics that help customers increase their productivity, improve decision-making, achieve better outcomes, and advance the rule of law around the world. As a digital pioneer, the company was the first to bring legal and business information online with its Lexis® and Nexis® services.

Show more

Title: Research Engineer - Machine Learning
Description:
Our client, a leading Algorithmic Trading firm, are hiring a machine learning engineer to work alongside a Quantitative Trader who has recently joined the firm.




Responsibilities:

Developing data pipelines for collecting, processing, and analyzing diverse datasets.
Design and implement deep learning architectures for large volumes of data.
Conduct experiments and tests to evaluate model performance.
Contribute to optimizing and fine-tuning existing machine learning models.
Build pipelines for monitoring, managing and constantly improving production ML/DL models.




Qualifications:

A bachelors, masters, or PhD (complete) degree or equivalent from a top university, with 2-6 years of experience.
Prior experience with training, building, and deploying large scale deep learning models is mandatory.
Prior experience designing and implementing sequence and time series models is required.
Experience with Git, CI/CD pipelines and MLOps for automating model deployments.
Skilled in using Linux, SQL, Git, and BASH scripting.
Strong knowledge of Python and hands-on (Pytorch/Tensorflow).




For more info, apply below or email Tom via tom@qenexus.com

Title: Freelance Data Scientist
Description:
Freelance Data Scientist – 6-Month Contract (Hybrid, Utrecht)




Contract Details:

Duration: 6 months Initially

Engagement: Freelance/Contract

Location: Utrecht, Hybrid

Hours: 40




We are seeking an experienced Freelance Data Scientist for a 6-month hybrid role based in Utrecht. This is an exciting opportunity to work with a leading omnichannel retail organization that operates on a large scale, leveraging data science to drive business impact.




About the Role -

Recently our customers data science team has made significant strides in implementing data-driven solutions. They have successfully delivered and analyzed initial products and are now focused on optimizing and expanding these successes.




As a Data Scientist, you will work to develop, implement, and optimize machine learning models and data-driven solutions that contribute directly to business growth and customer engagement.




Required Skills & Experience

Proven experience in machine learning, deep learning, and advanced data analysis techniques.
Strong expertise in Python, R, and SQL for data processing and model development.
Hands-on experience with cloud platforms (AWS or Azure).
Familiarity with MLOps frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or MLflow.
Experience working with Databricks and other big data processing tools.
Ability to translate complex data findings into actionable business insights.




If you are a Freelance Data Scientist and available for a new project in the Netherlands, please get in touch by sending your CV to Oscar.Bridgman@vividresourcing.com, or call me on +31 (0) 20 888 8400.

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
We’re building a world-class team to redefine knowledge work with AI

Zeno is a legal AI startup working to change how legal professionals do their work. By combining leading AI technology with deep insights into the legal profession, we automate complex workflows and increase productivity. In just one year, we’ve evolved from a single Proof of Concept to a platform with multiple tools actively used by hundreds of legal professionals.

We’re in the early stages of building something impressive. With our seed funding secured and early market traction validated, we’re growing a team of engineers and thinkers who want to solve real problems and drive innovation and create lasting change in the legal sector.

The role

As an AI Engineer at Zeno, you will work at the forefront of AI and large language model (LLM) applications, designing and implementing intelligent systems that redefine how legal professionals access and utilize knowledge. You’ll explore cutting-edge advancements, tackle deeply technical challenges, and help bring AI-driven solutions to life.

This is a high-impact role where your contributions will shape the next generation of AI-powered legal tools—enhancing search, automation, and decision-making for legal professionals worldwide.

What You’ll Be Working On


Architect and deploy AI-driven solutions that enhance search, knowledge retrieval, and workflow automation.
Stay ahead of the curve by experimenting with state-of-the-art LLM models, including agentic flows and reasoning frameworks.
Optimize performance, scalability, and security while maintaining high-quality, production-ready code.
Rapidly prototype and validate new ideas, working closely with users to refine and deploy impactful AI applications.
Work alongside the technical founders, experienced engineers and legal professionals to push AI’s limits in legal tech.


What We’re Looking For


You thrive on technical challenges and have a deep passion for AI, LLMs, and building intelligent applications.
Experience working with AI and software development, preferably with LLM applications (either in work experience or side projects)
You’re skilled in Python, Java, C++, or JavaScript and can work across tech stacks to bring AI systems to life.
You take ownership, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and aren’t afraid to experiment.
You enjoy working with like-minded engineers, bouncing ideas, and building next-generation AI systems together.


What We Offer


A unique opportunity to work at a startup that is shaping the future of legal tech.
The ability to make a direct and tangible impact on the development and growth of our platform.
An inspiring place to work in an office located at the heart of Rotterdam.
Collaboration with a top-tier team of engineers, researchers, and entrepreneurs.
Competitive compensation, including growth and equity opportunities within the company.


Let’s shape the future of legal work together
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Overview / About Us

Lumanity is dedicated to improving patient health by accelerating and optimizing access to medical advances. We partner with life sciences companies around the world to generate evidence to demonstrate the value of their product, translate the science and data into compelling product narratives, and enable commercial decisions that position these products for success in the market. We do this through strategic and complimentary areas of focus: Asset Optimization and Commercialization, Value, Access, and Outcomes, Medical Strategy and Communications, and Real-World Evidence.

PHARMO Institute is dedicated to the study of epidemiology, drug utilization, drug safety and health outcomes. As part of Lumanity, a global pharmaceutical strategic services organization, PHARMO Institute studies the effects of drug treatments in real life to enhance the health of people using medication. In that way, we contribute to drug safety and are able to find unwanted side effects in advance.

Responsibilities / Position Overview

The team are hiring a Data Scientist / Researcher who will be conducting pharmacoepidemiologic research in the team, to deliver on client project work.

This hire will be responsible for:


Execution of assignments - carries out assignments (partly) under the supervision of a (senior) researcher. The implementation may relate to the development of research protocol, statistical analysis plan, statistical analyses, data processing, literature review, methodology development.
Drafts – under guidance reports within larger assignments.
Innovation - contributing to innovations in one (or more) thematic areas and to the development of new PHARMO products.
Acquisition - contributes to the acquisition of new assignments, development of action plan and quotation under the final responsibility of the (senior) researcher.


Specific Operation Requirements

Handling confidential information and complying with information security procedures in accordance with the ISO 27001 and ISO 9001 certification of STIZON and PHARMO respectively. This role offers the unique opportunity to combine you programming knowledge, passion for data, commercial craftsmanship, and social involvement.

Qualifications


Completed academic training in the field of medical content
Masters the English language (word and writing)
Knowledge and experience with epidemiological/RWE/statistical research
Experience with the execution of research projects
Quality according to the customer
Professional development
Carrying out assignments within the set time
Working according to established agreements, rules and procedures
Writing of scientific publications


Competencies


Strong team player with the ability to collaborate effectively with colleagues from diverse backgrounds.
Resilient and able to thrive in high-pressure situations.
Proactive in taking initiative and focused on both personal and professional growth.
Goal-oriented with a strong drive to achieve and exceed objectives.
Client-focused, with a commitment to delivering exceptional service and satisfaction.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to convey ideas clearly and effectively.
Forward-thinking and proactive in identifying and addressing needs.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen attention to detail.


We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone feels valued and empowered. We encourage candidates of all backgrounds to apply and join our dynamic team.

Benefits

We offer our employees a comprehensive benefits package that focuses on what matters to you – health and well-being, personal finances, professional development, and a healthy work/life balance:


Competitive salary
Attractive pension scheme
Positive working atmosphere with committed colleagues and an enthusiastic management team.
Flexible working hours and the possibility to work partly from home and more
Show more
