Title: Software Developer
HTML:
OneThird is op zoek naar een Software Developer!


Als Software Developer bij OneThird werk je nauw samen met onze junior ontwikkelaar en softwaretester. Daarnaast neem je deel aan agile-ceremonies om user stories in te schatten, acceptatiecriteria te beoordelen en sprint-reviews te doen. We maken gebruik van CI/CD-pipelines in Azure DevOps en gebruiken dit platform ook voor versiebeheer en het schrijven en volgen van user stories.


Wat ga je o.a. doen:

  • Deelname aan code reviews, ontwerpsessies en taakverdelingen;
  • Implementeren van geautomatiseerde unit-testcases rondom je code;
  • Ontwerpen en adviseren van softwarearchitecturen;
  • Schrijven van ontwerpdocumenten voor nieuwe projecten;
  • Plannen en beheren van projecten, inclusief taken en middelen, met behulp van een projectmanagementtool.


Wat we je bieden

  • Een uitstekend salaris, op basis van opleiding en ervaring;
  • Een aandelenoptieplan en 25 vakantiedagen (op basis van een fulltime contract);
  • Flexibele werktijden en volop groeikansen binnen een snelgroeiend bedrijf.


Wat we van je verwachten

  • Een hbo diploma in bijvoorbeeld Informatica of een vergelijkbare studie;
  • Ervaring met .NET Core (C#) en .NET Core MVC;
  • Ervaring met o.a. SQL en Xamarin Forms;
  • Ervaring met webontwikkeling (HTML, CSS, JavaScript);
  • Minimaal 3 jaar relevante werkervaring als Developer of in een vergelijkbare rol.

Title: Data Scientist - Marketing Insights
Description:
At Catawiki, every day brings the extraordinary! Whether it’s , a , or , we encounter exceptional objects every day.




We're a one-of-a-kind marketplace for buying and selling special objects! Each week we offer over 75,000 unique items in auction, carefully curated by our passionate in-house experts.




Having sold over 20 million unique objects to date, we’re on a mission to become the world’s most popular destination for special objects. As a growing, diverse and sustainable scale-up, we proudly live by our core values:





Taking ownership and driving impact


Being open to change and feedback


Being passionate about our mission and our customers.





If these values resonate with you, we’d love to explore how you can join us on this exciting journey!


About the role and team


With thousands of active lots every day, hundreds of thousands of daily bids, millions of users, and billions of events, the Catawiki platform generates vast amounts of data every day. All this data is being collected and stored, and used extensively by our team of 19 data scientists and engineers that want to build a better company by using data in a smart way. At Catawiki, we believe in using data for making decisions, and the Data Science & Analytics team plays a central role in that.




We are looking for a Data Scientist - Marketing Insights to work with our Marketing team and leverage data to measure success of our marketing strategies and campaigns to find opportunities to attract more people on Catawiki.




You will be part of the Data Science Commercial Insights Team helping us make sense of our data, finding actionable insights and creating self-service opportunities by combining data from multiple sources and working closely together with your colleagues in other departments.


What You'll Do



You will collaborate with cross-functional Marketing teams, and will own analytics for an entire team or multiple (Paid-search, CRM, Brand etc), developing strong relationships with your stakeholders and proactively identifying growth opportunities through your deep understanding of Catawiki’s trends.


On a daily basis, you will be on top of all of Catawiki’s data, and you will work with Marketing to develop or identify metrics that measure the business impact of Marketing initiatives.


To drive data-informed decisions, you will leverage advanced analytics techniques such as regression analysis, causal inference, and experimentation (e.g., A/B testing) to understand user behaviour, identify actionable insights, and evaluate the effectiveness of new features.


You will identify and implement data self-service opportunities to enable Marketing teams to make decisions at scale.


You will be part of the Data team where you will also get an opportunity to work on multiple foundational data topics, such as building scalable data pipelines, improving data accessibility across the company or enabling new tracking frameworks (server-side tagging etc).



Who You Are



A Data Scientist / Business Analyst / Data Analytics Engineer with a strong quantitative background and at least 3 years of relevant experience (ideally in an online company)


You are not afraid of handling large volumes of data and are able to maintain complex data pipelines


You are an SQL Ninja


Fluent in either R or Python


You are also skilled in data visualisation tools (Looker Studio, Tableau, Power BI etc)


You have experience with Web and App analytics and tracking tools (GA/GTM)


Proven ability to extract meaning from large datasets with little engineering support


Experience with A/B experimentation and data transformation tools (dbt, Dataform etc) is a plus


With examples from your own experience you can demonstrate a strong focus on deriving actionable business insights from your analyses


You have strong communication skills and are able to work at a fast pace with business owners, engineers and management


An entrepreneurial mindset that enables you to get things done, also if that requires actions outside your own area or comfort zone



Where You’ll Be


This role is based in our Amsterdam office, in the Netherlands.


Why You'll Love Working with Us



Create a Visible Impact by working at scale in a global organisation that serves millions of customers across 80+ categories. In our flat structure, every role has a broad scope that directly impacts both our customers and the business.


Learn and Grow with Us through our Learning & Development initiatives, which include clear development plans and mentorship programmes designed to support your career progression.


A Culture of Connection defines us. We’re a passionate, diverse and collaborative team of 800+ Catawikains and 60+ nationalities, all coming together to build a one-of-a-kind marketplace. We foster an inclusive and queer-friendly work environment, committed to making every Catawikian feel welcomed and empowered. Whatever your story, we encourage you to bring your unique perspective to our team.


Celebrate Life’s Moments with us at Catawiki. When you join us, you’ll receive a €100 Catavoucher, and on each birthday, you'll get a €50 Catavoucher to celebrate. Enjoy an extra day off each year to "Pursue Your Passion". We also recognise significant work anniversaries (3, 5, 8, 10 years) with additional time off, plus extra leave for life’s big moments like marriage, engagements, or moving house.





Please note that benefits can vary by location. For specific information regarding what’s available in your country, please consult your recruiter.


Our Offices and Way of Working


Our vibrant offices in Amsterdam, Paris and Lisbon are designed to inspire and connect. Most Catawikians are within commuting distance of one of our offices and enjoy the flexibility of a hybrid work model. This means we typically ask you to be in the office 2 out of 5 days, roughly 40% of your working time, to collaborate and connect with your colleagues. Of course, if the job description specifies that the role is 100% remote—such as for certain expert or sales positions—then that arrangement will apply.


Interested?


Apply directly with an English CV and cover letter by submitting your information at the bottom of this page. By submitting your application you agree to .




If you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Show more
HTML:
At Catawiki, every day brings the extraordinary! Whether it’s , a , or , we encounter exceptional objects every day.


We're a one-of-a-kind marketplace for buying and selling special objects! Each week we offer over 75,000 unique items in auction, carefully curated by our passionate in-house experts.


Having sold over 20 million unique objects to date, we’re on a mission to become the world’s most popular destination for special objects. As a growing, diverse and sustainable scale-up, we proudly live by our core values:



  • Taking ownership and driving impact

  • Being open to change and feedback

  • Being passionate about our mission and our customers.


If these values resonate with you, we’d love to explore how you can join us on this exciting journey!


About the role and team

With thousands of active lots every day, hundreds of thousands of daily bids, millions of users, and billions of events, the Catawiki platform generates vast amounts of data every day. All this data is being collected and stored, and used extensively by our team of 19 data scientists and engineers that want to build a better company by using data in a smart way. At Catawiki, we believe in using data for making decisions, and the Data Science & Analytics team plays a central role in that.


We are looking for a Data Scientist - Marketing Insights to work with our Marketing team and leverage data to measure success of our marketing strategies and campaigns to find opportunities to attract more people on Catawiki.


You will be part of the Data Science Commercial Insights Team helping us make sense of our data, finding actionable insights and creating self-service opportunities by combining data from multiple sources and working closely together with your colleagues in other departments.


What You'll Do

  • You will collaborate with cross-functional Marketing teams, and will own analytics for an entire team or multiple (Paid-search, CRM, Brand etc), developing strong relationships with your stakeholders and proactively identifying growth opportunities through your deep understanding of Catawiki’s trends.

  • On a daily basis, you will be on top of all of Catawiki’s data, and you will work with Marketing to develop or identify metrics that measure the business impact of Marketing initiatives.

  • To drive data-informed decisions, you will leverage advanced analytics techniques such as regression analysis, causal inference, and experimentation (e.g., A/B testing) to understand user behaviour, identify actionable insights, and evaluate the effectiveness of new features.

  • You will identify and implement data self-service opportunities to enable Marketing teams to make decisions at scale.

  • You will be part of the Data team where you will also get an opportunity to work on multiple foundational data topics, such as building scalable data pipelines, improving data accessibility across the company or enabling new tracking frameworks (server-side tagging etc).


Who You Are

  • A Data Scientist / Business Analyst / Data Analytics Engineer with a strong quantitative background and at least 3 years of relevant experience (ideally in an online company)

  • You are not afraid of handling large volumes of data and are able to maintain complex data pipelines

  • You are an SQL Ninja

  • Fluent in either R or Python

  • You are also skilled in data visualisation tools (Looker Studio, Tableau, Power BI etc)

  • You have experience with Web and App analytics and tracking tools (GA/GTM)

  • Proven ability to extract meaning from large datasets with little engineering support

  • Experience with A/B experimentation and data transformation tools (dbt, Dataform etc) is a plus

  • With examples from your own experience you can demonstrate a strong focus on deriving actionable business insights from your analyses

  • You have strong communication skills and are able to work at a fast pace with business owners, engineers and management

  • An entrepreneurial mindset that enables you to get things done, also if that requires actions outside your own area or comfort zone


Where You’ll Be

This role is based in our Amsterdam office, in the Netherlands.


Why You'll Love Working with Us

  • Create a Visible Impact by working at scale in a global organisation that serves millions of customers across 80+ categories. In our flat structure, every role has a broad scope that directly impacts both our customers and the business.

  • Learn and Grow with Us through our Learning & Development initiatives, which include clear development plans and mentorship programmes designed to support your career progression.

  • A Culture of Connection defines us. We’re a passionate, diverse and collaborative team of 800+ Catawikains and 60+ nationalities, all coming together to build a one-of-a-kind marketplace. We foster an inclusive and queer-friendly work environment, committed to making every Catawikian feel welcomed and empowered. Whatever your story, we encourage you to bring your unique perspective to our team.

  • Celebrate Life’s Moments with us at Catawiki. When you join us, you’ll receive a €100 Catavoucher, and on each birthday, you'll get a €50 Catavoucher to celebrate. Enjoy an extra day off each year to "Pursue Your Passion". We also recognise significant work anniversaries (3, 5, 8, 10 years) with additional time off, plus extra leave for life’s big moments like marriage, engagements, or moving house.


Please note that benefits can vary by location. For specific information regarding what’s available in your country, please consult your recruiter.


Our Offices and Way of Working

Our vibrant offices in Amsterdam, Paris and Lisbon are designed to inspire and connect. Most Catawikians are within commuting distance of one of our offices and enjoy the flexibility of a hybrid work model. This means we typically ask you to be in the office 2 out of 5 days, roughly 40% of your working time, to collaborate and connect with your colleagues. Of course, if the job description specifies that the role is 100% remote—such as for certain expert or sales positions—then that arrangement will apply.


Interested?

Apply directly with an English CV and cover letter by submitting your information at the bottom of this page. By submitting your application you agree to .


If you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Title: Data Science & ML Programmeertrainer
Description:
Outlier helpt 's werelds meest innovatieve bedrijven bij het verbeteren van hun AI-modellen door menselijke feedback te leveren. Ben jij een ervaren software-engineer die zijn of haar expertise in codering wil inzetten om AI-modellen te trainen?

Wij werken samen met organisaties om grote taalkundige AI-modellen te trainen en helpen geavanceerde generatieve AI-modellen betere code te schrijven. De projecten bevatten meestal afgebakende, zeer gevarieerde problemen die interactie vereisen met deze modellen terwijl ze leren coderen. Er is geen eerdere ervaring met AI vereist.

Over Deze Kans

Outlier is op zoek naar getalenteerde programmeurs om te helpen bij het trainen van generatieve AI-modellen.

Deze freelance-opdracht kan volledig op afstand worden uitgevoerd en biedt flexibele werkuren, zodat je kunt werken wanneer het jou het beste uitkomt.

Jouw Mogelijke Bijdragen


Het maken en beantwoorden van vragen met betrekking tot informatica om AI-modellen te helpen trainen.
Het evalueren en rangschikken van code die door AI-modellen wordt gegenereerd.


Voorbeelden Van Gewenste Expertise


Momenteel ingeschreven voor of afgeronde bachelor- of hogere opleiding in informatica aan een gerenommeerde instelling.
Vaardigheid in een of meer van de volgende programmeertalen: Java, Python, JavaScript / TypeScript, C++, Swift, Verilog.
Het vermogen om complexe concepten vloeiend in het Nederlands uit te leggen.
Uitstekende aandacht voor detail, inclusief grammatica, interpunctie en stijlrichtlijnen.


Betaling


De huidige uurtarieven voor kernprojectwerk uitgevoerd door coderingsexperts variëren van 25 tot 50 USD.
Tarieven variëren afhankelijk van expertise, vaardigheidsbeoordeling, locatie, projectbehoeften en andere factoren. Hogere tarieven kunnen bijvoorbeeld worden aangeboden aan mensen met een doctoraat. Voor niet-kernwerk, zoals inwerkfasen of overwerk, kunnen lagere tarieven van toepassing zijn. Sommige projecten bieden ook incentivebetalingen. Bekijk de betalingsvoorwaarden voor elk project.


PLEASE NOTE: We collect, retain and use personal data for our professional business purposes, including notifying you of opportunities that may be of interest and sharing with our affiliates. We limit the personal data we collect to that which we believe is appropriate and necessary to manage applicants’ needs, provide our services, and comply with applicable laws. Any information we collect in connection with your application will be treated in accordance with the Outlier Privacy Policy and our internal policies and programs designed to protect personal data.

This is a 1099 contract opportunity on the Outlier.ai platform. Because this is a freelance opportunity, we do not offer internships, sponsorship, or employment. You must be authorized to work in your country of residence. If you are an international student, you may be able to sign up for Outlier if you are on a visa. You should contact your tax and/or immigration advisor with specific questions regarding your circumstances.
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Python Expert
Description:
Outlier helps the world’s most innovative companies improve their AI models by providing human feedback. Are you an experienced software engineer who would like to lend your coding expertise to train AI models?

We partner with organizations to train AI large language models, helping cutting-edge generative AI models write better code. Projects typically include discrete, highly variable problems that involve engaging with these models as they learn to code. There is no requirement for previous AI experience.

You must write Dutch for this specific AI training opportunity

About The Opportunity


Outlier is looking for talented coders to help train generative artificial intelligence models
This freelance opportunity is remote and hours are flexible, so you can work whenever is best for you


You may contribute your expertise by…


Crafting and answering questions related to computer science in order to help train AI models
Evaluating and ranking code generated by AI models


Examples Of Desirable Expertise


Ability to articulate complex concepts fluently in Dutch (required)
Currently enrolled in or completed a bachelor's degree or higher in computer science at a selective institution
Proficiency working with one or more of the the following languages: Java, Python, JavaScript / TypeScript, C++, Swift, and Verilog
Excellent attention to detail, including grammar, punctuation, and style guidelines


Payment


Currently, pay rates for core project work by coding experts range from USD $25 to $50 per hour.
Rates vary based on expertise, skills assessment, location, project need, and other factors. For example, higher rates may be offered to PhDs. For non-core work, such as during initial project onboarding or project overtime phases, lower rates may apply. Certain projects offer incentive payments. Please review the payment terms for each project.


PLEASE NOTE: We collect, retain and use personal data for our professional business purposes, including notifying you of opportunities that may be of interest and sharing with our affiliates. We limit the personal data we collect to that which we believe is appropriate and necessary to manage applicants’ needs, provide our services, and comply with applicable laws. Any information we collect in connection with your application will be treated in accordance with the Outlier Privacy Policy and our internal policies and programs designed to protect personal data.

This is a 1099 contract opportunity on the Outlier.ai platform. Because this is a freelance opportunity, we do not offer internships, sponsorship, or employment. You must be authorized to work in your country of residence. If you are an international student, you may be able to sign up for Outlier if you are on a visa. You should contact your tax and/or immigration advisor with specific questions regarding your circumstances.

Title: Data Science Traineeship Amsterdam
HTML:
• For Dutch-speaking candidates only (C1 level in Dutch required)

Waar de Data Analist zich richt op de inzichten die uit data gehaald kunnen worden en de Data Engineer zich focust op het technische aspect van het ophalen, structureren en integreren van de data, maakt de Data Scientist berekeningen op basis van de data om voorspellingen te kunnen doen over toekomstige ontwikkelingen in de branche of organisatie. Als Data Scientist ben je dan ook een vaardig programmeur. Daarnaast houdt een Data Scientist zich bezig met het bouwen, voorspellen en evalueren van algoritmes en beperkt hij zich niet tot het heden en verleden, maar kijkt ook naar de toekomst middels voorspellende modellen.

Wij starten ieder kwartaal een Data Science Traineeship waarin jij door specialisten met ervaring uit de praktijk opgeleid wordt tot een Data Engineer of Data Scientist.

De eerste drie maanden word je fulltime opgeleid (theorie, examens en praktijk) door professionals uit het data vakgebied. Na de opleidingsperiode begeleiden wij je richting een passende opdrachtgever in de regio van jouw woonplaats. Hiervoor ga je in gesprek met opdrachtgevers waarvoor wij je uiteraard goed voorbereiden. Je kiest uiteindelijk zelf waar je wil gaan starten. Denk hierbij aan MKB bedrijven, gemeentelijke-, zorg- en onderwijs organisaties of top 500 bedrijven als Rabobank, TNO, VDL, Alliander, ONVZ, ASR, NOC*NSF, Van Lanschot, Achmea of Gazelle. Na ruim één jaar via People X te hebben gewerkt, treed je in dienst bij de opdrachtgever en maak je weer een stap in salaris.

Functieomschrijving

Je werkzaamheden zijn uiteenlopend en inhoudelijk verschillend per opdrachtgever/branche waar je gaat werken, maar denk hierbij aan:

1

Opschonen en verwerken van ruwe data tot bruikbare data;

2

Het opzetten en inrichten van een datawarehouse;

3

Op basis van je bevindingen advies geven over de huidige en toekomstige bedrijfsvoering;

4

Herkennen van patronen in grote hoeveelheden data, om hiervoor een voorspellend algoritme te ontwikkelen (machine learning);

5

Beschrijven en visualiseren van ontdekte inzichten en voorspellingen.

Wat heeft People X jou te bieden?

1

Een traineeship van 1,5 jaar;

2

Je wordt betaald vanaf dag 1 van het traineeship en ontvangt vanaf je inzet bij een opdrachtgever tussen de € 2750,- en € 3250,- bruto per maand o.b.v. 40 uur;

3

Een specialistisch data traineeship gedoceerd door erkende (Microsoft) gecertificeerde trainers;

4

Het behalen van diverse erkende certificeringen die aansluiten op de behoefte in de markt: SQL, Power BI, Azure, Fabric, Data Science en Scrum / Agile;

5

Het behalen van vier officiële Microsoft Certified titels: Azure Fundamentals, Data Analyst Associate, Fabric Data Engineer Associate en Azure Data Scientist Associate;

6

Soft-, Business- en Vitaliteitstrainingen zodat je vanaf het begin stevig in je schoenen staat;

7

Begeleiding en coaching vanuit een persoonlijke Talent Manager die zorgt voor een goede instroom en ontwikkeling bij de opdrachtgever waar je gaat starten;

8

Baangarantie bij een toporganisatie in een branche die bij je past en uiteraard in de regio van je woonplaats;

9

Een gedegen inwerktraject door een ervaren Data specialist en een groot kennisnetwerk van (oud) trainees, trainers en specialisten waar jij op terug kunt vallen en mee kan sparren;

10

Tijdens en na het traineeship ontvang je een kilometervergoeding (€ 0,23) of een NS Businesscard;

11

Een uitgebreide pensioenregeling.

Wat vragen wij?

1

Een (bijna) afgeronde universitaire master in bijvoorbeeld Econometrie, Operations Research, Wiskunde, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science of een andere relevante technische/statistische studie;

2

Je beheerst minimaal één programmeertaal vanuit jouw studie of zelfstudie (bijvoorbeeld Python, R, Matlab of Java);

3

Ervaring met statistiek vanuit jouw studie of zelfstudie (bijvoorbeeld met SPSS, Stata etc.).

4

Daarnaast is ervaring met SQL en/of Machine Learning / Deep Learning technieken een pré;

5

Je bent leergierig, analytisch, oplossingsgericht, zelfstandig en hebt de drive om je kennis up-to-date te houden;

6

Je beschikt over goede communicatieve vaardigheden en beheerst naast de Nederlandse taal ook de Engelse taal;

7

Je bent fulltime beschikbaar vanaf de start van het traineeship. Komt dit traineeship te vroeg? Je kunt via deze vacature ook alvast solliciteren voor een van de volgende traineeships. Op de website zie je alle actuele startdata. Geef bij je sollicitatie even aan voor welk traineeship je solliciteert.

Description:
Outlier helpt 's werelds meest innovatieve bedrijven bij het verbeteren van hun AI-modellen door menselijke feedback te leveren. Ben jij een ervaren software-engineer die zijn of haar expertise in codering wil inzetten om AI-modellen te trainen?

Wij werken samen met organisaties om grote taalkundige AI-modellen te trainen en helpen geavanceerde generatieve AI-modellen betere code te schrijven. De projecten bevatten meestal afgebakende, zeer gevarieerde problemen die interactie vereisen met deze modellen terwijl ze leren coderen. Er is geen eerdere ervaring met AI vereist.

Over Deze Kans

Outlier is op zoek naar getalenteerde programmeurs om te helpen bij het trainen van generatieve AI-modellen.

Deze freelance-opdracht kan volledig op afstand worden uitgevoerd en biedt flexibele werkuren, zodat je kunt werken wanneer het jou het beste uitkomt.

Jouw Mogelijke Bijdragen


Het maken en beantwoorden van vragen met betrekking tot informatica om AI-modellen te helpen trainen.
Het evalueren en rangschikken van code die door AI-modellen wordt gegenereerd.


Voorbeelden Van Gewenste Expertise


Momenteel ingeschreven voor of afgeronde bachelor- of hogere opleiding in informatica aan een gerenommeerde instelling.
Vaardigheid in een of meer van de volgende programmeertalen: Java, Python, JavaScript / TypeScript, C++, Swift, Verilog.
Het vermogen om complexe concepten vloeiend in het Nederlands uit te leggen.
Uitstekende aandacht voor detail, inclusief grammatica, interpunctie en stijlrichtlijnen.


Betaling


De huidige uurtarieven voor kernprojectwerk uitgevoerd door coderingsexperts variëren van 25 tot 50 USD.
Tarieven variëren afhankelijk van expertise, vaardigheidsbeoordeling, locatie, projectbehoeften en andere factoren. Hogere tarieven kunnen bijvoorbeeld worden aangeboden aan mensen met een doctoraat. Voor niet-kernwerk, zoals inwerkfasen of overwerk, kunnen lagere tarieven van toepassing zijn. Sommige projecten bieden ook incentivebetalingen. Bekijk de betalingsvoorwaarden voor elk project.


PLEASE NOTE: We collect, retain and use personal data for our professional business purposes, including notifying you of opportunities that may be of interest and sharing with our affiliates. We limit the personal data we collect to that which we believe is appropriate and necessary to manage applicants’ needs, provide our services, and comply with applicable laws. Any information we collect in connection with your application will be treated in accordance with the Outlier Privacy Policy and our internal policies and programs designed to protect personal data.

This is a 1099 contract opportunity on the Outlier.ai platform. Because this is a freelance opportunity, we do not offer internships, sponsorship, or employment. You must be authorized to work in your country of residence. If you are an international student, you may be able to sign up for Outlier if you are on a visa. You should contact your tax and/or immigration advisor with specific questions regarding your circumstances.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Your challenge

Now more than ever is the time to create intelligence with lasting positive impact. Therefore we are looking for exceptional ML Engineers to join our fast growing team and accelerate businesses with intelligent technology.

The role of an ML Engineer is not the same anymore as a couple of years ago. With the AI market evolving fastly, so does the role. We don't spend a lot of our time anymore on building new ML models for example. We are consultants, work on data engineering and software engineering tasks and build ready-for-production applications for our clients.

You will mostly work with Python to solve varied Machine Learning tasks, using various frameworks such as Tensorflow, Pytorch, or HuggingFace and to help put these applications into production on the cloud in order to generate business value for our clients. ML6 delivers projects on all major cloud providers (GCP, AWS, Azure).

With(in) Your Team You Will


Be a true consultant and efficiently translate customer business needs across industries into end-to-end technical solutions
Use Python to deploy production ready pipelines and ML models on Google Cloud, AWS or Azure
Keep up with and apply state of the art ML research
Collaborate with Data- and Software Engineers, Project Managers, and clients
Contribute to your team's domain work
Take up software and data engineering tasks


Why you?

Minimum


You have a degree in a computer science or related field
Work or educational experience in software development
Work or educational experience with Machine Learning or Artificial Intelligence
Excellent verbal and written communication in English (Dutch is a plus)
Ability to provide expert advice to non-technical staff and clients
Experience with Python
Being able to work autonomously and take ownership
Flexible, curious and willing to embrace change for the better


Preferred


Version control (Git)
Contribution to open source projects
Experience with Google Cloud/AWS or Azure
Experience with data engineering


Why ML6?

We believe that money should never be the primary motivation to join ML6. We do want to attract and retain top talent and even when money is not the driver, we believe that your expertise and impact should be rewarded accordingly. We provide attractive salary packages and an optimised benefits program where we stay true to our caring and learning goals. In a nutshell, we've built a place where we truly love working, we think you will too.

View our rewarding philosophy and offerings here

Note that we are looking for multiple talents for this role over the year to accelerate their career with us.

Title: Software Engineer
HTML:
Als Software Engineer richt jij je op het ontwikkelen van PLC's. Je ontwikkelt PLC software, test I/O van machines in de productie omgeving en test FAT samen met productie medewerkers. Daarnaast richt jij je op het oplossen van elektrotechnische vragen bij onze klanten. Na jouw inwerkperiode word je o.a. verantwoordelijk voor de volgende taken:


  • Het Engineren van PLC-applicaties in GX Works3, HMI en SCADA;
  • Ontwikkelen van applicaties in IX Developer ten behoeve van GUI;
  • Actief bijdragen aan standaardisering van het huidige/toekomstige installaties;
  • Analyseren 3D modellen ten behoeve van de ontwikkeling van de software;
  • Rapporteren over het verloop van projecten, in lijn met planning;
  • Ondersteuning service departement, initieel op locatie.


Jouw achtergrond

Je hebt een afgeronde relevante MBO- of HBO opleiding in een technische richting en een passie voor techniek en/of machines. Je bent bekend met PLC-gestuurde systemen (software) of hebt de wens om je hierin verder te ontwikkelen. Het is voor jou geen probleem om een functioneel ontwerp te lezen en om te zetten naar een PLC / HMI software. Daarnaast kun je elektrotechnische schema's lezen en beheers je zowel de Nederlandse als Engelse taal goed, in woord en geschrift. Ervaring met de programma's GX Works3 en IX Developer is een grote pré.


Waarom je bij ons wilt werken ..

Werken bij Innovatec betekent werken met plezier en passie. Door de ruimte te krijgen om zelf met ideeën te komen en ze uit te voeren, halen we het beste naar boven in onze mensen.

Daarom voelt ons team zich betrokken bij de organisatie en zijn wij trots op ons werk. Deze trots leidt tot betere processen en tevreden klanten. En daar staan we voor! Uiteraard is dit nog niet alles en bieden wij je de volgende arbeidsvoorwaarden:

  • Een veelzijdige functie voor 40 uur per week (32 of 36 uur is bespreekbaar);
  • Een salaris dat past bij je werkervaring en functie;
  • 27 vakantiedagen en 13 ADV- dagen (o.b.v. fulltime dienstverband)
  • De keuze om je ADV om te zetten in extra salaris;
  • Pensioen ondergebracht bij het PME;
  • Reiskostenvergoeding van € 0,23 per kilometer (boven de 10 kilometer woon/werkafstand), zonder gemaximeerd bedrag;
  • Overige arbeidsvoorwaarden uit de Metalektro CAO. Innovatec volgt deze CAO.


Enthousiast geworden!

Wij ontvangen graag jouw CV en eventuele motivatie via de sollicitatiebutton. Heb je vragen over de vacature? Neem dan contact op met onze recruiter Michael van Duivenbode via +316 83147700 of michael.vanduivenbode@innovatec.com.


Wij vullen de vacature in door middel van onze eigen wervingsinspanningen en maken geen gebruik van een wervingsbureau.

Title: Data Science Traineeship Den Bosch
HTML:
• For Dutch-speaking candidates only (C1 level in Dutch required)

Waar de Data Analist zich richt op de inzichten die uit data gehaald kunnen worden en de Data Engineer zich focust op het technische aspect van het ophalen, structureren en integreren van de data, maakt de Data Scientist berekeningen op basis van de data om voorspellingen te kunnen doen over toekomstige ontwikkelingen in de branche of organisatie. Als Data Scientist ben je dan ook een vaardig programmeur. Daarnaast houdt een Data Scientist zich bezig met het bouwen, voorspellen en evalueren van algoritmes en beperkt hij zich niet tot het heden en verleden, maar kijkt ook naar de toekomst middels voorspellende modellen.

Wij starten ieder kwartaal een Data Science Traineeship waarin jij door specialisten met ervaring uit de praktijk opgeleid wordt tot een Data Engineer of Data Scientist.

De eerste drie maanden word je fulltime opgeleid (theorie, examens en praktijk) door professionals uit het data vakgebied. Na de opleidingsperiode begeleiden wij je richting een passende opdrachtgever in de regio van jouw woonplaats. Hiervoor ga je in gesprek met opdrachtgevers waarvoor wij je uiteraard goed voorbereiden. Je kiest uiteindelijk zelf waar je wil gaan starten. Denk hierbij aan MKB bedrijven, gemeentelijke-, zorg- en onderwijs organisaties of top 500 bedrijven als Rabobank, TNO, VDL, Alliander, ONVZ, ASR, NOC*NSF, Van Lanschot, Achmea of Gazelle. Na ruim één jaar via People X te hebben gewerkt, treed je in dienst bij de opdrachtgever en maak je weer een stap in salaris.

Functieomschrijving

Je werkzaamheden zijn uiteenlopend en inhoudelijk verschillend per opdrachtgever/branche waar je gaat werken, maar denk hierbij aan:

1

Opschonen en verwerken van ruwe data tot bruikbare data;

2

Het opzetten en inrichten van een datawarehouse;

3

Op basis van je bevindingen advies geven over de huidige en toekomstige bedrijfsvoering;

4

Herkennen van patronen in grote hoeveelheden data, om hiervoor een voorspellend algoritme te ontwikkelen (machine learning);

5

Beschrijven en visualiseren van ontdekte inzichten en voorspellingen.

Wat heeft People X jou te bieden?

1

Een traineeship van 1,5 jaar;

2

Je wordt betaald vanaf dag 1 van het traineeship en ontvangt vanaf je inzet bij een opdrachtgever tussen de € 2750,- en € 3250,- bruto per maand o.b.v. 40 uur;

3

Een specialistisch data traineeship gedoceerd door erkende (Microsoft) gecertificeerde trainers;

4

Het behalen van diverse erkende certificeringen die aansluiten op de behoefte in de markt: SQL, Power BI, Azure, Fabric, Data Science en Scrum / Agile;

5

Het behalen van vier officiële Microsoft Certified titels: Azure Fundamentals, Data Analyst Associate, Fabric Data Engineer Associate en Azure Data Scientist Associate;

6

Soft-, Business- en Vitaliteitstrainingen zodat je vanaf het begin stevig in je schoenen staat;

7

Begeleiding en coaching vanuit een persoonlijke Talent Manager die zorgt voor een goede instroom en ontwikkeling bij de opdrachtgever waar je gaat starten;

8

Baangarantie bij een toporganisatie in een branche die bij je past en uiteraard in de regio van je woonplaats;

9

Een gedegen inwerktraject door een ervaren Data specialist en een groot kennisnetwerk van (oud) trainees, trainers en specialisten waar jij op terug kunt vallen en mee kan sparren;

10

Tijdens en na het traineeship ontvang je een kilometervergoeding (€ 0,23) of een NS Businesscard;

11

Een uitgebreide pensioenregeling.

Wat vragen wij?

1

Een (bijna) afgeronde universitaire master in bijvoorbeeld Econometrie, Operations Research, Wiskunde, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science of een andere relevante technische/statistische studie;

2

Je beheerst minimaal één programmeertaal vanuit jouw studie of zelfstudie (bijvoorbeeld Python, R, Matlab of Java);

3

Ervaring met statistiek vanuit jouw studie of zelfstudie (bijvoorbeeld met SPSS, Stata etc.).

4

Daarnaast is ervaring met SQL en/of Machine Learning / Deep Learning technieken een pré;

5

Je bent leergierig, analytisch, oplossingsgericht, zelfstandig en hebt de drive om je kennis up-to-date te houden;

6

Je beschikt over goede communicatieve vaardigheden en beheerst naast de Nederlandse taal ook de Engelse taal;

7

Je bent fulltime beschikbaar vanaf de start van het traineeship. Komt dit traineeship te vroeg? Je kunt via deze vacature ook alvast solliciteren voor een van de volgende traineeships. Op de website zie je alle actuele startdata. Geef bij je sollicitatie even aan voor welk traineeship je solliciteert.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
At Peaks we're looking for a Data Scientist to join our team.

Do you thrive on analyzing marketing data to unlock valuable insights? Are you passionate about saving, investing, and driving customer engagement? Do you want to make an impact in a fast-growing international scale-up? If so, keep reading—Peaks might be your perfect match!

As a marketing data expert, you’ll optimize ad performance, build attribution models, ensure seamless data integration, refine customer segmentation, and enable impactful A/B testing. You'll play a key role in improving our marketing data architecture with a focus on cost efficiency, speed, and best engineering practices.

About Peaks

We’re Peaks, a fast growing, innovative Dutch fintech scale-up on a mission to help 1 million Europeans build wealth with investing and feel better about their financial future.

Since the launch of our app in November 2017 we have grown to one of the largest investment platforms in The Netherlands and Germany and serve more than 100.000 customers.

We serve these customers with a team of 40 very ambitious talents. To help Peaks fulfil its mission and growth ambitions, we are looking for a (Marketing) Data Scientist.

What you will be doing

You will play a key role in driving our business growth by managing the end-to-end process of data ingestion, modeling, and publication. Your responsibilities will include designing and maintaining scalable data solutions, defining meaningful success metrics, and empowering non-technical team members with user-friendly, self-service analytics tools. You will have to identify and implement solution to optimize ad networks performance and boost conversion rates throughout the sales funnel.


Ad Performance Analysis: Create dashboards and reports to measure ad effectiveness, ROAS, CAC, CAC-payback period, CLV.
Marketing Attribution: Build models to track customer journeys across multiple channels (e.g., last-click, multi-touch attribution).
Data Integration: Ensure marketing platforms (Google Ads, Meta Ads, CRM, etc.) receive accurate and up-to-date data through ETL/ELT pipelines. You identify improvements and spot tracking issues on app and web across all our acquisition channels.
Customer Segmentation & Audiences: Transform raw data into structured customer profiles, enabling targeted campaigns and lookalike audiences.
Experimentation & A/B Testing: Provide clean datasets for measuring the impact of different marketing strategies.
Improving our architecture based on what brings the most impact to cost reduction and speed, applying software engineering best practices


What you will need to apply


At least 5 years of engineering experience with an analytical mindset
Solid understanding of architectures, design principles and engineering best practices
Experience across all stages of the data pipeline: ingestion, transformations, mart creation
In-depth technical knowledge of advertising technologies such as Appsflyer, Meta, Google & other
Experience with our tech stack is a bonus: S3/Redshift/MySQL/Python/Go/Rust
Knowledge of unit growth metrics
Live in The Netherlands (Peaks is located in the heart of Amsterdam)


What we offer you


A good salary complemented by the chance to share in our success through our employee stock ownership program
The opportunity to develop yourself quickly within an ambitious and results driven fintech scale-up
No bureaucratic hassle: a flatter than flat organization and no-nonsense culture;
An international environment with a great team of very talented people
An office in a prime location in the center of Amsterdam


Why you should apply Now

Our culture rewards ownership, excellence, and high energy. We care deeply about outcomes and hold each other accountable - we’re here to win and fix one of the largest challenges Europeans face - closing the pension gap and democratising wealth. If this gets you fired up, reach out!
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Python Expert
Description:
Outlier helps the world’s most innovative companies improve their AI models by providing human feedback. Are you an experienced software engineer who would like to lend your coding expertise to train AI models?

We partner with organizations to train AI large language models, helping cutting-edge generative AI models write better code. Projects typically include discrete, highly variable problems that involve engaging with these models as they learn to code. There is no requirement for previous AI experience.

You must write Dutch for this specific AI training opportunity

About The Opportunity


Outlier is looking for talented coders to help train generative artificial intelligence models
This freelance opportunity is remote and hours are flexible, so you can work whenever is best for you


You may contribute your expertise by…


Crafting and answering questions related to computer science in order to help train AI models
Evaluating and ranking code generated by AI models


Examples Of Desirable Expertise


Ability to articulate complex concepts fluently in Dutch (required)
Currently enrolled in or completed a bachelor's degree or higher in computer science at a selective institution
Proficiency working with one or more of the the following languages: Java, Python, JavaScript / TypeScript, C++, Swift, and Verilog
Excellent attention to detail, including grammar, punctuation, and style guidelines


Payment


Currently, pay rates for core project work by coding experts range from USD $25 to $50 per hour.
Rates vary based on expertise, skills assessment, location, project need, and other factors. For example, higher rates may be offered to PhDs. For non-core work, such as during initial project onboarding or project overtime phases, lower rates may apply. Certain projects offer incentive payments. Please review the payment terms for each project.


PLEASE NOTE: We collect, retain and use personal data for our professional business purposes, including notifying you of opportunities that may be of interest and sharing with our affiliates. We limit the personal data we collect to that which we believe is appropriate and necessary to manage applicants’ needs, provide our services, and comply with applicable laws. Any information we collect in connection with your application will be treated in accordance with the Outlier Privacy Policy and our internal policies and programs designed to protect personal data.

This is a 1099 contract opportunity on the Outlier.ai platform. Because this is a freelance opportunity, we do not offer internships, sponsorship, or employment. You must be authorized to work in your country of residence. If you are an international student, you may be able to sign up for Outlier if you are on a visa. You should contact your tax and/or immigration advisor with specific questions regarding your circumstances.

PLEASE NOTE: We collect, retain and use personal data for our professional business purposes, including notifying you of opportunities that may be of interest and sharing with our affiliates. We limit the personal data we collect to that which we believe is appropriate and necessary to manage applicants’ needs, provide our services, and comply with applicable laws. Any information we collect in connection with your application will be treated in accordance with the Outlier Privacy Policy and our internal policies and programs designed to protect personal data.

This is a 1099 contract opportunity on the Outlier.ai platform. Because this is a freelance opportunity, we do not offer internships, sponsorship, or employment. You must be authorized to work in your country of residence. If you are an international student, you may be able to sign up for Outlier if you are on a visa. You should contact your tax and/or immigration advisor with specific questions regarding your circumstances.

Title: Machine Learning Python Expert
Description:
Outlier helps the world’s most innovative companies improve their AI models by providing human feedback. Are you an experienced software engineer who would like to lend your coding expertise to train AI models?

We partner with organizations to train AI large language models, helping cutting-edge generative AI models write better code. Projects typically include discrete, highly variable problems that involve engaging with these models as they learn to code. There is no requirement for previous AI experience.

You must write Dutch for this specific AI training opportunity

About The Opportunity


Outlier is looking for talented coders to help train generative artificial intelligence models
This freelance opportunity is remote and hours are flexible, so you can work whenever is best for you


You may contribute your expertise by…


Crafting and answering questions related to computer science in order to help train AI models
Evaluating and ranking code generated by AI models


Examples Of Desirable Expertise


Ability to articulate complex concepts fluently in Dutch (required)
Currently enrolled in or completed a bachelor's degree or higher in computer science at a selective institution
Proficiency working with one or more of the the following languages: Java, Python, JavaScript / TypeScript, C++, Swift, and Verilog
Excellent attention to detail, including grammar, punctuation, and style guidelines


Payment


Currently, pay rates for core project work by coding experts range from USD $25 to $50 per hour.
Rates vary based on expertise, skills assessment, location, project need, and other factors. For example, higher rates may be offered to PhDs. For non-core work, such as during initial project onboarding or project overtime phases, lower rates may apply. Certain projects offer incentive payments. Please review the payment terms for each project.

Title: Vehicle Software Engineer - Over-the-Air (OTA) Update (F/M/D)
Description:
IF YOU MAKE HEARTS BEAT FASTER, YOUR OWN HAS TO BE IN THE RIGHT PLACE.




Vehicle Software Engineer - Over-the-Air (OTA) Update (F/M/D)




Wherever dream cars are built, dream jobs are never far away. Join our team to develop digital products that make our cars even more exciting.

We are looking for a Vehicle Software Engineer, who will push the implementation of successful Over-the-Air (OTA) update campaigns. To ensure a smooth and seamless digital experience, we are currently building a team of experts operating and continuously improving Over-the-Air Functionalities upfront with our customers. As the Vehicle Software Engineer, you will be based in Ludwigsburg, Germany and will be responsible for the successful execution of OTA update campaigns and continuous improvement of the whole system from a vehicle perspective. Your involvement will span across all aspects of the OTA update process including planning, preparation, testing, monitoring, problem-solving, and implementation. We strive for continuous improvement, so from the first day, we want you to think big and find the best solutions to operate that process sustainably and feasibly.




The OTA Team is part of our Portfolio Vehicle. Within this Portfolio we work in cross-functional product teams across the globe, to develop premium customized Porsche services that are integrated seamlessly into the existing digital life of our customers. Global collaboration and synergies based on lean and data-driven processes are key to our success.




If you are not only in for the quick fix but like to get to the bottom of interesting technical challenges, and you are keen on being around exciting cars, then Porsche Digital is the right place for you.




WHAT YOUR TASKS ARE

Some years of professional experience in the field of automotive electronics or software development in an automotive context
Strong technical background with experience in projects for OTA software updates and OTA functionalities in general
Knowledge of vehicle diagnostics including flashing and configuration of vehicle software
Experience with managing complex sets and sources of data, as well as extracting and analyzing vehicle logs and traces
Hands-on experience with Porsche testing equipment, processes, and diagnostic systems is a plus
E/E architecture and & in-vehicle network know-how will be an advantage
Flexibility to work both independently as a pro-active problem solver as well as collaborate in a cross-functional team to deliver on a common goal
Strong analytical and conceptual skills combined with the ability to quickly grasp complex issues
Strong communication and organizational skills
Fluent in German & English




OUR BENEFITS

Competitive payment
Thirty days of paid vacation
Referral bonuses for bringing new talent on board
Flexible working model (you and your team decide when to be in the office)
Food allowance for Speisewerk (Ludwigsburg)
Access to our corporate benefits
Company pension scheme
Mobility leasing option (e.g. Jobrad, VW Leasing)
A subsidy for your VVS / BVG ticket
Modern working environment
Dog-friendly Office
Regular surveys to measure your happiness at Porsche Digital
Personal growth budget




WHAT COMES NEXT




If you've made it this far, don't keep us waiting. Get started - apply directly!

In the meantime: Check out our new Porsche Digital Website to get an impression of what our hearts beat for: https://www.porsche.digital

We are looking forward to every unique application that reaches us. Because diversity is just as important as the energy that flows through our veins.

Show more

Title: Frontend Developer – Stuttgart
Description:
Frontend Developer – Fintech Start Up – Stuttgart, Germany




(Tech stack: Front End Developer, JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3, Angular, KnockoutJS, BackboneJS, React, Angular, VueJS, jQuery Typescript, Web, UI, UX, User Interface, User Experience, Front End Developer)




We have several fantastic new roles for Front End Developer to join an ambitious Fintech start-up. This is your chance to work with the sharpest minds in private wealth management and financial software development. Our client’s latest product release has changed the way people view private wealth management and allowed them to provide their clients with an individualised, scalable asset management framework that is unrivalled in today’s market place.




It takes a team to make things happen and this team includes some of the most talented Front End Developer (JavaScript, jQuery, Angular) in the industry. This is your opportunity to be part of a new, technically challenging project and to be involved in the creation of a new application from scratch. FinTech is booming and our client are fast becoming a leader of this market!




They are looking for Front End Developer with experience in some or all of the following (full training will be provided to fill any gaps in your skill set): JavaScript, LESS, SASS, ES6, HTML5, CSS3, Angular, KnockoutJS, BackboneJS, React, VueJS, jQuery, Typescript and AJAX.




All Front-End Developer positions come with the following benefits:

Shares in the company.
Pension scheme (8%).
3 hours ‘free time’ each week to investigate new technologies.
An annual training allowance of CHF 4.5k.
30 days holiday (excluding Bank Holidays) plus your birthday off.
Flexible working hours.
Work from home.
Pizza and beer Fridays.
Access to free yoga classes which take place over lunch or after work in their fitness studio.




It’s an incredible opportunity so if you’re interested, act and apply today!




Location: Stuttgart , Germany / Remote Working




Salary: €90,000 - €110,000 + Bonus + Pension + Benefits




NOIREURGENSP1

NOIRGERMANYREC

NOIREUROPEREC




NC/HT/STU9010

Title: Machine Learning Developer (all genders)
Company: MSG Food ام اس جي الغذائية
Description:
Braunschweig, Ismaning bei München, Stuttgart
Vollzeit
unbefristet


Teile diesen Job!

Jetzt bewerben!

Spannende IT-Projekte, attraktive Karrierechancen, Kontinuität, Sicherheit und Nachhaltigkeit – das alles findest du bei uns. Denn als unabhängige international agierende Unternehmensgruppe mit weltweit mehr als 10.000 Mitarbeitenden sind wir in vielen dynamischen Märkten aktiv und unterstützen unsere Kunden als starker Partner bei der digitalen Transformation.

Mit unserer Expertise in der Automotive-IT gestalten wir die Mobilität der Zukunft. Unsere agilen Teams arbeiten an wegweisenden Projekten – von autonomem Fahren bis hin zu datengetriebenen Prozessen. Wir bieten maßgeschneiderte Lösungen für die Herausforderungen unserer Kunden und schaffen damit spannende Möglichkeiten für deine berufliche Entwicklung in einem zukunftsorientierten Umfeld.

Das erwartet dich bei uns


Entwicklung und Implementierung von KI-Lösungen: Du arbeitest an anspruchsvollen Projekten und bringst deine Kreativität und technisches Wissen ein. Du setzt innovative KI-Ansätze wie Generative AI (GenAI) und Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) Architekturen um
Integration und Optimierung von ML-Modellen: Du integrierst ML-Modelle in verschiedene Anwendungen und passt sie flexibel an die spezifischen Anforderungen der Automobilindustrie an, einschließlich cloudbasierter Lösungen
Cloud-Technologien und Plattformen: Du setzt moderne Cloud-Dienste wie Azure und AWS ein, um skalierbare und performante KI-Lösungen zu entwickeln. Kenntnisse in Machine Learning Services und Infrastruktur auf diesen Plattformen sind von Vorteil
Projektbegleitung für innovative KI-Lösungen: Du arbeitest lösungsorientiert und hältst den Fokus auf die Bedürfnisse unserer Kunden
Monitoring und MLOps-Prinzipien: Du überwachst Modellleistung und sorgst strategisch für Qualität und Effizienz
Zusammenarbeit mit Fachteams und Kunden: Im Austausch mit interdisziplinären Teams sowie unseren Kunden trägst du zu einem reibungslosen Projektverlauf bei. Deine Kommunikations- und Teamfähigkeiten sind entscheidend, um Ideen gemeinsam weiterzuentwickeln und erfolgreiche Ergebnisse zu erzielen


Das bringst du mit


Du hast ein Studium in Informatik, Physik oder Mathematik abgeschlossen, idealerweise mit einem Fokus auf KI/ML
Du bringst Erfahrung in der Entwicklung von KI-Lösungen mit, vorzugsweise im Automotive-Bereich
Du hast Kenntnisse im Entwurf und der Umsetzung von Pipelines für Model Evaluation und Deployment und idealerweise Erfahrung mit Tools wie MLFlow
Du bringst fundierte Erfahrung in der Softwareentwicklung mit, vor allem in Java und CI/CD-Pipelines, und bist offen für neue Technologien und sich ändernde Anforderungen
Du bringst Erfahrung im Monitoring von ML-Modellen sowie Grundkenntnisse in MLOps, LLMOps und generativer KI mit Erfahrungen mit Spark und Cloud-Technologien sind von Vorteil
Zertifizierung bei Azure oder AWS im Bereich AI sind von Vorteil
Du arbeitest gerne in internationalen Softwareentwicklungsteams und kommunizierst sicher in Deutsch und Englisch


Von uns für dich – deine Benefits

Gelebte Kultur "Mensch im Mittelpunkt"

Nachhaltige Projekte & Soziales Engagement

Förderung von Diversität & Chancengleichheit

Vertrauensvoller Teamspirit & Gestaltungsfreiheit

Passgenaue Weiterentwicklung & Mentoring

Flexibles Arbeiten & Work-Life Integration

Corporate Benefits

Mobiles Arbeiten

Deine Ansprechperson Bei Rückfragen

Isabell Putensen

Recruiting

recruiting-automotive@msg.group

Referenznummer: 2024-0171

Wir sind vielfältig

… und begrüßen alle Bewerbungen - unabhängig von Herkunft, Behinderung, Nationalität, Religion, Alter, Geschlecht sowie sexueller Orientierung und Identität. Vielfalt macht uns als Team stark – werde ein Teil davon!

Mehr erfahren!

Title: Data Scientist Praktikant*in - Vehicle Recommendations (m/w/d)
Description:
Life is always about becoming… Im Leben geht es darum, sich auf eine Reise zu begeben, um die beste Version unseres zukünftigen Selbst zu werden. Während wir Neues entdecken, stellen wir uns Herausforderungen, meistern sie und wachsen über uns hinaus.

Bewerben Sie sich bei Mercedes-Benz und finden Sie den Aufgabenbereich, in dem Sie Ihre Talente individuell entfalten können. Dabei werden Sie von visionären Kolleginnen und Kollegen unterstützt, die Ihren Pioniergeist teilen. Bei uns einzusteigen bedeutet, Teil eines globalen Teams zu werden, dessen Ziel es ist, die begehrenswertesten Automobile der Welt zu bauen. Together for excellence.

Stellennummer: V000060896

Aufgaben

Leidenschaft für Technologie, Begeisterung für Innovationen

Wir entwickeln technologische Innovationen, digitale Produkte und zukunftsweisende Software-Lösungen exklusiv für Mercedes-Benz. Wir setzen neue Standards im Bereich Car Connectivity sowie der Digitalisierung von Fahrzeug und Vertrieb. Mit über 1.400 Mitarbeiter*innen in Ulm, Stuttgart, Berlin und Karlsruhe sowie in unserem Projekt-Hub in Kuala Lumpur sind wir nicht nur ein vertrauenswürdiger Partner und strategischer Verbündeter, sondern auch die größte Software-Entwicklungstochter des Konzerns. Was uns dabei verbindet? Unsere Begeisterung für Innovationen, die Leidenschaft für moderne Technologie, ein agiles Mindset und das klare Ziel vor Augen: die Transformation von Mercedes-Benz zu „100% digital“.

Welche Aufgaben erwarten dich?


Zu deinen Aufgaben gehört es, große Datenmengen zu analysieren, um Muster und Trends zu identifizieren.
Dabei ist es wichtig, relevante Informationen aus den Daten herauszufiltern und zu interpretieren.
Du bist dafür verantwortlich, Machine Learning-Algorithmen zu identifizieren und anzuwenden, um die Empfehlungsgenauigkeit zu verbessern.
Durch den Einsatz dieser Algorithmen kannst du präzisere und individuellere Empfehlungen generieren.
Es gehört auch zu deinen Aufgaben, Berichte und Präsentationen zu erstellen, um die Ergebnisse deiner Analysen und Optimierungen darzustellen.


Profil

Wie passt du in unser Team?


Du befindest dich in einem laufenden Studium der Informatik, Data Science, Mathematik, Statistik oder einem ähnlichen Studiengang.
Du besitzt Grundkenntnisse in Programmiersprachen wie beispielsweise Python.
Du verfügst über grundlegende Kenntnisse im Einsatz von Machine-Learning-Algorithmen.
Analytisches Denkvermögen und Problemlösungsfähigkeiten zeichnen dich aus.
Du hast Interesse an der Automobilindustrie und neuen Technologien.
Gute Kommunikationsfähigkeiten und Teamgeist zählen zu deinen Stärken.
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse runden dein Profil ab.

Title: AI Development Specialist
Description:
Outlier helps the world’s most innovative companies improve their AI models by providing human feedback. Are you an experienced software engineer who would like to lend your coding expertise to train AI models?

We partner with organizations to train AI large language models, helping cutting-edge generative AI models write better code. Projects typically include discrete, highly variable problems that involve engaging with these models as they learn to code. There is no requirement for previous AI experience.

You must write German for this specific AI training opportunity

About The Opportunity


Outlier is looking for talented coders that also speak German to help train generative artificial intelligence models
This freelance opportunity is remote and hours are flexible, so you can work whenever is best for you


You may contribute your expertise by…


Crafting and answering questions related to computer science in order to help train AI models
Evaluating and ranking code generated by AI models


Examples Of Desirable Expertise


Ability to articulate complex concepts fluently in German (required)
Currently enrolled in or completed a bachelor's degree or higher in computer science at a selective institution
Proficiency working with one or more of the the following languages: Java, Python, JavaScript / TypeScript, C++, Swift, and Verilog
Excellent attention to detail, including grammar, punctuation, and style guidelines


Payment


Currently, pay rates for core project work by coding experts range from USD $25 to $50 per hour.
Rates vary based on expertise, skills assessment, location, project need, and other factors. For example, higher rates may be offered to PhDs. For non-core work, such as during initial project onboarding or project overtime phases, lower rates may apply. Certain projects offer incentive payments. Please review the payment terms for each project.


PLEASE NOTE: We collect, retain and use personal data for our professional business purposes, including notifying you of opportunities that may be of interest and sharing with our affiliates. We limit the personal data we collect to that which we believe is appropriate and necessary to manage applicants’ needs, provide our services, and comply with applicable laws. Any information we collect in connection with your application will be treated in accordance with the Outlier Privacy Policy and our internal policies and programs designed to protect personal data.

This is a 1099 contract opportunity on the Outlier.ai platform. Because this is a freelance opportunity, we do not offer internships, sponsorship, or employment. You must be authorized to work in your country of residence. If you are an international student, you may be able to sign up for Outlier if you are on a visa. You should contact your tax and/or immigration advisor with specific questions regarding your circumstances.

Title: (Junior) Cloud Engineer (gn)
Description:
About

Die Schwarz IT betreut die gesamte digitale Infrastruktur und alle Softwarelösungen der Unternehmen der Schwarz Gruppe. Sie ist somit für Auswahl, Bereitstellung und Betrieb sowie Weiterentwicklung von IT-Infrastrukturen, IT-Plattformen und Business-Anwendungen zuständig. Um die Fachbereiche durch IT-Lösungen optimal bei deren Geschäftsprozessen zu unterstützen, nimmt die Schwarz IT die Anforderungen der Fachbereiche in Beratungsgesprächen auf und erarbeitet gemeinsam mit diesen professionelle und leistungsfähige IT-Lösungen.

Deine Aufgaben


Du gestaltest die Systemlandschaft für das modernisierte Warenwirtschaftssystem von Lidl und ihre zugehörigen Dienste
Du betreust und betreibst nicht nur die verschiedenen Kernkomponenten unserer Cloud-Plattform (z.B. Kubernetes, Messaging und Datenbank), sondern bist auch maßgeblich an der Weiterentwicklung dieser beteiligt
Du bringst unsere Cloud- Plattform voran - von der Konzeption über die Umsetzung/Validierung bis zur Produktreife bist du Teil des "Großen Ganzen"
Du führst Problem- und Fehleranalysen durch und identifizierst nachhaltige Lösungen




Dein Profil


Du hast dein Studium der (Wirtschafts-) Informatik oder eine vergleichbare Berufsausbildung mit IT-Schwerpunkt erfolgreich abgeschlossen
Du hast erste Erfahrung im Aufbau von Cloud Services
Du bist im Umgang mit DevOps- / IaC- / CI/CD-Tools vertraut
Du zeichnest dich durch hohes und kontinuierliches Interesse an neuen Cloud-Themen aus und bringst deine dazugewonnenen Kenntnisse/Ideen gerne im Team ein
Du verfügst über (sehr) gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse




Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung!

Schwarz Dienstleistung KG


Laura Ehlbeck
Referenz-Nr. 44751 Stiftsbergstraße 1
74172 Neckarsulm www.it.schwarz


Nice-to-have skills


Cloud Services
DevOps
Kubernetes
Stuttgart, Baden-Württemberg, Germany


Work experience


DevOps
Cloud Architect


Languages


German

Title: AI/ML Operations Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
About

The High-Performance Computing Centre Stuttgart (HLRS) was founded as Germany's first federal high-performance computing (HPC) centre. It operates one of the fastest supercomputers in the world. It offers various HPC solutions and services for universities, research institutions, and industry. Furthermore, HLRS is a worldwide leader in engineering and global system sciences. Staff scientists at HLRS investigate emerging technologies such as Artificial Intelligence (AI), Cloud Computing, and Quantum Computing (QC) towards realising hybrid workflows and lowering the hurdle for non-experts using HPC technologies. In this context, HLRS is significantly involved in international and national research projects across the abovementioned research areas.

HammerHAI - The AI Factory for Industry and Science

The HammerHAI project offers to establish an AI Factory at the High-Performance Computing Center Stuttgart (HLRS), which is supported by a strong consortium from Germany, to successfully meet the growing demand for artificial intelligence (AI) infrastructure across Europe. HammerHAI will be a one-stop shop for many AI users, focusing primarily on start-ups, small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs), large industrial companies, and supporting academic institutions and the public sector. It will offer tailored services and infrastructure to accelerate AI innovation and help develop a competitive AI ecosystem in Europe. The AI Factory will be located in a region that is one of Europe-s powerhouses in manufacturing and engineering innovation, and it will be integrated into an ecosystem that promotes talent building that will be the basis of an ongoing digital transition.

The AI Factory HammerHAI will provide secure, scalable, and AI-optimised supercomputing resources to meet the needs of start-ups, SMEs, industry, and research institutions. Its infrastructure will enable users to easily migrate their AI applications from laptops or cloud environments to supercomputers, providing the computing power needed to develop large-scale AI models. Hereby, the AI Factory will support the entire AI lifecycle, from data preparation to model training, deployment, monitoring, and retraining, and will provide a comprehensive package of services to ensure efficient and effective AI development and operation.

Shaping the Future of AI in HPC

We are seeking a highly motivated AI/ML Innovation Engineer to support the deployment, monitoring, and optimization of AI infrastructure within the AI Factory HammerHAI at HLRS. This role focuses on ensuring scalable, secure, and highperformance AI services for various users, including start-ups, SMEs, industry, and research institutions. The successful candidate will work on integrating AI pipelines, deploying AI workloads in HPC environments, and developing monitoring and benchmarking frameworks. This position requires expertise in AI, ML operations, cloud-native technologies, and high-performance computing systems.

In this context, we are looking for a

AI/ML Operations Engineer

(m/f/d, up to TV-L 13, 100 %)

HLRS_09_2025

to work on HammerHAI with a strong team of AI experts in close collaboration with end users, system administrators and external stakeholders.

This is a temporary position. Employment is limited in accordance with the legal regulations up to the project's duration, which is currently scheduled to run 3 years. The salary for this position is based on your personal qualifications up to the level of TV-L 13.

Nice-to-have skills


Deep Learning
Communication
Communication
Kubernetes
Machine Learning
Engineering
OpenStack
Linux
Architecture
Computer Science
Automation
Artificial Intelligence
Machine Learning
Cloud Computing
Automation
Version Control
OpenStack
Kubernetes
Version Control
Spark
Stuttgart, Baden-Württemberg, Germany


Work experience


Machine Learning
DevOps

Languages


German

Outlier is looking for talented coders that also speak German to help train generative artificial intelligence models
This freelance opportunity is remote and hours are flexible, so you can work whenever is best for you


You may contribute your expertise by…


Crafting and answering questions related to computer science in order to help train AI models
Evaluating and ranking code generated by AI models


Examples Of Desirable Expertise


Ability to articulate complex concepts fluently in German (required)
Currently enrolled in or completed a bachelor's degree or higher in computer science at a selective institution
Proficiency working with one or more of the the following languages: Java, Python, JavaScript / TypeScript, C++, Swift, and Verilog
Excellent attention to detail, including grammar, punctuation, and style guidelines


Payment


Currently, pay rates for core project work by coding experts range from USD $25 to $50 per hour.
Rates vary based on expertise, skills assessment, location, project need, and other factors. For example, higher rates may be offered to PhDs. For non-core work, such as during initial project onboarding or project overtime phases, lower rates may apply. Certain projects offer incentive payments. Please review the payment terms for each project.


PLEASE NOTE: We collect, retain and use personal data for our professional business purposes, including notifying you of opportunities that may be of interest and sharing with our affiliates. We limit the personal data we collect to that which we believe is appropriate and necessary to manage applicants’ needs, provide our services, and comply with applicable laws. Any information we collect in connection with your application will be treated in accordance with the Outlier Privacy Policy and our internal policies and programs designed to protect personal data.

This is a 1099 contract opportunity on the Outlier.ai platform. Because this is a freelance opportunity, we do not offer internships, sponsorship, or employment. You must be authorized to work in your country of residence. If you are an international student, you may be able to sign up for Outlier if you are on a visa. You should contact your tax and/or immigration advisor with specific questions regarding your circumstances.

Outlier helps the world’s most innovative companies improve their AI models by providing human feedback. Are you an experienced software engineer who would like to lend your coding expertise to train AI models?

We partner with organizations to train AI large language models, helping cutting-edge generative AI models write better code. Projects typically include discrete, highly variable problems that involve engaging with these models as they learn to code. There is no requirement for previous AI experience.

About

STRABAG AG

Stuttgart

Vollzeit

req62937

Fortschritt beginnt mit uns.

Bei STRABAG bauen rund 86.000 Menschen an 2.400 Standorten weltweit am Fortschritt. Einzigartigkeit und individuelle Stärken kennzeichnen dabei nicht nur unsere Projekte, sondern auch jede:n Einzelne:n von uns. Ob im Hoch- und Ingenieurbau, Straßen- und Tiefbau, Brücken- und Tunnelbau, in der Projektentwicklung, Baustoffproduktion oder im Gebäudemanagement – wir denken Bauen weiter, um der innovativste und nachhaltigste Bautechnologiekonzern Europas zu werden. Chancengleichheit, Vielfalt und Inklusion sind integrale Bestandteile dessen, wer wir als Unternehmen sind und wie wir arbeiten. Gemeinsam setzen wir Vorhaben erfolgreich und partnerschaftlich um und wachsen an neuen Aufgaben. Gemeinsam erschaffen wir Großes. Bau mit uns die Zukunft!

Bewirb dich jetzt und werde Teil unseres Teams.

Die Konzerneinheit STRABAG Innovation & Digitalisation fungiert als Enabler für Digitalisierungs- und Entwicklungsprojekte. In enger Zusammenarbeit mit operativen Kolleginnen und Kollegen werden so über 400 verschiedene Innovations- und Digitalisierungsprojekte vorangetrieben.

Application Services & Data Science beschäftigt sich mit der strategischen (Weiter-)Entwicklung von Softwareprodukten sowie dem zukunftsweisenden und zielführenden Umgang mit Daten in allen Konzernbereichen. Dabei setzen wir auf eine Vielfalt von technischen und strategischen Kompetenzen sowie vielseitige Persönlichkeiten in unseren Teams. Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Bewerbung.

Aufgaben

Mit unseren Einkaufseinheiten und der IT der STRABAG SE entwickeln wir eine konzernweite Portallösung für die Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Lieferanten. Schrittweise führen wir hierbei auf Basis einer marktführenden Source-to-Pay-Lösung einen digital durchgängigen End-to-End-Prozess im Einkauf ein. Hierbei benötigen wir Ihre Unterstützung!

Ihre Aufgaben Im Einzelnen

Mitwirkung/Beratung bei der strategischen Weiterentwicklung der Software-Produkte und Prozesse im Bereich eProcurement, auch applikationsübergreifend

Eigenverantwortliche Formulierung von fachlichen Anforderungen im Kontext Purchase-to-pay und Katalogmanagement auf Basis von User Stories, Refinement, Plausibilisierung des Lösungsdesigns sowie fachliche Abnahme der Lösungen in Testphasen

Enge Zusammenarbeit mit Product Owner, Solutions Consultants und Konfiguratoren im Rahmen einer agilen Produktentwicklung (Scrum)

Erstellung der fachlichen Dokumentation und Release Notes

Ausbildung des Support-Teams sowie Unterstützung während der Hochlaufphase und im Regelbetrieb

Voraussetzungen

Abgeschlossene Berufsausbildung oder Studium in einem kaufmännischen oder (IT-) technischen Bereich

Mehrjährige Erfahrung in der digitalen Abwicklung und Betreuung von Einkaufs- und Lieferantenprozessen im Bereich Purchase-to-pay inkl. Katalogmanagement

Sicherer Umgang mit Office- und Kollaborationstools (z.B. Confluence / Jira)

Analytische und strukturierte Arbeitsweise mit hohem Qualitätsanspruch sowie gute Selbstorganisation und hohe Zuverlässigkeit

Ausgeprägte Team- und Kommunikationsfähigkeit

Freude an der Arbeit mit digitalen Werkzeugen und agilen Methoden

Verhandlungssichere Deutschkenntnisse und sehr gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift

Wir bieten

Sie haben die einmalige Möglichkeit, den neuen Zentralbereich SID - STRABAG Innovation & Digitalisation maßgeblich mitzugestalten. Es erwarten Sie spannende konzernweite Digitalisierungsprojekte, die einen wesentlichen Beitrag zum Unternehmenserfolg leisten können. Herausfordernde Aufgaben, ein innovatives Umfeld, agile Arbeitsmethoden und interessante, erfahrene Kolleg:innen blicken mit Ihnen gemeinsam über den Tellerrand hinaus.
