Title: Software Entwickler (w/m/d) für Oberflächenentwicklung
Description:
About Us

A career at Hitachi Rail will help create a legacy. With operations in every corner of the world, our work goes to the cutting-edge of digital transformation and technology. From the multi-cultural strength of our global organisation to the sustainable and innovative ways we work to bring people together, there's something for everyone to get stuck into. And that's where you come in.

Stuttgart, Baden-Württemberg, Germany (Hybrid)

Als Hitachi Rail treiben wir die Leit- und Sicherungstechnik voran, um den Bahnverkehr in Deutschland sowie international sicher und effizient zu gestalten.

Unsere Technologien helfen dabei, jedes Jahr Milliarden Menschen mit der Bahn zuverlässig an ihr Ziel zu bringen - so tragen wir einen aktiven Teil zur starken Schiene in Deutschland und weltweit bei.

Software Entwickler für Oberflächenentwicklung (m/w/d) (Ref.Nr.1004136) in Voll- oder Teilzeit an unserem Standort in Ditzingen

Dieser Verantwortung stellen Sie sich gerne:

Als Software Entwickler für Oberflächenentwicklung (m/w/d) sind Sie für die Spezifikation, die Projektierung, die Konfiguration, die Tests und für die Dokumentation sicherheitskritischer Software für Human Machine Interfaces (HMI) im Rahmen der Stellwerksentwicklung verantwortlich.

Dies beinhaltet außerdem folgende Aufgaben:



Sie analysieren die Produktdaten, konfigurieren das Produkt und führen bei den HMI-Systemen die Produkttests durch
Die Erstellung der dazugehörigen Dokumentation und die technische Unterstützung für Angebote, Projekte und für den Vertrieb gehört ebenso zu Ihrem Aufgabenbereich
Darüber hinaus unterstützen Sie bei den Feldtests und bei den Inbetriebnahmen
Abgerundet werden Ihre Aufgaben durch die Wartungs- und Serviceunterstützung



Das bringen Sie mit:



Sie haben ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Elektrotechnik, Informatik, Verkehrswesen oder vergleichbar und verfügen über gute Kenntnisse in den Scriptsprachen Perl & Python
Sie verfügen über Grundkenntnisse der Netzwerktechnik und haben i dealerweise Kenntnisse in DOORS und Erfahrung mit den CENELEC-Normen und mit Verifizierungsaktivitäten
Als Teamplayer ist für Sie eine selbstständige und eigenverantwortliche Arbeitsweise selbstverständlich, bestenfalls konnten Sie bereits Einblicke in die Eisenbahnbranche und in die Signaltechnik sammeln bzw. haben hierfür Interesse
Sie verfügen fließende Deutsch- und sehr gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift
Abgerundet wird ihr Profil durch Ihre guten Kommunikationsfähigkeiten und Ihre Kundenorientierung



Unser Talent Acquisition Team freut sich auf Ihre Kontaktaufnahme

+49 (0) 152 59 10 1539

Ioanna Sapountzi

Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Bewerbung in nur wenigen Klicks über unser Karriereportal.

Weitere Informationen zu Hitachi Rail Deutschland als Arbeitgeber finden Sie unter www.hitachirail.com/careers .

Über uns

Unsere Motivation sowie Dreh- und Angelpunkt ist die Mobilitätswende. Dafür finden unsere Teams innovative Produkte und Lösungen, die den Betrieb und die Zuverlässigkeit des gesamten Schienennetzes sicherstellen und die Kapazitäten auf den Schienen erhöhen. Das European Train Control System (ETCS) sowie unsere Stellwerkslösungen sind dabei nur wenige von vielen.

Unsere Projekte hierfür sind vielfältig. Um unsere Teams noch stärker zu machen, suchen wir nach Ihrer Unterstützung. Dafür bieten wir Ihnen ein attraktives Gesamtpaket mit den folgenden Benefits:



Zusammen stark : Vernetzung durch interne Netzwerke wie YES (Young Employee Society) oder WoMenTogether sowie Arbeiten in internationalen Teams
Unser Antrieb : Gemeinsam legen wir die Grundsteine für die Digitalisierung der Bahn-Welt in Deutschland und weltweit, um Menschen sicher ans Ziel und zu ihren Liebsten zu bringen!
Flexibles Arbeiten : Wir bieten Ihnen flexible Arbeitsmodelle wie Gleitzeit und hybrides Arbeiten
Attraktive Konditionen : Ein sicherer und unbefristeter Job bei einem globalen agierenden Unternehmen mit Tarifbindung



Bei uns werden ein offener Dialog und Transparenz aktiv gefördert und vorgelebt. Wir treten aktiv für Vielfalt ein, schaffen die nötigen Rahmenbedingungen hierfür und verpflichten uns zu einer konsequenten Förderung aller Formen der Diversität. Wir sind davon überzeugt, dass wir mit gemischten Teams die besten Ergebnisse erzielen und Chancengleichheit eine Selbstverständlichkeit ist. Unser beispielhaftes Handeln im Sinne einer an Chancengleichheit ausgerichteten Personalführung wurde mit dem TOTAL E-Quality Prädikat honoriert. Mit speziellen Programmen fördern wir Diversität & Inklusion sowie die Vereinbarkeit von Beruf und Familie und unterstützen unsere Beschäftigten beim Balanceakt zwischen ihrem Privatleben und den spannenden Herausforderungen bei Hitachi Rail.

Thank you for your interest in Hitachi Rail. If your application is of interest, we will be in contact. Please do not hesitate to discover more about us and our latest jobs at https://www.hitachirail.com/careers .

At Hitachi Rail, there is a place for everyone. We welcome and value differences in background, age, gender, sexuality, family status, disability, race, nationality, ethnicity, religion, and world view. It is our commitment to create an inclusive environment - we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

We would be delighted if you would be one of our followers at https://www.linkedin.com/company/hitachirail .

Title: Systemingenieur (m/w/d) C/C++ und Python
Description:
Mit europaweit über 1.500 Mitarbeitern entwickeln wir zusammen mit unseren Partnern die Engineering- und IT-Lösungen von morgen. Unser Know-How deckt dabei die zukunftsweisendsten Technologien aus nahezu allen Industriebereichen ab. Zur Verstärkung unserer Projektteams suchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt eine/n

Systemingenieur (m/w/d) C/C++ und Python

Please read the required qualifications carefully and note that proficiency in German (level C1) is required.

Deine Aufgaben


Entwicklung und Implementierung von Softwarekomponenten in C/C++ und Python
Analyse und Lösung technischer Problemstellungen in komplexen Systemen
Entwicklung und Pflege von Systemarchitekturen sowie deren Integration in bestehende Prozesse
Erstellung von technischen Spezifikationen und Dokumentationen
Zusammenarbeit mit interdisziplinären Teams zur Sicherstellung der Systemfunktionalität
Durchführung von Tests, Debugging und Optimierung der Software


Das bringst Du mit


Abgeschlossenes Studium in Elektrotechnik, Nachrichtentechnik, Informatik oder ähnliches
Erweiterte Kenntnisse in Systemintegration sowie Testprogrammierung
Fundierte Expertise in Objektorientierte Softwareentwicklung sowie Software-Qualitätssicherung
Erfahrung in C/C++, Python sowie C# wünschenswert
Erste Erfahrungen in Embedded Linux
Reisebereitschaft innerhalb Deutschland


Das bieten wir Dir


Abwechslungsreiche Projekte bei renommierten Industrieunternehmen
Individuelle Förderung und Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
Work-Life-Balance (u. a. Home Office, Events)
Betriebliche Altersvorsorge
Zahlreiche Mitarbeiterrabatte


Noch Fragen?

Bei Fragen erreichst du uns unter bewerbung@mca-engineering.de

Title: Praktikant Entwicklung Technologien (m/w/d)
Description:
Pilz ist mit rund 2 500 Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeitern globaler Anbieter von Produkten, Systemen und Dienstleistungen für die sichere Automation. Als Technologieführer der Automatisierungstechnik tragen wir globale Verantwortung für die Sicherheit von Mensch, Maschine und Umwelt. Dazu arbeiten wir leidenschaftlich an innovativen Technologien und Lösungen, um die Welt jeden Tag ein bisschen sicherer zu machen.

–

Praktikant Entwicklung Technologien (m/w/d)

–

Stammhaus Ostfildern, befristet für 6 Monate, Kennziffer: 13ET50P

Title: Principal Engineer
Description:
Title - Principal Engineer

Location - Stuttgart

Salary - €110,000







Are you an experienced Java Principal Engineer looking for the opportunity to shape architecture, drive innovation, and lead a high-impact product? We building a high-performance data platform, integrating AI and proprietary database technology to transform invoice processing and data handling.




🔹 The Role

As a Principal Engineer, you’ll take ownership of architectural decisions, performance optimization, and technology choices while working closely with customers to ensure the product delivers real value. You will mentor engineers, tackle complex code challenges, and drive DevOps improvements to ensure smooth deployments.




🔹 Why Join Us?

✅ Freedom to define architecture & choose technologies

✅ Work with a highly skilled, senior team (backend + web developers)

✅ Direct access to customers for immediate impact

✅ AI integration & high-performance data processing challenges

✅ Opportunity to lead, innovate, and shape the future of our platform#




🔹 What We’re Looking For

✔ Deep Java expertise & experience with large-scale applications

✔ Strong AWS experience, with a focus on scalability & performance

✔ Hands-on knowledge of SQL & NoSQL databases, performance tuning, and caching strategies

✔ Experience in DevOps & deployment management

✔ Ability to analyse and optimize performance in complex systems

✔ Strong communication skills & ability to navigate product complexity




🔹 Bonus Points For

⭐ Experience with proprietary database engines & AI-driven analytics

⭐ Background in data processing & invoice automation




This role has been open since May, and we're looking for the right leader to take charge ASAP. If you're ready to define architecture, mentor engineers, and build something game-changing, let's talk!







📩 Apply now or DM me for more details!

Show more

Title: ServiceNow Developer - On-site 4 days a month - Stuttgart - must be fluent in German
Description:
ServiceNow Developer - On-site 4 days a month - Stuttgart - must be fluent in German




I am currently working with a ServiceNow partner who are the go to for ServiceNow implementations within the Financial Services industry, off the back of a really successful pipeline build they are now looking to scale their delivery team for a ServiceNow Developer who are going to play a vital part in an implementation.




You will be joining a tight knit team of ServiceNow Specialists focusing on the scale of implementations for clients.




Must haves:

3-4 years experience in ServiceNow.
ITSM, CSM, ITOM experience is highly desirable.
IT Development
Proficiency in coding and scripting within ServiceNow, including JavaScript, Glide API, Business Rules, UI Actions, and platform-specific tools.
Experience mentoring junior developers is a plus.




If you are interested in this opportunity please get in touch and share your CV to keira.sparkes@opusrs.com

Title: Frontend Developer (m/f)
Description:
We are the leading e-commerce company in the window and door sector in Europe. Behind our nine online shops is Neuffer Fenster + Türen GmbH, founded in Stuttgart in 1872. We see ourselves as a technology company, are proud of our ambitious team and are always on the lookout for talented people who want to become part of our success story.


Tasks



Design and implementation of frontend components (HTML, JavaScript, jQuery, Vite, SCSS)


Contribution to the implementation of automated JavaScript-based tests


Integration of frontend components with backend systems


Error analysis and continuous improvement of existing systems


Testing and debugging of frontend components


Continuous improvement of usability, accessibility, and performance of web applications



Requirements



Several years of experience in a modern frontend framework such as VueJS or React (we use VueJS)


You find CSS/SCSS to be intuitive


Experience working in TDD is a huge benefit


Experience in the entire software development lifecycle: research, design, development, and implementation


Strong problem-solving skills and proactive attitude in suggesting solutions and improvements


Good communication skills, fluent English and German



Benefits



an exciting job in an innovative and international working environment


short decision-making processes, open communication and room for implementing own ideas


a modern workplace in the city centre of Stuttgart with ideal transport connections


a variety of team events + internal training and development opportunities


fresh fruit, smoothies and sponsored lunch 3x a week including TGIF-BBQ on our 300 sqm terrace


corporate benefits: high-quality special discounts from well-known manufacturers and brand





Do you want to be part of our team? Then apply now! More than 100 colleagues in open, dynamic teams in Stuttgart are looking forward to meeting you!

Title: Fachausbilder (m/w/d) Informatik C#/C++
Description:
About

Bei unseren Kunden sorgen wir für solide Glücksgefühle – und vor allem bei deren Kunden. Denn diese erhalten dank unserer integrativen Intralogistik-Anlagen und Warehouse-Management-Software genau das geliefert, was sie bestellt haben. Zur richtigen Zeit in der richtigen Menge am richtigen Ort. Garantiert. Unser internationales Team packt an und umfasst rund 600 Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter. Und wir wachsen weiter.

Fachausbilder (m/w/d) Informatik C#/C++

Stuttgart

Du bist IT-Experte mit Leidenschaft für Wissensvermittlung? Dann suchen wir genau dich! Als Fachausbilder in der Informatik insbesondere für die Programmiersprache C++ begleitest du unsere Auszubildenden in der viastore SOFTWARE auf ihrem Weg zu echten IT-Profis. In einem innovativen Umfeld vermittelst du praxisnahes Know-how und bereitest die nächste Generation auf die Herausforderungen der digitalen Welt vor.

Das Erwartet Sie Bei Uns

Sie übernehmen die fachliche Führung unserer Auszubildenden im Bereich Fachinformatik für Anwendungsentwicklung; die disziplinarische Führung liegt hierbei beim Ausbildungskoordinator mit dem Sie eng zusammenarbeiten

Sie betreuen neben den Auszubildenden auch Schüler/innen und Studenten/innen die am viastore Hauptstandort in Stuttgart Ihre Praktika absolvieren

Sie verantworten die qualitative Ausbildung gemäß dem Ausbildungsplan, den Sie gemeinsam mit dem Fachbereich weiterentwickeln

Sie überwachen und unterstützen unsere Auszubildenden in ihrer beruflichen Entwicklung; hierbei stellen Sie sicher, dass sie das für den Beruf benötigte Wissen erwerben und bewerten gleichzeitig ihren Lernfortschritt

Sie organisieren, beschaffen oder konzipieren Trainingsmodule, die Sie dann für ausgewählte Themenbereiche ggf. selbst mit Auszubildenden oder auch erfahrenen Softwareentwicklern durchführen

Das Bringen Sie Mit

Sie verfügen über ein abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich MINT oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation und sind seit min. 4 Jahren in der Softwareentwicklung tätig (C#, C++)

Sie verfügen idealerweise über die Ausbildereignungsbescheinigung (AEVO) oder bringen die Bereitschaft mit, die benötigte Ausbildereignungsprüfung abzulegen

Sie sind ausgebildeter Trainer / Coach oder haben Interesse daran sich als solchen weiterbilden zu lassen

Sie zeichnen sich durch hohe soziale Kompetenz wie z. B. Empathie, Feedback-Kompetenz, Kommunikationsfähigkeit, Konfliktlösungsfähigkeit oder Motivationsfähigkeit und didaktische Fähigkeiten aus

Sie verfügen über verhandlungssichere Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift und fühlen sich bei Unterhaltungen und fachlichem Austausch auf Englisch wohl

Das Bieten Wir Ihnen

Einen sicheren Arbeitsplatz in einer teamorientierten Unternehmenskultur mit flachen Hierarchien und kollegialem Betriebsklima

Begleitetes Onboarding

Fundierte Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten

Flexible Arbeitszeiten und Möglichkeit des mobilen Arbeitens

Gute Verkehrsanbindung, bezuschusstes ÖPNV-Ticket, kostenlose Mitarbeiterparkplätze

Vermögenswirksame Arbeitgeberleistung

Moderne Büro-Ausstattung

Bezuschusstes Mittagessen

Regelmäßige Events und Workshops

Sport- und Wellnesszuschuss

JobRad Leasing

Angebot an Corporate Benefits

Kostenloses Obst, Kaffee und Wasser

Für diese Vakanz berücksichtigen wir grundsätzlich Bewerber*innen aus mehreren Bereichen: Softwareentwickler (m/w/d), Software Developer (m/w/d), Software Consultant (m/w/d), IT-Architekt (m/w/d), Ausbilder/in Softwareentwicklung (m/w/d), Fachinformatiker (m/w/d) etc.

Nice-to-have skills


C#
C++
Stuttgart, Baden-Württemberg, Germany


Work experience


Applications
Software Architect


Languages


German

Title: Sales Engineer / Vertriebsingenieurwesen (m/w/d) - Energieprognose - Software berta & rudi
Description:
Werde Teil der Digital Building Industries AG

Die DBI AG hat sich die Revolution der konservativen Baubranche zum Ziel gemacht. Sie ist ein junges, innovatives Unternehmen der in der Branche etablierten TMM-Gruppe. Deren langjährig aufgebautes Erfahrungswissen soll in eine neuartige KI-gestützte Webanwendung überführt werden, die eine einfache und intuitive Gebäudeplanung ermöglicht.

Zur Verstärkung Unseres Teams Suchen Wir Ab Sofort

Sales Engineer / Vertriebsingenieurwesen (m/w/d)

DAS SIND DEINE AUFGABEN


In Zusammenarbeit mit deinen Vertriebskolleginnen und Kollegen übernimmst du aktiv Verantwortung für unsere Vertriebspipeline von der Identifikation potenzieller Kunden bis hin zur Akquirierung
Du organisiert und leitest Produktpräsentationen zu unserer Software berta & rudi
Du betreust unsere Bestandskunden und trägst durch eine vertrauensvolle Zusammenarbeit zum Aufbau langfristiger Kundenbeziehungen bei
Außerdem beantwortest du technische und vertriebsspezifische Fragen und unterstützt bei der Einführung der Software


DAS BRINGST DU MIT


Du verfügst über ein abgeschlossenes Studium (Bachelor/Master) mit der Fachrichtung Versorgungstechnik , Technische Gebäudeausrüstung , Energiesysteme , Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen oder in einem ähnlichen Bereich
Erfahrung im B2B-Vertrieb, idealerweise mit technischen Produkten oder Softwarelösungen
Du bringst Interesse und fachliche Kenntnisse an den Themen Nachhaltigkeit und Energie mit sowie den entsprechenden Softwarelösungen
Kommunikationsstärke, Verhandlungsgeschick und Begeisterung für die Zusammenarbeit mit Kunden
Eine eigenverantwortliche und strukturierte Arbeitsweise gepaart mit einer ausgeprägten Teamfähigkeit
Zusätzlich beherrschst Du verhandlungssicheres Deutsch in Wort und Schrift


DAS BIETEN WIR DIR


Modernes, teamorientiertes und kooperatives Arbeitsumfeld mit flachen Hierarchien und kurzen Entscheidungswegen
Aktives Gestalten und Mitarbeiten bei spannenden Projekten und die Möglichkeit Dein Wissen auszubauen
Strukturierte Einarbeitung, bei der Dir ein Pate aus dem Team für alle Fragen zur Seite steht sowie vielfältige Entwicklungs- und Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten , um Dich und Deine Talente zu fördern

HTML:
Werde Teil der Digital Building Industries AG

Die DBI AG hat sich die Revolution der konservativen Baubranche zum Ziel gemacht. Sie ist ein junges, innovatives Unternehmen der in der Branche etablierten TMM-Gruppe. Deren langjährig aufgebautes Erfahrungswissen soll in eine neuartige KI-gestützte Webanwendung überführt werden, die eine einfache und intuitive Gebäudeplanung ermöglicht.

Zur Verstärkung Unseres Teams Suchen Wir Ab Sofort

Sales Engineer / Vertriebsingenieurwesen (m/w/d)

DAS SIND DEINE AUFGABEN

  • In Zusammenarbeit mit deinen Vertriebskolleginnen und Kollegen übernimmst du aktiv Verantwortung für unsere Vertriebspipeline von der Identifikation potenzieller Kunden bis hin zur Akquirierung
  • Du organisiert und leitest Produktpräsentationen zu unserer Software berta & rudi
  • Du betreust unsere Bestandskunden und trägst durch eine vertrauensvolle Zusammenarbeit zum Aufbau langfristiger Kundenbeziehungen bei
  • Außerdem beantwortest du technische und vertriebsspezifische Fragen und unterstützt bei der Einführung der Software

DAS BRINGST DU MIT

  • Du verfügst über ein abgeschlossenes Studium (Bachelor/Master) mit der Fachrichtung Versorgungstechnik , Technische Gebäudeausrüstung , Energiesysteme , Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen oder in einem ähnlichen Bereich
  • Erfahrung im B2B-Vertrieb, idealerweise mit technischen Produkten oder Softwarelösungen
  • Du bringst Interesse und fachliche Kenntnisse an den Themen Nachhaltigkeit und Energie mit sowie den entsprechenden Softwarelösungen
  • Kommunikationsstärke, Verhandlungsgeschick und Begeisterung für die Zusammenarbeit mit Kunden
  • Eine eigenverantwortliche und strukturierte Arbeitsweise gepaart mit einer ausgeprägten Teamfähigkeit
  • Zusätzlich beherrschst Du verhandlungssicheres Deutsch in Wort und Schrift

DAS BIETEN WIR DIR

  • Modernes, teamorientiertes und kooperatives Arbeitsumfeld mit flachen Hierarchien und kurzen Entscheidungswegen
  • Aktives Gestalten und Mitarbeiten bei spannenden Projekten und die Möglichkeit Dein Wissen auszubauen

Title: Entwicklungsingenieur (m/w/d) Security Embedded Software
Description:
Entwicklungsingenieur (m/w/d) Security Embedded Software




Wer sind wir?

ARINKO Stuttgart GmbH - als innovatives Ingenieurbüro entwickeln wir in engem Austausch mit unseren Kunden technische Lösungen für den Maschinen- und Anlagenbau sowie für die IT. Dabei bilden unsere 60 Mitarbeitenden die Basis unseres Erfolgs und widmen sich täglich neuen spannenden Projekten, sowohl in unserem Büro als auch bei unseren Kunden vor Ort. Unser Denken und Handeln ist geprägt durch Vertrauen, Respekt und Wertschätzung - wir betreuen unsere Kolleginnen und Kollegen individuell und bieten ihnen beste Perspektiven: Durch kontinuierliche Weiterbildung sind sie stets auf dem neuesten Stand. Bei ARINKO haben auch Sie alle Möglichkeiten, Ihre Karriere auf lange Sicht zu gestalten - ob als Berufseinsteiger (m/w/d) oder Experte (m/w/d).




Ihre Benefits:

Flexible Arbeitszeiten
Individuelle Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
Übertarifliches Gehalt
30 Tage Urlaub
Attraktive Mitarbeiterrabatte
Ergonomischer Arbeitsplatz
Fahrradleasing über JobRad
Onboarding mit persönlichem Ansprechpartner
Teamleiter-/Mentorenprogramm
Jährliches Entwicklungsgespräch
Mitarbeiterstammtische und Betriebsfeste
Familiäres Betriebsklima und kurze Entscheidungswege
Betriebsrente
Weihnachtsgeld und Urlaubsgeld
Betriebliches Gesundheitsmanagement




Ihre Aufgaben:

Entwurf, Implementierung und Verifikation von Security-Anforderung im Umfeld der Embedded Software-Plattform für elektrische Antriebssysteme
Mitarbeit bei der Erstellung von Datenflussdiagramm, TARA und Dokumentation
Mitarbeit bei der Erstellung einer Security-Software-Architektur Security by Design von der Spezifikation bis zur Umsetzung
Mitarbeit im Umfeld PSIRT und der Abstimmung mit bereichsübergreifenden Security Experten
Erstellung der Feindesigns sowie Codierung in C++
Unterstützung der Plattformentwicklung über den gesamten Lebenszyklus




Ihr Profil:

Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium der Fachrichtung technische Informatik vergleichbare Qualifikation
Erfahrung im Bereich Security in der Automatisierungstechnik
Erfahrung mit Automatisierungstechnologien und gute Kenntnisse in C++, objektorientierten Programmierung, Embedded-Plattformen und Echtzeit-Betriebssystemen, UML, Software-Engineering
Fundierte Kenntnisse der Cybersicherheit in Bezug auf Sicherheitsprotokolle (TLS), Verschlüsselung (z.B. AES, RSA), Schlüsselverwaltung wie PKI, BYOE
Idealerweise Kenntnisse von Echtzeit-Kommunikationsprotokolle (z.B. EtherCat, ETHERNET/IP, PROFINET, OPC UA TSN) und Netzwerkprotokollen wie Ethernet, UDP, TCP/IP
Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift
Sichere Beherrschung der gängigen MS-Office-Tools
Anwenderkenntnisse und Tools zum Requirementmanagement und Revisionsmanagement
Hohes Maß an Organisationsvermögen, Selbstdisziplin und eigenverantwortliche Arbeitsweise




Klingt gut? Dann senden Sie uns Ihre Bewerbung unter Angabe Ihres frühestmöglichen Eintrittstermins. Wir freuen uns darauf Sie kennenzulernen!

Title: Full Stack Developer in Stuttgart
Description:
Beschreibung

Benedikt – Full Stack Developer in Stuttgart

» As a full stack developer, I enjoy working independently the most. This requires you to be actively involved in discussions and always evaluate whether you can provide support somewhere else. Sometimes you have to put your own needs on the back burner and say: ‘OK, I'm going to help the team now. There may be something more important that serves the general goal.' You are always involved in solving problems that have arisen that were not foreseeable - that is in the nature of things. But there is no case that is impossible or unsolvable. You just have to plan well and see where you can get the help you need to solve the problem. «

This is how you work

As an agile team of up to eight experts, you share end-to-end responsibility for the software. You deploy finished components in the cloud and communicate directly with users from a wide range of industries.

Anforderungen

You …

_ design and develop a cloud-based platform including mobile and web applications.

_ develop front- and backend components in a microservice architecture.

_ coordinate development accompanying tests, unit tests and integration tests and perform code reviews in a team.

_ specify and develop interfaces in an enterprise environment.

_ work closely in an agile, interdisciplinary team with your colleagues.

_ conceive and realise UI designs, e.g. based on React & Material UI.

Skills

What you bring to the table

_ sound knowledge of current frontend (React / Angular / Svelte) and backend technology (Java / Go / Node.js / C#.NET)

_ enthusiasm and motivation for software development topics

_ confident handling of Git

_ clean code and TDD

_ quick comprehension and structured work

_ familiar with agile software development

_ good German and English skills

Arbeitgeber

Agile Softwareentwicklung, passgenaue Lösungen. In Stuttgart, Bonn, München, Kopenhagen und Budapest. Wir arbeiten nutzer:innenzentriert und agil. Denn Analyse allein löst keine Probleme und Geschwindigkeit ist für den Erfolg entscheidend. In interdisziplinären Teams bündeln wir je nach Projektbedarf die Stärken der Mitarbeiter:innen. Unsere Ergebnisse entstehen mit viel Empathie für die User:innen, jeder Menge fachlichem Know-how und Erfahrung im Einsatz neuster Technologien. Langfristige Partnerschaften sind uns wichtig. Auf unsere Ideen und Erfahrung setzen sowohl Konzerne, als auch mittelständische Unternehmen. Manche Kund:innen sind seit Tag Eins dabei. Komm ins Team und gestalte mit uns die Zukunft. Deine Ansprechperson: Karin Bilsing — jobs@sprinteins.com

Title: Praktikum/Abschlussarbeit "Implementierung eines Verfahrens zur Vollwellenwandlung von Hohlleiterfiltern" (m/w/d)
Description:
Job Description

Es wurde ein neues Verfahren für die Synthese von Hohlleiterfiltern entwickelt. Dieses Verfahren soll nun in die bestehende Softwarebasis integriert werden.

Deine Aufgaben


Beherrschung der (bestehenden) FEM-Simulationssoftware
Entwicklung einer Datenbank auf Basis von MySQL
Implementierung des Algorithmus in Java und Python


Deine Qualifikation


Immatrikulierter Student in der Fachrichtung Nachrichtentechnik, Hochfrequenztechnik, Elektrotechnik/Informationstechnik oder vergleichbare Studiengänge
Kenntnisse in Hochfrequenztechnik sind von Vorteil, aber keine Voraussetzung
Kenntnisse in den Programmiersprachen Java, Phyton, MySWL
Sehr gute Deutsch-sowie gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift sind Voraussetzung
Engagement und eigenständiges Arbeiten in einem kommunikativen Team sind selbstverständlich


Was dich erwartet


Betreuung und kompetente Unterstützung durch erfahrene Mitarbeiter
Gestaltungsfreiraum, der neue Perspektiven für das Engagement jedes Einzelnen eröffnet
Einblick in die Raumfahrtbranche
eine Möglichkeit, die Zukunft von Tesat mitzugestalten und etwas zu bewegen
flexible Arbeitszeit
attraktive Vergütung
werteorientiertes Handeln und die Begeisterung für das was wir tun

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Pandora, we are transforming the retail experience with cutting-edge technology. Our mission is to provide an exceptional shopping experience to our customers by leveraging data-driven insights and innovative solutions across our business. We are looking for a talented Machine Learning Engineer to join our dynamic team and help us shape the future of retail.

Job Summary:

As a Machine Learning Engineer at Pandora, you will play a key role in developing and deploying machine learning models that drive impactful decisions and elevate customer experiences. You will collaborate closely with a diverse group of data scientists, data engineers, and business leaders to create scalable solutions that optimize our retail operations across the full value chain – covering jewellery design and crafting, supply chain logistics, to instore/online retail and marketing. We encourage creative problem-solving, continuous learning, and work-life balance in a supportive environment.

Key Responsibilities:


Model Development: Work in end-to-end analytical products, from exploration and prototyping to productizing and testing, helping to solve complex business problems across the full value chain.
Data Pipeline Engineering: Develop and maintain data pipelines for collecting, processing, and analyzing large datasets, ensuring data quality and consistency.
Model Deployment: Deploy machine learning models into production environments, ensuring they are scalable, reliable, and easy to maintain.
Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, software engineers, MLOps engineers, product managers, and business stakeholders, to understand business needs and translate them into machine learning solutions.
Performance Monitoring: Continuously monitor the performance of deployed models and implement improvements to enhance their accuracy, efficiency, and scalability.
Research & Innovation: Stay up-to-date with the latest developments in machine learning and AI, and apply new techniques to improve existing models and processes.
Documentation: Maintain clear and comprehensive documentation of models, processes, and systems to facilitate knowledge sharing and collaboration.



Qualifications:

Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, or a related field.

Experience:


3+ years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, Data Scientist, or similar role.
Experience in the retail industry or e-commerce is highly desirable.



Technical Skills:


Strong problem-solving abilities, solid background in algorithms and data structures.
Strong proficiency in Python.
Ability to work with machine learning tools (eg. scikit-learn, tensorflow, keras, pytorch, Spark MLlib).
Experience with big data using Databricks, Snowflake, Apache Spark or Hadoop.
Proficiency in SQL and experience with relational databases.
System level architecture understanding including scaling, MLOps, model/data monitoring, and ensuring a deterministic pipeline.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., Azure) and containerization technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git) and collaborative development tools (e.g., JIRA, Confluence).



Soft Skills:


Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
A proactive attitude and a passion for continuous learning and innovation.



Our Pandora Values

We dream, are visionary and go beyond the obvious. 

We dare to pursue bold ambitions with courage and speed. 

We care deeply about each other, our customers and the planet we all share. Every day we strive to be a fulfilling workplace, where each of us can thrive and contribute, where talents can grow, and 

We deliver on our promises to colleagues, customers, partners and stakeholders.

We are focused on building a diverse and inclusive workforce. If you’re excited about this role, but do not meet 100% of the qualifications listed above, we encourage you to apply.

Did we get your attention

If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora’s future, please do not hesitate to apply. We look forward to hearing from you!

We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.

Icing on the cake

You will be working out of our beautiful Head Office in Copenhagen V, established in 2016 and designed to unite and inspire our teams. Besides our beautiful interior design we are also proud of our LEED Gold Certification for Energy and Environmental Design. This means that we use as few natural resources as possible and that we use them with respect. The result is a professional and dynamic space that is unique, comfortable and inspirational – and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here or comes to visit.

About Pandora

Established in 1982, Pandora designs, manufactures and markets hand-finished jewellery made from high-quality materials at affordable prices. Pandora’s products are available in more than 100 countries on six continents through more than 6,500 points of sale, including around 2,500 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 32,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery at two LEED certified facilities in Thailand, using mainly recycled silver and gold. The company plans to be carbon neutral by 2025 and has joined the Science Based Targets initiative to reduce emissions across its full value chain. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated a revenue of DKK 28.1 billion in 2023. 

At Pandora, we believe that creating an inclusive and diverse workplace and reflecting societal diversity in our customer engagement is essential to delivering on our company purpose: to give a voice to people’s loves. We dedicate ourselves to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and diversity where everyone feels respected and valued.

Job Summary:

As a Machine Learning Engineer at Pandora, you will play a key role in developing and deploying machine learning models that drive impactful decisions and elevate customer experiences. You will collaborate closely with a diverse group of data scientists, data engineers, and business leaders to create scalable solutions that optimize our retail operations across the full value chain – covering jewellery design and crafting, supply chain logistics, to instore/online retail and marketing. We encourage creative problem-solving, continuous learning, and work-life balance in a supportive environment.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Model Development: Work in end-to-end analytical products, from exploration and prototyping to productizing and testing, helping to solve complex business problems across the full value chain.
  • Data Pipeline Engineering: Develop and maintain data pipelines for collecting, processing, and analyzing large datasets, ensuring data quality and consistency.
  • Model Deployment: Deploy machine learning models into production environments, ensuring they are scalable, reliable, and easy to maintain.
  • Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, software engineers, MLOps engineers, product managers, and business stakeholders, to understand business needs and translate them into machine learning solutions.
  • Performance Monitoring: Continuously monitor the performance of deployed models and implement improvements to enhance their accuracy, efficiency, and scalability.
  • Research & Innovation: Stay up-to-date with the latest developments in machine learning and AI, and apply new techniques to improve existing models and processes.
  • Documentation: Maintain clear and comprehensive documentation of models, processes, and systems to facilitate knowledge sharing and collaboration.


Qualifications:

Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, or a related field.

Experience:

  • 3+ years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, Data Scientist, or similar role.
  • Experience in the retail industry or e-commerce is highly desirable.


Technical Skills:

  • Strong problem-solving abilities, solid background in algorithms and data structures.
  • Strong proficiency in Python.
  • Ability to work with machine learning tools (eg. scikit-learn, tensorflow, keras, pytorch, Spark MLlib).
  • Experience with big data using Databricks, Snowflake, Apache Spark or Hadoop.
  • Proficiency in SQL and experience with relational databases.
  • System level architecture understanding including scaling, MLOps, model/data monitoring, and ensuring a deterministic pipeline.
  • Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., Azure) and containerization technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
  • Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git) and collaborative development tools (e.g., JIRA, Confluence).


Soft Skills:

  • Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
  • A proactive attitude and a passion for continuous learning and innovation.


Our Pandora Values

We dream, are visionary and go beyond the obvious. 

We dare to pursue bold ambitions with courage and speed. 

We care deeply about each other, our customers and the planet we all share. Every day we strive to be a fulfilling workplace, where each of us can thrive and contribute, where talents can grow, and 

We deliver on our promises to colleagues, customers, partners and stakeholders.

We are focused on building a diverse and inclusive workforce. If you’re excited about this role, but do not meet 100% of the qualifications listed above, we encourage you to apply.

Did we get your attention

If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora’s future, please do not hesitate to apply. We look forward to hearing from you!

We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.

Icing on the cake

You will be working out of our beautiful Head Office in Copenhagen V, established in 2016 and designed to unite and inspire our teams. Besides our beautiful interior design we are also proud of our LEED Gold Certification for Energy and Environmental Design. This means that we use as few natural resources as possible and that we use them with respect. The result is a professional and dynamic space that is unique, comfortable and inspirational – and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here or comes to visit.

About Pandora

Established in 1982, Pandora designs, manufactures and markets hand-finished jewellery made from high-quality materials at affordable prices. Pandora’s products are available in more than 100 countries on six continents through more than 6,500 points of sale, including around 2,500 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 32,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery at two LEED certified facilities in Thailand, using mainly recycled silver and gold. The company plans to be carbon neutral by 2025 and has joined the Science Based Targets initiative to reduce emissions across its full value chain. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated a revenue of DKK 28.1 billion in 2023. 

At Pandora, we believe that creating an inclusive and diverse workplace and reflecting societal diversity in our customer engagement is essential to delivering on our company purpose: to give a voice to people’s loves. We dedicate ourselves to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and diversity where everyone feels respected and valued.

Title: Biomedical Machine Learning Engineer Intern
Place: Frederiksberg Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join IMP SCANDINAVIA, a dynamic MedTech Start-Up revolutionizing the healthcare sector with our intelligent monitoring technology. We are seeking a motivated Biomedical Digital Signal Processing intern to contribute to our research and development team. If you're a hands-on, self-driven individual with a passion for improving patient outcomes, this is the perfect opportunity for you.

The Job?

IMP is currently looking for a hands-on, self-driven, energetic Biomedical Digital Signal Processing intern to join our research and development team. This position is responsible for developing creative solutions to significant unmet medical needs that align with IMP objectives. The digital signal processing aspect of the work involves innovating new approaches to analyzing human data over time including physiological data.

Responsibilities


Design of advance signal processing algorithms for portable diagnostic devices.
Develop machine learning and deep learning models for various vital sign calculations
Collaborate with our tech stack to operationalize applications, including API development.
Drive product innovation by exploring new ways to improve our offerings.
Document progress and utilize critical thinking for decision-making on implemented methods.


Your daily tasks will be designed in close corporation with the CTO and our R&D team.

Qualifications


Have at least a BSc in Biomedical Engineering, Electric Engineering, Computer science or similar health science engineering degree.
Strong knowledge of physiology of biological systems such as heart, lungs, and brain etc.
Proficiency in DSP, Data Science Pattern recognition, and ML/DL for DSP.
Strong programming skills in Python/MATLAB and object-oriented programming.
Experience in Embedded C (Optional)
Quick and Independent learner, not afraid of taking initiatives.
Passion for delivering solutions in the healthcare sector.
Familiar with the regulations and standards implications for the documentation of a medical device.


What We Offer


Join a team of passionate individuals and make a real impact on our business.
Flexible working hours to make the most of your time.
Hybrid work opportunities, allowing you to perform at your best.
We value eagerness to learn and positive energy, so apply even if you meet only some of the criteria.
Expect responsibility, challenges, professional and personal growth, and 24/7 office space availability.
Enjoy social events and receive a letter of recommendation.


For more information, please contact us and to apply, please send us an application via The Hub. Join IMP and be part of our mission to enhance patient quality of life, streamline supervision and monitoring, and empower health-related decision-making in the healthcare sector.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Are you someone who takes ownership of tasks, sees projects through with focus, and thrives on creative problem-solving? Do you enjoy uncovering patterns in data and transforming insights into actionable solutions? If you're motivated by continuous improvement and strategic thinking, this might be the perfect opportunity for you.

At PriceShape, we value collaboration and the drive to contribute to meaningful advancements. You’ll bring structure to complex problems and communicate findings to inspire action, all while contributing to the evolution of our technology and e-commerce platform.

Job Description

As a Data Scientist at PriceShape, you will play an essential role in analyzing, modeling, and deriving insights from data that drives our platform's core functionalities. You will focus on building predictive models, analyzing trends, and optimizing e-commerce-related processes using structured data.

Your day-to-day work will be together with an international team, working closely with your Team Lead, our CTO, Head of Engineering and our full-stack developers. Our department consists of colleagues from various parts of the world and English is the primary language for communication.

Your Key Responsibilities Consist Of The Following


Supporting the development and deployment of machine learning and deep learning models, contributing to the process from ideation to implementation under the guidance of the team lead.
Assisting in advanced time series analyses for e-commerce data, such as sales forecasting and inventory management.
Writing and optimizing complex SQL queries to extract, manipulate, and analyze data.
Collaborating with software developers to implement data-driven solutions into the platform.
Conducting exploratory data analysis and presenting insights to the team lead and relevant stakeholders.


We Expect You To Bring The Following

Your hands-on skills and data curiosity are what matter most. We're looking for someone who is self-sufficient, eager to learn, and most importantly someone who is passionate about data science within the e-commerce space.

Must-Have Skills


Strong experience with Python and relevant libraries (e.g., Pandas, Numpy, Scikit learn, TensorFlow…).
Proficiency in SQL, with the ability to write complex queries involving joins, subqueries, and aggregations.
A solid understanding of machine learning algorithms (supervised and unsupervised learning) and their practical applications in sales data.
Practical experience in time series analysis for solving business problems like sales forecasting and inventory management.
Experience deploying and maintaining machine learning models in a production environment using AWS services.
Strong understanding of feature engineering techniques.
Experience with software engineering best practices such as version control and testing.


Good-to-Have Skills


Familiarity with working on sales and customer data in e-commerce.
Ability to quickly understand e-commerce-specific datasets and use them effectively
Basic knowledge of deep learning, particularly LSTMs (Long Short-Term Memory networks).


What You Can Expect From Us


A great career opportunity for continuous growth alongside your team and the company.
An informal, international startup culture that prioritizes work-life balance.
Flexible working hours, with a base at our new office in Aarhus C.
Computer and equipment of your choice.
Social events like parties, poker nights, and padel tennis.


About PriceShape

PriceShape is a fast-growing company with potential for personal and professional growth. We are a young SaaS company that develops and sells a price optimization tool for e-commerce stores and brands worldwide. PriceShape has around 95 employees with our daily operations in Aarhus.

How To Apply

If you think the position is attractive and suitable, please send us a job application and your CV as soon as possible. We process and interview on an ongoing basis. For clarifications about the position, you can contact our CTO, Brian Hansen at brha@priceshape.dk.



Job openings



Recruitment process



Talent pool

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Place: Hørsholm, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to join our Software and AI Solutions department at Gubra. In this role, you will collaborate closely with data scientists and software developers to deploy, monitor, and manage machine learning models in production, ensuring robust and scalable ML pipelines.




State-of-the-art ML models in multiple domains

In this role, you will handle ML models from multiple domains. Our most established domains are biomedical image analysis and machine learning based design of pharmaceuticals. Gubra is a leader in high throughput 3D imaging, and an early adopter of digital histopathology. We have developed our own ML based drug discovery platform called streaMLine. The platform has reduced drug discovery time by 50%. Now, we are ready to apply ML to more parts of our business, and you will play a large part in that.




In addition, we are currently investigating areas where generative AI can make our processes more efficient. If interested, you could be instrumental in designing and building solutions with elements from generative AI.




Your primary tasks will be to:

Design, implement, and manage ML applications
Manage model versions and ensure smooth integration into production systems
Build and maintain automated pipelines for data ingestion, preprocessing, training, validation, and inference in production
Ensure ML models and pipelines are scalable to handle varying loads and diverse data.




Proven Machine Learning experience

At Gubra, we believe that sharing knowledge is key to success. Therefore, you will be part of a team where collaboration and the willingness to share early-stage ideas are essential. We promise that you will learn from us, and we are looking forward to learning from you.




We are open to any levels of experience if you are motivated. Your qualifications could include:

A master's or PhD degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
Proficiency in Python, including experience with machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch) and data processing libraries.
Experience applying data science and statistics to solve real problems.




Desirable qualifications

You do not necessarily need to have these qualifications, but we hope you are willing to learn, because you will use them actively in this position:

Knowledge of CI/CD tools and containerization
Experience with MLOps, including model monitoring, reproducibility, and data management
Experience with cloud or hybrid infrastructure
Motivation to learn about the biotech industry
Motivation to develop competencies in generative AI.




Software and AI Solutions – your new Team

You will join 16 skilled data scientists and developers in the Software and AI Solutions department at Gubra HQ in Hørsholm, on the edge of Greater Copenhagen. The department focuses on developing advanced tools to support all aspects of our biotechnology and research business.




We work in an informal and inclusive environment. We like to share knowledge and help each other. We look forward to welcoming you to the team.




Contact and application

We encourage you to submit your application as soon as possible, as we will be reviewing applications on an ongoing basis. Please upload your motivated cover letter, resume and relevant diplomas on our website no later than March 9, 2025.




If you have any questions, you are very welcome to contact Senior Department Manager, Casper Salinas at cgs@gubra.dk. If necessary, we will set up an additional call to ensure your understanding of the job and your many opportunities.




We look forward to receiving your application.




About Gubra

Gubra is an ambitious contract research organisation (CRO) and biotech company striving for excellence at all levels. We insist on doing things efficiently – and often differently - to achieve the results we aim for. Our vision is to become leaders in the fight for a healthier and more sustainable world. We do that by facilitating the discovery of new medicine, and by acting and inspiring others to fight the ongoing climate and biodiversity crises.




Gubra’s activities are focused on the early stages of drug development and are organised in two highly synergistic business areas: CRO Services and Discovery & Partnerships (D&P). We generate our revenue by performing research for life science companies as well as by partnering projects from our discovery and development pipeline.




Our therapeutic focus is within metabolic and fibrotic diseases, and we specialize in in vivo pharmacology, ex vivo assays, drug profiling, histology, stereology and whole brain and organ imaging. In addition, we offer a full palette of advanced transcriptomics. Our ML/AI-driven peptide drug discovery platform streaMLine enables us to rapidly develop a peptide hit into a non-clinical candidate ready for development. Through a constant focus on high quality, scientific excellence, speed, and solid teamwork we have established ourselves as a highly professional and competent partner in the market.




People are our greatest asset, and our team consists of +260 employees all located in Hørsholm, Denmark. The mix of people from different cultures and educational backgrounds combined with our entrepreneurial mindset have greatly impacted our working environment, which is characterized by entrepreneurial drive, scientific curiosity, and teamwork – we join forces!




Check out www.gubra.dk for more inspiration.

Title: Automation Developer
Description:
Kunne du tænke dig at udvikle og implementere automatiseringsløsninger, der understøtter en større forretning? Som Automation Developer hos Telenor løser du komplekse problemstillinger og leverer forretningskritiske services. Du får metodefrihed, adgang til AI-værktøjer og mulighed for selv at definere, hvordan opgaverne løses. Interesseret?

"Hvis du kan lide at kode, automatisere og optimere – og samtidig vil have stor indflydelse i en rolle med brede snitflader og masser af metodefrihed, så er det her jobbet for dig"

– Jacob Ankerstrøm, Manager

Fra kode til automation skaber du innovation, der gør en reel forskel

Som Automation Developer bliver du en del af teamet IT Process Automation, der tilhører Telenors Technology-division. Teamet er sat i verden med henblik på at drive de platforme, som understøtter organisationen inden for business service management og procesautomatisering.

Vi samarbejder tæt med forretningen om at udvikle løsninger, der ikke blot løser dagligdagens behov, men også understøtter Telenors langsigtede mål – både operationelt og strategisk. Forude venter en spændende periode med et større transformationsprojekt, hvor teamet får en central rolle – og her får vi brug for dig!

Som vores nye kollega får du mulighed for at arbejde med procesautomatisering og enterprise service management på tværs af flere platforme, herunder ServiceNow og UiPath. Du designer og udvikler flows, koder og konfigurerer systemer samt opsætter API’er og integrationer, der alt sammen skaber værdi på tværs af organisationen.

Du omsætter forretningskrav til tekniske løsninger ved hjælp af dine formidlingsevner

I denne rollefår du frie tøjler til at omsætte forretningskrav til tekniske løsninger, der rent faktisk nytter. Du får lov til at dykke ned i JavaScript, eventuelt suppleret af Python, PowerShell og .NET (C#) for at bygge smarte, skalerbare systemer, der holder organisationen kørende.

Du bliver således arkitekten bag robuste integrationer og workflows, hvor din erfaring med databasehåndtering, objektorienteret programmering og API’er får plads til at skinne. Og bare rolig – du står ikke alene! Du kommer til at arbejde tæt sammen med et team, der deler din passion for automatisering og smarte løsninger.

Ved hjælp af tæt dialog med stakeholders sikrer du, at løsningerne understøtter forretningens behov. Derfor er det vigtigt, at du formår at kommunikere tekniske idéer på en letforståelig måde, arbejde struktureret og have et holistisk blik på opgaverne.

Har du en bachelor eller kandidat i Computer Science, Computer Teknologi, Datalogi eller lignende? Fedt! Certificeringer i ITIL, ServiceNow eller UiPath? Cool, men ikke et must. Erfaring med Telco, ServiceNow, Service Management eller RPA? Bonus! Dog håber vi mest af alt, at du har et ønske om at lykkes med det, du sætter dig for og deler vores ambition om at skabe tekniske løsninger, der understøtter forretningen.

En arbejdsplads fyldt med Fantastiske forbindelser

Som team har vi fokus på det tætte samarbejde og den uformelle omgangstone. Vi deler erfaringer og har det sjovt sammen – samtidig med, at vi opretholder et højt fagligt niveau. Læring er højt prioriteret og hos os får du frihed til at udvikle dig, så du kan vokse både personligt og professionelt.

Ønsker du at lære vores Technology-division bedre at kende? Læs mere her .

Du bliver en del af en foranderlig organisation, hvor der, på tværs af forretningen, venter dedikerede og dygtige kolleger, som kontinuerligt arbejder for at udvikle fremtidens teleselskab. Vi arbejder agilt, fokuserer indsatsområder ved hjælp af Kanban og praktiserer Tight-Loose-Tight som ledelsesfilosofi.

Interesseret?

Har du spørgsmål, eller vil du vide mere om stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte Manager, Jacob Ankerstrøm via kontaktoplysningerne til højre.

Kan du se dig selv i rollen, og har du interesse i at blive vores nye Fantastiske forbindelse, søger du blot stillingen via linket her på siden. Du behøver ikke skrive en ansøgning, men vi ser gerne et CV fra dig. Derudover har du mulighed for at sætte et par ord på dig selv gennem vores ansøgningsskema.

Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig hurtigst muligt, men senest den 9. marts 2025.
Show more

Som Automation Developer hos Telenor løser du komplekse problemstillinger og leverer forretningskritiske services. Du får metodefrihed, adgang til AI-værktøjer og mulighed for selv at definere, hvordan opgaverne løses. Interesseret?

"Hvis du kan lide at kode, automatisere og optimere – og samtidig vil have stor indflydelse i en rolle med brede snitflader og masser af metodefrihed, så er det her jobbet for dig"

– Jacob Ankerstrøm, Manager

Fra kode til automation skaber du innovation, der gør en reel forskel

Som Automation Developer bliver du en del af teamet IT Process Automation, der tilhører Telenors Technology-division. Teamet er sat i verden med henblik på at drive de platforme, som understøtter organisationen inden for business service management og procesautomatisering.

Vi samarbejder tæt med forretningen om at udvikle løsninger, der ikke blot løser dagligdagens behov, men også understøtter Telenors langsigtede mål – både operationelt og strategisk. Forude venter en spændende periode med et større transformationsprojekt, hvor teamet får en central rolle – og her får vi brug for dig!

Som vores nye kollega får du mulighed for at arbejde med procesautomatisering og enterprise service management på tværs af flere platforme, herunder ServiceNow og UiPath. Du designer og udvikler flows, koder og konfigurerer systemer samt opsætter API’er og integrationer, der alt sammen skaber værdi på tværs af organisationen.

Du omsætter forretningskrav til tekniske løsninger ved hjælp af dine formidlingsevner

I denne rollefår du frie tøjler til at omsætte forretningskrav til tekniske løsninger, der rent faktisk nytter. Du får lov til at dykke ned i JavaScript, eventuelt suppleret af Python, PowerShell og .NET (C#) for at bygge smarte, skalerbare systemer, der holder organisationen kørende.

Du bliver således arkitekten bag robuste integrationer og workflows, hvor din erfaring med databasehåndtering, objektorienteret programmering og API’er får plads til at skinne. Og bare rolig – du står ikke alene! Du kommer til at arbejde tæt sammen med et team, der deler din passion for automatisering og smarte løsninger.

Ved hjælp af tæt dialog med stakeholders sikrer du, at løsningerne understøtter forretningens behov. Derfor er det vigtigt, at du formår at kommunikere tekniske idéer på en letforståelig måde, arbejde struktureret og have et holistisk blik på opgaverne.

Har du en bachelor eller kandidat i Computer Science, Computer Teknologi, Datalogi eller lignende? Fedt! Certificeringer i ITIL, ServiceNow eller UiPath? Cool, men ikke et must. Erfaring med Telco, ServiceNow, Service Management eller RPA? Bonus! Dog håber vi mest af alt, at du har et ønske om at lykkes med det, du sætter dig for og deler vores ambition om at skabe tekniske løsninger, der understøtter forretningen.

En arbejdsplads fyldt med Fantastiske forbindelser

Som team har vi fokus på det tætte samarbejde og den uformelle omgangstone. Vi deler erfaringer og har det sjovt sammen – samtidig med, at vi opretholder et højt fagligt niveau. Læring er højt prioriteret og hos os får du frihed til at udvikle dig, så du kan vokse både personligt og professionelt.

Ønsker du at lære vores Technology-division bedre at kende? Læs mere her .

Du bliver en del af en foranderlig organisation, hvor der, på tværs af forretningen, venter dedikerede og dygtige kolleger, som kontinuerligt arbejder for at udvikle fremtidens teleselskab. Vi arbejder agilt, fokuserer indsatsområder ved hjælp af Kanban og praktiserer Tight-Loose-Tight som ledelsesfilosofi.

Interesseret?

Har du spørgsmål, eller vil du vide mere om stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte Manager, Jacob Ankerstrøm via kontaktoplysningerne til højre.

Kan du se dig selv i rollen, og har du interesse i at blive vores nye Fantastiske forbindelse, søger du blot stillingen via linket her på siden. Du behøver ikke skrive en ansøgning, men vi ser gerne et CV fra dig. Derudover har du mulighed for at sætte et par ord på dig selv gennem vores ansøgningsskema.

Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig hurtigst muligt, men senest den 9. marts 2025.

Title: Data Scientist, Denmark - BCG X
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

We Are BCG X

We’re a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world’s most complex problems. Leveraging BCG’s global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.

What You'll Do

Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.

As a Data Scientist and Senior Data Scientist, you'll be part of our rapidly growing team. You'll have the chance to apply data science methods and analytics to real-world business situations across a variety of industries to drive significant business impact. You'll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions.

Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X. Successful candidates are intellectually curious builders who are biased toward action, scrappy, and communicative.

We Are Looking For Talented Individuals With a Passion For Data Science, Statistics, Operations Research And Transforming Organizations Into AI Led Innovative Companies. Successful Candidates Possess The Following


Comfortable in a client-facing role with the ambition to lead teams
Likes to distill complex results or processes into simple, clear visualizations
Explain sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner
Love building things and are comfortable working with modern development tools and writing code collaboratively (bonus points if you have a software development or DevOps experience)
Significant experience applying advanced analytics to a variety of business situations and a proven ability to synthesize complex data
Deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and their mathematical underpinnings, and can translate this into business implications for our clients
Have strong project management skills


#BCGXjob

What You'll Bring

Technologies

Programming Languages: Python

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.

BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.
Show more

Title: AI Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Our development team is searching for an enthusiastic and dynamic AI Engineer to join our newly established AI team. This is a fantastic opportunity to be at the forefront of our latest product development, integrating AI as a key component to enhance our solutions. If you're excited about AI, prompt engineering, and developing next-generation AI-powered solutions, we’d love to hear from you!

Joining Configit offers you a unique opportunity to thrive in a dynamic and ambitious company, working alongside highly skilled colleagues. As an international, multicultural software company, we operate across offices in Denmark, Germany, the US, the UK, and India. While this position is based at their headquarters in Copenhagen, you can expect collaboration with colleagues across these locations.

We are currently undergoing a transformative journey, transitioning from a traditional license-based software company to a cutting-edge subscription-based SaaS vendor. Specializing in innovative software solutions, we cater to manufacturing companies dealing with complex products, including those from renowned brands like Jaguar Land Rover, Philips Healthcare, and Siemens. Collaborating closely with clients and partners, we take pride in resolving complex configuration challenges and shaping the future of configuration software.

Your role

Responsibilities

As part of the AI team, you will be responsible for shaping and implementing AI-powered solutions within our products. Your key responsibilities will include:


Being the subject matter expert and go-to person for AI’s technical landscape and emerging AI technologies
Designing and refining prompt strategies for AI models, ensuring accuracy, relevance, and optimal system responses
Gaining an in-depth understanding of our product suite and leveraging AI to enhance user experience and functionality
Working with a wide variety of AI technologies, such as ChatGPT, and Claude to develop and deploy AI-driven features
Collaborating closely with developers, product owners, and tech leads to integrate AI in a meaningful and scalable way
Continuously iterating and optimizing prompts and AI workflows to improve automation and decision-making processes
Exploring and implementing new AI techniques and methodologies to drive innovation within the company
Contributing to the overall AI strategy, ensuring alignment with our long-term product goals


Your Skills

To succeed in this role, you should have a good technical foundation combined with a passion for AI and emerging technologies. Specifically, we are looking for someone who:


Has hands-on experience with AI solutions that are actively deployed and operational
Has a good technical understanding and is comfortable working with complex software products
Has experience or deep interest in prompt engineering and how to refine AI interactions for optimal performance
Has applied experience with LLMs and understands their strengths and limitations
Is familiar with AI solutions such as ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini, LLaMA, or Mistral.
Has a natural curiosity and enthusiasm for AI and new technologies, always eager to experiment and refine AI-powered solutions
Enjoys working in cross-functional teams, collaborating with software developers, product owners, and AI specialists
Has experience or a good understanding of manufacturing or production industries (not mandatory but highly beneficial)
Is fluent in English with strong communication skills


What You’ll Find With Us

A unique opportunity in a dynamic, ambitious, and international culture, where you will work with a lot of skilled colleagues.


We are proud of our values: Business Focus * One Team * Knowledge * Can do Attitude * Move Fast
We work with complex and challenging products that add great value to our enterprise customers.
We offer a flexible working policy, which ensures a healthy work-life balance in a flexible setup.
Collaboration is important, and we work in an international environment and across all professional disciplines.
We prioritize communication as an important part of our culture, which is informal and open on all levels.
We offer a high-standard office environment in Copenhagen close to public transport.


At Configit, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace where our employees can thrive. We are proud to employ people of all backgrounds, and your unique talents and experiences will be welcomed. Come be a part of an exciting team!

We are supported by Coresearch in this recruitment.


Show more

Title: AI Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Your Role In Our Mission

We are looking for an AI Engineer to help us take systems that understand large technical documents and turn them into code. This is a job of excitement and exploration, requiring AI expertise and software engineering skills to build complex systems. Knowledge of semiconductors is a plus.

At Normal Computing, you will contribute to cutting-edge machine learning applications across various aspects of our business, working on solutions from the early stages of research and development to production deployment for our customers.

Responsibilities


Contribute to AI projects from concept to production deployment
Design and build systems using large language models to process complex technical documents
Develop solutions for multi-modal data handling (PDFs, logs, tables)
Solve challenging AI and software engineering problems
Work with other teams to integrate AI into our products
Create robust AI evaluation frameworks
Develop strategies to manage AI-specific challenges (latency, variance, errors)
Keep up with AI advancements, especially in language models and multi-modal AI


What Makes You A Great Fit


Experience with engineering projects, ideally related to ML or AI
Strong software engineering skills, especially with distributed systems
Proficiency in Python and ML frameworks (PyTorch, Hugging Face)
Experience with prompt engineering and deploying language models
Ability to handle and preprocess large, diverse datasets
Understanding of AI safety and responsible development
Knowledge of AI evaluation and benchmarking
Clear communication of complex AI concepts


Bonus Points For


Experience deploying AI in production environments
Cloud platform knowledge for AI deployment
Familiarity with advanced AI techniques (few-shot learning, meta-learning)
Open-source AI contributions or relevant publications
Ability to balance AI innovation with production-ready systems
Adaptability in a fast-paced, evolving AI landscape


Equal Employment Opportunity Statement

Normal Computing is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status.

Accessibility Accommodations

Normal Computing is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please let us know at accomodations@normalcomputing.ai.

Privacy Notice

By submitting your application, you agree that Normal Computing may collect, use, and store your personal information for employment-related purposes in accordance with our Privacy Policy.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer - Challenger Academy 2025
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
What if you could help companies transform their businesses using AI and machine learning? Joining KPMG as a Machine Learning Engineer means you’ll be working with a variety of clients, applying the latest developments in AI to optimize operations, enhance customer experiences, and predict future trends. Take on exciting challenges from day one and shape the future of businesses with machine learning.




Perks of joining our amazing team

You will be joining our NewTech team, who drive business transformation through innovation, automation, and data-driven insights. Our team delivers impactful projects across industries, always pushing the boundaries of AI, automation, and strategic analysis to create real value for clients. Collaboration is at the heart of everything we do, with a diverse team of business analysts, automation experts, and technology enthusiasts.




We foster a supportive, open culture where new ideas are encouraged and valued. Our team thrives on collaboration and continuous learning, ensuring everyone has opportunities for personal and professional growth. Beyond work, we enjoy social events and team-building activities that strengthen our close-knit community.




What sets us apart is our relentless focus on innovation, consistently staying ahead with the latest technology in automation and AI. Through our hands-on "consulting-by-doing" approach, we provide real-world experience from day one, empowering our team to make a tangible impact while accelerating both professional development and client success.




KPMG Challenger Academy

Are you looking for a graduate programme? We think we have something better! At KPMG, you have the freedom to shape your own career. With endless opportunities to grow, learn, and take on new challenges, the KPMG Challenger Academy is where you build a future you are excited about. As part of the Academy, you set your own goals, work on interesting client projects, and get the best training to develop yourself. To make things even better, you get your own Koach (not Coach—we did spell-check this job ad, but KPMG’s equivalent of a performance manager) to help you reach your full potential and achieve your goals.




The Academy is designed for your early career after graduating your master studies. The Academy is split into 3 dynamic off-site modules, each designed to get you started in your new role and develop you as a consultant. Regardless of whether you are a recent graduate or bring previous experience, we ensure that everyone starts from the same point with equal opportunities to grow professionally.




Curious to know more about the KPMG Challenger Academy? You can read much more here.




Do you recognize yourself in the following?

You have strong technical skills in building and deploying machine learning models, with a solid understanding of algorithms and data structures. Experience with Python and libraries like Scikit-Learn, XGBoost, Hugging Face and LangChain, FastAPI or similar frameworks is key, and you excel at optimizing models for performance and scalability. You're familiar with cloud platforms, data pipelines, and version control using Git, allowing you to integrate models into production seamlessly. Above all, you’re passionate about AI’s transformative potential and enjoy coding, designing software and implementing ML models that make AI accessible for real-world applications.




Examples of tasks that you will do:

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement AI solutions.
Design, develop, and deploy machine learning applications at scale.
Optimize model performance for real-world applications.
Integrate models into production environments using cloud platforms and Git.
Stay up-to-date and curious with emerging trends in machine learning and AI.




Are you ready to take on the challenge and become part of KPMG? Send your application today!

If you have any questions or would like more information, please contact Mathias Hoeg Boisen mhboisen@kpmg.com or on phone +45 51 16 11 77.




We are excited to receive your application. The deadline for applying is 13 April or as soon as we have found our new team member. This might be before the final deadline since we invite candidates for interviews on an ongoing basis.




Please note that we do not accept applications by e-mail to ensure GDPR compliance.




At KPMG, we are committed to developing diverse talent at all levels. We encourage all interested candidates to apply, regardless of age, race, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, religion, or ethnicity.




We can’t wait to hear from you!

Show more

Title: Machine Learning/AI konsulenter
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Er du konsulent med erfaring i Machine Learning/AI, og er du bosiddende i Danmark, med minimum 5 års professionel erfaring fra IT relaterede projekter ude hos kunder, og har du ikke før haft kontakt med os, så kunne et partnerskab med emagine måske være interessant for dig?

emagine er et high-end konsulenthus med hovedkvarter i København, der leverer skræddersyede ydelser og ekspertise ved brug af et netværk af ekspertkonsulenter.

Som freelance konsulent kan du blive inddraget i opgaver, enten som ekspertrådgiver, som en del af et emagine team, eller som en betroet konsulent ude på opgave i en af vores kunders organisation.

I Danmark har vi kontorer i København, Aarhus og Aalborg, med over 900 konsulenter ude på opgaver lige nu. I Europa har vi over 5.000 konsulenter på opgave.

Tilmeld dig vores database og få muligheden for at arbejde med nogle af de mest innovative virksomheder i branchen.

At blive medlem af vores konsulentdatabase har mange fordele, herunder:


Adgang til en bred vifte af projekter med internationale virksomheder, så du kan anvende dine færdigheder og ekspertise til projekter, der betyder noget.
Opgaver, der matcher dine færdigheder og ekspertise, hvilket sikrer, at du arbejder på projekter, der stemmer overens med dine styrker.
Kurser og kompetenceudvikling på alle niveauer med særlig erfaring inden for undervisning i projekt- program- og porteføljeledelse.
Muligheder for at udvide din portefølje af projekter og fremme din karriere


Som konsulent med Machine Learning/AI kompetencer, bør du have erfaring med en del af følgende:


Artifical Intelligence (AI)
Machine Learning (ML)
Retrieval-augmented generation (RAG)
Python
Deep Learning
SQL
Neurale Netværk
Large Language Model (LLM)
Microsoft Azure AI Studio
AutoGen
Docker
R
Algoritmer
NLP Engineering
Kubernetes
