Title: Machine Learning Researcher
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Imagine working with cutting-edge machine learning models, crunching high frequency data sets and sparring with exceptional and fun colleagues, all while taking part in scaling our business even further.

Does this sound highly appealing to you? Then you might be our new Machine Learning Researcher at Alipes Capital.




At Alipes Capital, we have been the market leader in automating the financial markets since we started back in 2008, shaping a fully automatic natural language processing system for reading and interpreting financial news.




To accomplish our mission of being the best at what we do, we understand the importance of elevating our predictive modeling standards to the highest levels. Your work will involve leading the efforts in creating a world class modeling workflow, enabling the team to seamlessly turn massive data sets of financial information into mathematical models that accurately predict movements in the financial markets.




In doing so, you will get a chance to tackle a variety of software infrastructure challenges, such as:

Development and optimization of calibration and benchmarking frameworks
Building out and implementing best practices for data preparation and dataset generation pipelines
Prototyping and releasing novel predictive architectures, especially with respect to time-series models.




You will get instant validation of your work and experience short feedback cycles, where going from inception to deployment can be a matter of hours. There will be no red tape to cut and no sales people to consult.




About the team

All of this will happen in an informal atmosphere where technical discussions are valued, and you are encouraged to take ownership of, and pride in, your work. You will impact the direction of the team, prioritize your work and choose the tools that get the job done. We are a tight-knit modeling team with fourteen passionate quantitative researchers covering 6 nationalities – eleven PhD’s and three MSc’s with expertise in statistical analysis, mathematical modeling and machine learning. We enjoy collaboration and are always willing to lend a helping hand. We are working alongside two other teams of software developers and traders that implement and conceive the mathematical models together with us. What makes this constellation work great is that all of the individual team members write code and understand that a seemingly trivial change can actually require a lot of work, and vice versa.




About you

Fluency within mathematics and statistics
Experience working with the full Machine Learning stack from data generation through model calibration and real-life validation and monitoring
Programming experience with Python, in particular data-wrangling and numerical programming
Proficiency with computer science fundamentals
A scientific and inquisitive mind




Nice to have

Experience working with ‘out-of-core’ datasets
Experience working with tools like PyTorch, Tensorflow, XGBoost and/or Catboost
Programming experience with languages like C# and C/C++
PhD or MSc degree in engineering, physics, computer science, mathematics or economics




What we can offer you

Flat hierarchy and high levels of trust and autonomy
Exciting problems to solve
Collaborative team made up of really smart and curious people
Nice office in central Copenhagen with a hybrid work model
Pension, Health Insurance and 30 days of vacation




Practicalities

To apply, please send us your CV and a cover letter telling us why you think this role is a great fit for you. If your profile looks like a good match, we will get in touch to coordinate an online technical test as a first step in the interview process.

Title: Research Scientist - Microbiome Discovery Domain - L’Oréal Group - Copenhagen
Description:
Does the intricate dance between microbes and human biology fascinate you? Are you passionate about unlocking the secrets of the microbiome to revolutionize the future of skincare? Do you thrive in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment where scientific breakthroughs are the daily goal? Then we need your passion and expertise! L'Oréal is seeking a highly motivated and innovative Research Scientist to join our Microbiome Discovery team based in Copenhagen. This is a unique opportunity to be at the forefront of cutting-edge research and to be a part of L’Oréal’s global Research & Innovation entity based in Denmark, exploring the potential of host-microbiome interactions for developing the next generation of cosmetic innovations.

As our new Research Scientist you will be instrumental in establishing our new Copenhagen-based cell lab, developing assays, and screening for groundbreaking discoveries that will transform the beauty industry.

In This Role, You Will


Design, develop, and validate cell-based assays to study host-microbiome interactions, particularly focusing on immunological mechanisms.
Establish and maintain our new cell lab, ensuring optimal functionality and adherence to best practices.
Plan and execute in vitro experiments to screen for microbiome-derived compounds or formulations with cosmetic applications.
Analyze experimental data, interpret results, and present findings to the broader research team and management.
Collaborate with internal and external partners to advance our understanding of the skin microbiome.


We Offer


The chance to be a pioneer in the exciting field of microbiome-based cosmetics.
A state-of-the-art research environment with access to cutting-edge technologies.
A collaborative and supportive team of scientists and experts.
The opportunity to see your research translate into innovative products that impact the lives of millions.
A culture that encourages creativity, innovation, and scientific rigor.


Qualifications


MS.c or Ph.D. in Immunology, Microbiology, Cell Biology, or a related field with a strong focus on host-microbiome interactions and 5 years of relevant experience.
Experience with cell culture techniques, co-culture models and immunological assays such as ELISA, flow cytometry, cytokine profiling, and cell signaling analysis.


Ideally, You Also Have


Experience with microbiome analysis techniques, including DNA extraction, PCR, and sequencing.
Experience with developing and validating new assays.
Experience with setting up and maintaining a cell culture laboratory.
Experience with primary cell isolation is seen as an advantage.


You Are


A highly motivated and independent researcher with a passion for scientific discovery.
An innovative thinker with the ability to design and execute experiments to test hypotheses.
A collaborative team player with excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
A problem-solver with a "can-do" attitude and an entrepreneurial mindset.
Passionate about translating scientific discoveries into real-world applications.
Organized and detail-oriented, with a strong commitment to data quality and integrity.


We are looking for our new Research Scientist to start as soon as possible. This is a permanent/fixed-term position. Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis. We welcome everyone to apply no matter your gender, ethnicity, physical abilities, religion, or sexual orientation.

About L'Oréal

For more than hundred years, L’Oréal believes that beauty needs Science. Science & Technology are allowing us to invent safe, trustable, sustainable & responsible beauty products and experiences that will change people’s lives.

L’Oréal Research & Innovation (R&I) has continuously invested upstream in its research with a high level of ambition. With over 4000 L'Oréal Scientists in R&I, you will join one of the discovery domains, the Microbiome domain.

With a vision to impact people’s lives through their unconscious interaction with their own microbiome we seek to solve problems through control of microbial dysbiosis, and altering the way you interact with your microbiome.

What we do at L’Oréal always has a big impact. At L’Oréal, we define success as making a positive, conscious impact. We’ve been recognized as one of the most ethical company in the world by Ethisphere®. For the seventh time in a row, L’Oréal has been recognized as a global leader in sustainable development by the international non-profit organization CDP® in three areas: combating climate change, sustainable management of water, and protecting forests, for the fourth year running. In 2023, L’Oréal was for the 6th consecutive year recognized by the Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index (GEI) for having successfully created an inclusive and equal work environment. We believe diversity fosters creativity and accelerates innovation. To ensure that our products meet the needs of every form of beauty in every culture, our team members must be as diverse and inclusive as the world itself.  For us, our job is more than just a job, it is about building a better future for others and our planet.

Freedom to Go Beyond. That's the Beauty of L'Oréal.
Show more

Title: Senior Data Science Specialist
Description:
Senior Data Science Specialist:




Do you want to be a member of an international, skilled, highly motivated and self-driven team of software developers and data scientists spanning different educational backgrounds and competences?










This team is the innovation center for an global market leader where innovation is not only welcomed but encouraged!




We are the competence center for data-driven and vision-based solutions, providing production insights and predictions by applying machine learning techniques to discrete data and vision data from production sites. These innovative solutions focus on bringing added value to the production by optimizing processes, reducing cost and not least by reducing environmental footprint.










We are now looking for a senior data science specialist to help us continue in our data-driven development. With a well structured data platform you will become a subject matter expert for all things data.




Taking a holistic approach to the Data lake and offering advanced analysis by finding correlations and trends that we can leverage towards new products. Sitting at the centre of the data value chain, you will be linked with stakeholders as well as like minded IT professionals.










What can you expect?




* An innovation driven tech team that work in a collaborative and dynamic environment

* Well defined tech stack that supports data-driven decision making

* A direct line of communication with senior management

* A focus on a healthy work-life balance

* Competitive salary and pension scheme










What do we expect?




* Previous experience with applied data science and machine learning

* Confidence with Python and SQL - Other programming languages are also welcome

* Experience translating business strategy into practical data development

* Ability to work as an individual or as a team member

* Ability to be in the office to help add to our team culture










This is a company I have personally worked with on multiple occasions, with great success!




If you want to learn more please don't hesitate to apply!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer, Computer Vision
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to develop computer vision and machine learning solutions for closing the gap between plan and reality for large scale construction projects, with the goal of minimizing waste through digitalization?

Your new role

Bringing data from offices to the construction site using 3D BIM models has long been part of our core expertise here at Dalux. Now, as one of the next steps in our effort to digitalize the construction industry, we are working to bring data from the construction site back into the office using modern Computer Vision techniques.

As a Machine Learning Engineer in our Computer Vision section, you will be a key part in delivery of the solutions into production. You will participate in the full lifecycle of the ML systems we build, while spearheading the model deployment, performance monitoring and maintenance, to ensure the reproducibility of our experiments and traceability of our pipelines in production. As part of the R&D team, you will be expected to keep up to date with the state-of-the-art in the ML/CV area as well as new techniques and processes.

Your background

We believe you…


Have 3+ years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, MLOps Engineer, or similar.
Have a proven track record of bringing machine learning models to production.
Have a solid theoretical foundation from a degree in computer science, engineering, IT or similar.
Can work both independently and as part of a team.


Most important is your problem-solving attitude, passion for software craftmanship, and the ambition to participate in the full lifecycle of our machine learning solutions.

Our tech...


Python
PyTorch
C++
OpenCV
AWS
MLFlow
Kubernetes


We are focused on using the right tools for the job, and as such the list of technologies may change depending on our needs and new offerings.

What To Expect As a Daluxian

In our organization the way from idea to product is short, combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.

You will become a part of a highly skilled team of passionate individuals driven by the wish to explore new and reshape existing technologies. As Dalux is a software company, we want half of the company to consist of Software Developers. All our software development happens at our head office at Vibenshuset in Copenhagen.

We offer...


Central location in Copenhagen, focus on work/life balance without any overtime, and no dress code.
An active social environment with monthly events and social clubs.
Flat communication in our organization, where the way from idea to product is short combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.
You’ll join a highly specialized, international team with room for creativity and professional growth.
Strong focus on diversity and inclusion – your ideas are heard, and opportunities are available to all.
Attractive employee benefits such as health insurance, lunch plan, coffee and fruit, free fitness facilities, and parking garage.
Focus on your development and well-being, with support for both professional goals and personal growth.


Ready for the next step

If Dalux sounds like a place where you could develop and contribute to the high-quality software, we would gladly accept your application. We will be having ongoing interviews.

If you have any questions, feel free to contact Simone Jena Berg Christensen.

Who Is Dalux

Dalux is a Danish software company founded in 2005 by Ph.D. Bent Dalgaard and Torben Dalgaard. Dalux’ products are aimed at making the construction industry smarter and more effective as it is the world’s 2nd largest industry and amongst the least digitalized. Our user-friendly digital tools and Building Information Modelling-technology (also known as BIM) is used in more than 160 countries globally.

We are crazy about cool technology and have experience being first movers on new tech. Our products are based on our unique 3D BIM-technology and makes use of AR - all developed entirely by Dalux.

Application deadline:

Ongoing

Title: Data Scientist, Computer Vision
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to develop computer vision and machine learning solutions for closing the gap between plan and reality for large scale construction projects, with the goal of minimizing waste through digitalization?

Your new role

Bringing data from offices to the construction site using 3D BIM models has long been part of our core expertise here at Dalux. Now, as one of the next steps in our effort to digitalize the construction industry, we are working to bring data from the construction site back into the office using modern Computer Vision techniques.

As a Data Scientist in our Computer Vision section, you will develop and deploy deep learning models to improve the understanding, alignment and correspondence between 3D models of the construction site and video data gathered using our vSLAM system. As part of an R&D team, you will work on discovery of new solutions through research and rapid prototyping, and translating the findings into delivery of high quality solutions to complex computer vision problems.

Your background

We believe you…


Have a solid theoretical foundation from a degree in computer science, engineering, IT or similar.
Have a hands-on experience with software development using C++, Python or C#. It is important that you have reached solid coding standards and strive for continuous improvement.
Have a machine learning experience or trained in the area. Hands-on experience with PyTorch and MLFlow is a plus.
Have computer vision experience or trained in the area. Hands-on experience with OpenCV is a plus.
Can work both independently and as part of a team.


Most important is your problem-solving attitude, passion for software craftmanship, and the ambition to participate in the full lifecycle of our machine learning solutions.

Our tech...


C++
OpenGL
Python
PyTorch
MLFlow
Kubernetes


We are focused on using the right tools for the job, and as such the list of technologies may change depending on our needs and new offerings.

What To Expect As a Daluxian

In our organization the way from idea to product is short, combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.

You will become a part of a highly skilled team of passionate individuals driven by the wish to explore new and reshape existing technologies. As Dalux is a software company, we want half of the company to consist of Software Developers. All our software development happens at our head office at Vibenshuset in Copenhagen.

We offer...


Central location in Copenhagen, focus on work/life balance without any overtime, and no dress code.
An active social environment with monthly events and social clubs.
Flat communication in our organization, where the way from idea to product is short combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.
You’ll join a highly specialized, international team with room for creativity and professional growth.
Strong focus on diversity and inclusion – your ideas are heard, and opportunities are available to all.
Attractive employee benefits such as health insurance, lunch plan, coffee and fruit, free fitness facilities, and parking garage.
Focus on your development and well-being, with support for both professional goals and personal growth.


Ready for the next step

If Dalux sounds like a place where you could develop and contribute to the high-quality software, we would gladly accept your application. We will be having ongoing interviews.

If you have any questions, feel free to contact Simone Jena Berg Christensen.

Who Is Dalux

Dalux is a Danish software company founded in 2005 by Ph.D. Bent Dalgaard and Torben Dalgaard. Dalux’ products are aimed at making the construction industry smarter and more effective as it is the world’s 2nd largest industry and amongst the least digitalized. Our user-friendly digital tools and Building Information Modelling-technology (also known as BIM) is used in more than 160 countries globally.

We are crazy about cool technology and have experience being first movers on new tech. Our products are based on our unique 3D BIM-technology and makes use of AR - all developed entirely by Dalux.

Application deadline:

Ongoing

Your new role

As a Data Scientist in our Computer Vision section, you will develop and deploy deep learning models to improve the understanding, alignment and correspondence between 3D models of the construction site and video data gathered using our vSLAM system. Title: Data Science Konsulent
Description:
Brænder du for data og analyser? Drømmer du om at blive en del af et ungt og dynamisk team? Bliv en del af Dataminds, et innovativt konsulenthus med stor erfaring inden for Data Science, Business Intelligence og Analytics.

Hos Dataminds er vi på jagt efter passionerede Data Science-konsulenter til at styrke vores team. Med en solid baggrund inden for dataanalyse og en uudslukkelig nysgerrighed, får du muligheden for at sætte dit præg på udviklingen af databaserede løsninger, der dagligt hjælper vores kunder og kolleger med at nå deres forretningsmål.

 

Du vil være med til at:

Løse komplekse forretningsmæssige problemstillinger med en datadrevet tilgang.
Udvikle og implementere analytiske modeller og BI-løsninger, der skaber indsigt og værdi.
Arbejde tæt sammen med kunder og kolleger for at sikre skræddersyede løsninger.

 

Vi forestiller os, at du:

Vi forestiller os, at du er uddannet cand.merc, cand.oecon, eller lignende.
Har erfaring med SQL, Power BI, Excel, R eller lignende værktøjer.
Har en analytisk tilgang og kan formidle komplekse data på en forståelig måde.
Er vant til at arbejde agilt og trives i både selvstændige og teamorienterede roller.
Praktisk erfaring fra tidligere stillinger, relevante kurser osv. er en fordel, men ikke et krav.

 

Det vil være en fordel, hvis du:

Er systematisk, struktureret og kvalitetsbevidst i opgaveløsningen.
Forstår vigtigheden af overholdelse af aftaler og deadlines.
Demonstrerer en proaktiv tilgang og er direkte og vedholdende, når idéer skal formuleres, udveksles og afprøves for at nå løsninger.
Har lyst til at udvikle dig fagligt.
Er i stand til hurtigt at sætte dig ind i og anvende nye teknologier.
Er i stand til at strukturere din egen arbejdsdag og tage ansvar for dine opgaver.
Er klar til at tage dialogen direkte med kunder.

 

Vi tilbyder: 

En karriere hos Dataminds, der byder på mere end bare et job. Vi tilbyder en karrierevej, hvor du kan udvikle dine faglige og personlige færdigheder i et miljø, der værdsætter innovation, samarbejde og vidensdeling. Et fællesskab, hvor vi altid stræber efter at være de bedste. Vores dynamiske og ungdommelige arbejdsmiljø byder på alt fra bordtennis til sociale arrangementer, og vi understøtter din trivsel med gode arbejdsforhold, frokostordning, pension, sundhedsforsikring, m.m.

 

Er Dataminds din næste destination? 

Arbejdspladsen er beliggende centralt i Ankersgade, tæt på byens puls og i gåafstand til Aarhus Hovedbanegård.

Hvis du er klar til at tage skridtet fuldt ud og blive en nøglespiller i vores succes, så send din ansøgning til mail@dataminds.com og vedlæg dit CV og karakterblad. Vi ser frem til at høre, hvordan du kan bidrage til vores team hos Dataminds.

Kontakt Kim Lillesøe på +45 25 16 19 59 for en uforpligtende snak om mulighederne.

Bliv en del af vores rejse mod succes og innovation - ansøg nu!

Show more

Title: Join Deloitte as a Software Developer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Company Description

With more than 3000 employees Deloitte is the largest audit and consultancy firm in Denmark. We tailor solutions across Audit, Tax, Financial Advisory Services, Enterprise Risk Services, and Technology & Transformation.

Are you curious about modern software development and looking for your next challenge? At Deloitte Engineering, we are seeking recent or soon-to-be graduates, who want to take an active role in improving their technical and problem-solving competencies while growing our Engineering practice.

About The Team

We, the Engineering offering of Deloitte Technology & Transformation Denmark, are on the lookout for additional team-players for our quickly growing practice of software engineers, architects, cloud consultants, and IT management consultants. We assist our clients, some of the largest companies, agencies, and organizations in Denmark and the Nordics, on the implementation of new cloud-native systems as part of their digital transformation – and we need you to help build their opportunities and meet their challenges!

Together, we will accelerate your career towards becoming a proficient software developer. At Deloitte, we are committed to empowering you throughout your career development. As a new employee, you are assigned a talent manager to support your career aspirations and development. You will also be part of a tech community with monthly meetings in which we share knowledge, investigate new topics, and upskill within relevant technologies and methodologies.

Job Description

As a software developer at the Engineering offering, you will work with many different aspects of development, from writing code to testing it. You will work closely with both clients and internal stakeholders to ensure that our solutions meet their business needs and technical requirements. Our client assignments can vary greatly, but common for all of them are that we strive to work with the technologies that the client prefers. Regardless of the technology, we provide you with the opportunity and tools needed to learn and grow within all of them.

In this role, you will make an impact by:


Developing applications and solutions of all sizes, frequently in Agile settings (SAFE/Scrum). This includes both backend and frontend development.
Assisting in the implementation of CI/CD pipelines, infrastructure as code (IaC), and adopting DevOps practices to streamline development workflows.
Building internal capabilities through community tasks, maybe within new business areas.
Joining in on workshops and sales pitches and contributing to proposals for new client projects.


Qualifications

You hold or will hold a Master’s degree, preferably with a focus on Computer Science, Engineering, or other relevant fields such as Information Technology or Software Development. Perhaps you have experience from previous part- or full-time software development positions, utilizing your analytical and problem-solving skill set. Furthermore, you are either a native Danish speaker or highly proficient in written and spoken Danish.

What you bring to the team:


Experience in Java, C#/.NET, JavaScript, TypeScript, or one or more other widely used programming languages.
Some experience with modern DevOps practices such as CI/CD, Infrastructure as Code, and test automation.
You have strong analytical skills and a focus on quality and detail.
You are a positive-minded teammate with the ability to work and solve problems in a structured way.
You can communicate and express yourself clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing.


Even if you do not see yourself in all the bullets above, we still encourage you to apply if you believe your skills can make an impact on our team.

What we can offer you:

We highly appreciate the knowledge, experience, and perspectives our consultants bring, and in exchange, we make sure they develop professionally, meet their career goals, and enjoy their time with Deloitte. Therefore, other than an incredible social calendar, we offer our consultants:


Enrollment in the Consultant Academy, which is our training program for building essential Consultant skills. The Academy takes you to exciting locations to learn from leading professionals in their respective fields.
Focused career development by assigning you a talent manager who acts as your mentor and guides you in your professional journey in Deloitte.
The opportunity to participate in projects and internal work with our different market offerings to find the right fit for you.


On the social aspect, Deloitte Technology & Transformation is second to none. We offer everything from various sports communities to festivals – not to mention the yearly Trip where all our colleagues come together off-site to create lasting memories. Additionally, we have a strong sense of belonging and community in Engineering, and we support each other every day to make an impact with our clients and to promote personal and professional development.

Additional Information

Do you want to be part of our team?

Click the "I am interested" button above if you are ready to join our team.

Send your application, CV, and other relevant documents by 09.05.2025. We process applications and arrange interviews continually, so we recommend that you apply as soon as possible.

Expected start date: 01.09.2025.

Please do not hesitate to contact Sophus Benee Olsen at +45 30 93 61 88 if you have any questions about the position.

We encourage all candidates to apply for the position regardless of, e.g., age, gender (gender identity and gender expression), sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, nationality, or disability.

By applying for this job, you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We have designed these standards to provide a consistent and exceptional Deloitte employee experience globally.

We look forward to connecting with you!

In Deloitte, you will find passionate, caring people who are curious by nature and striving to evolve. We value our different skills, perspectives and experiences and foster an environment where innovative powers thrive. To us, success is the feeling that the work we are doing will outlast us. The impact we make is not about what we achieve as individuals, but how we enable those around us to be their very best. From professional development to leadership opportunities, we empower our people to be extraordinary by playing to their strengths – because that is how we can make a difference.
Show more

Title: MLOps Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Pandora is the World’s largest jewellery brand, known for affordable luxury, innovative design and our high-quality craftsmanship. Founded in 1982 in Copenhagen, Denmark, by Per Enevoldsen and his wife Winnie, Pandora started as a small jewelry shop and has since grown into the globally recognized brand it is today.

At Pandora, we are transforming the retail experience by leveraging our vast data combined with cutting-edge technology. Our mission is to provide an exceptional shopping experience to our customers by leveraging data-driven insights and innovative solutions across our business. We are looking for a talented MLOps Engineer to join our dynamic team and help us shape the future of retail.

Job Summary:

As an MLOps Engineer at Pandora, you will play a play a critical role in deploying, monitoring, and optimizing machine learning models in production environments. The ideal candidate will bridge the gap between our AI Team and our Data Platform engineers, ensuring the seamless integration of ML models into scalable and reliable systems. In this role you will design and implement robust MLOps pipelines, automate model training and deployment processes, and monitor the performance of ML systems, including systems for GenAI. Your expertise in cloud platforms, containerization, and CI/CD tools will drive the operational efficiency of our AI and machine learning initiatives. We encourage creative problem-solving, continuous learning, and work-life balance in a supportive environment.

Key Responsibilities:


Design, develop and maintain end-to-end MLOps pipelines for model deployment, monitoring, maintenance, and scalability.
Automate the retraining, testing, and validation processes for ML models.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data science, software engineering and DevOps, to integrate ML models into production systems.
Monitor model performance, diagnose issues, and implement improvements.
Ensure scalability, reliability, and compliance of ML systems in production.
Optimize infrastructure costs while maintaining high system performance.
Stay up-to-date with the latest developments in MLOps, machine learning and AI, and apply new techniques to improve existing models and processes.



Qualifications:


Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, or a related field.
Experience:
Solid experience as a MLOps Engineer, Machine Learning Engineer, DevOps Engineer, or similar role.
Experience in the retail industry or e-commerce is highly desirable.
Technical Skills:
Strong experience with Infrastructure as Code frameworks and languages (Terraform, Bicep or ARM)
Strong programming skills in Python and experience with ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.).
Hands-on experience with containerization (Docker) and orchestration tools (Kubernetes).
Proficiency in CI/CD tools and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud).
Knowledge of model monitoring and evaluation metrics.
Familiarity with version control systems, such as Git, and model versioning tools like MLflow or DVC.
Experience with Generative AI product deployment is desirable.
Experience with big data using Databricks, Snowflake, Apache Spark or Hadoop is desirable.
System level architecture understanding including scaling, MLOps, model/data monitoring, and ensuring a deterministic pipeline.
Soft Skills:
Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
A proactive attitude and a passion for continuous learning and innovation.

Our Pandora Values:

We dream, are visionary and go beyond the obvious. 

We dare to pursue bold ambitions with courage and speed. 

We care deeply about each other, our customers and the planet we all share. Every day we strive to be a fulfilling workplace, where each of us can thrive and contribute, where talents can grow, and 

We deliver on our promises to colleagues, customers, partners and stakeholders.

We are focused on building a diverse and inclusive workforce. If you’re excited about this role, but do not meet 100% of the qualifications listed above, we encourage you to apply.

Did we get your attention

If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora’s future, please do not hesitate to apply. We look forward to hearing from you!

We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.

Icing on the cake

You will be working out of our beautiful Head Office in Copenhagen V, established in 2016 and designed to unite and inspire our teams. Besides our beautiful interior design we are also proud of our LEED Gold Certification for Energy and Environmental Design. This means that we use as few natural resources as possible and that we use them with respect. The result is a professional and dynamic space that is unique, comfortable and inspirational – and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here or comes to visit.

About Pandora

Established in 1982, Pandora designs, manufactures and markets hand-finished jewellery made from high-quality materials at affordable prices. Pandora’s products are available in more than 100 countries on six continents through more than 6,500 points of sale, including around 2,500 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 32,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery at two LEED certified facilities in Thailand, using mainly recycled silver and gold. The company plans to be carbon neutral by 2025 and has joined the Science Based Targets initiative to reduce emissions across its full value chain. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated a revenue of DKK 28.1 billion in 2023. 

At Pandora, we believe that creating an inclusive and diverse workplace and reflecting societal diversity in our customer engagement is essential to delivering on our company purpose: to give a voice to people’s loves. We dedicate ourselves to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and diversity where everyone feels respected and valued.
Show more
HTML:
Pandora is the World’s largest jewellery brand, known for affordable luxury, innovative design and our high-quality craftsmanship. Founded in 1982 in Copenhagen, Denmark, by Per Enevoldsen and his wife Winnie, Pandora started as a small jewelry shop and has since grown into the globally recognized brand it is today.

At Pandora, we are transforming the retail experience by leveraging our vast data combined with cutting-edge technology. Our mission is to provide an exceptional shopping experience to our customers by leveraging data-driven insights and innovative solutions across our business. We are looking for a talented MLOps Engineer to join our dynamic team and help us shape the future of retail.

Job Summary:

As an MLOps Engineer at Pandora, you will play a play a critical role in deploying, monitoring, and optimizing machine learning models in production environments. The ideal candidate will bridge the gap between our AI Team and our Data Platform engineers, ensuring the seamless integration of ML models into scalable and reliable systems. In this role you will design and implement robust MLOps pipelines, automate model training and deployment processes, and monitor the performance of ML systems, including systems for GenAI. Your expertise in cloud platforms, containerization, and CI/CD tools will drive the operational efficiency of our AI and machine learning initiatives. We encourage creative problem-solving, continuous learning, and work-life balance in a supportive environment.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Design, develop and maintain end-to-end MLOps pipelines for model deployment, monitoring, maintenance, and scalability.
  • Automate the retraining, testing, and validation processes for ML models.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data science, software engineering and DevOps, to integrate ML models into production systems.
  • Monitor model performance, diagnose issues, and implement improvements.
  • Ensure scalability, reliability, and compliance of ML systems in production.
  • Optimize infrastructure costs while maintaining high system performance.
  • Stay up-to-date with the latest developments in MLOps, machine learning and AI, and apply new techniques to improve existing models and processes.


Qualifications:

  • Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, or a related field.
  • Experience:
    • Solid experience as a MLOps Engineer, Machine Learning Engineer, DevOps Engineer, or similar role.
    • Experience in the retail industry or e-commerce is highly desirable.
  • Technical Skills:
    • Strong experience with Infrastructure as Code frameworks and languages (Terraform, Bicep or ARM)
    • Strong programming skills in Python and experience with ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.).
    • Hands-on experience with containerization (Docker) and orchestration tools (Kubernetes).
    • Proficiency in CI/CD tools and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud).
    • Knowledge of model monitoring and evaluation metrics.
    • Familiarity with version control systems, such as Git, and model versioning tools like MLflow or DVC.
    • Experience with Generative AI product deployment is desirable.
    • Experience with big data using Databricks, Snowflake, Apache Spark or Hadoop is desirable.
    • System level architecture understanding including scaling, MLOps, model/data monitoring, and ensuring a deterministic pipeline.
  • Soft Skills:
    • Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
    • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
    • A proactive attitude and a passion for continuous learning and innovation.
Our Pandora Values:

We dream, are visionary and go beyond the obvious. 

We dare to pursue bold ambitions with courage and speed. 

We care deeply about each other, our customers and the planet we all share. Every day we strive to be a fulfilling workplace, where each of us can thrive and contribute, where talents can grow, and 

We deliver on our promises to colleagues, customers, partners and stakeholders.

We are focused on building a diverse and inclusive workforce. If you’re excited about this role, but do not meet 100% of the qualifications listed above, we encourage you to apply.

Did we get your attention

If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora’s future, please do not hesitate to apply. We look forward to hearing from you!

We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.

Icing on the cake

You will be working out of our beautiful Head Office in Copenhagen V, established in 2016 and designed to unite and inspire our teams. Besides our beautiful interior design we are also proud of our LEED Gold Certification for Energy and Environmental Design. This means that we use as few natural resources as possible and that we use them with respect. The result is a professional and dynamic space that is unique, comfortable and inspirational – and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here or comes to visit.

About Pandora

Established in 1982, Pandora designs, manufactures and markets hand-finished jewellery made from high-quality materials at affordable prices. Pandora’s products are available in more than 100 countries on six continents through more than 6,500 points of sale, including around 2,500 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 32,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery at two LEED certified facilities in Thailand, using mainly recycled silver and gold. The company plans to be carbon neutral by 2025 and has joined the Science Based Targets initiative to reduce emissions across its full value chain. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated a revenue of DKK 28.1 billion in 2023. 

At Pandora, we believe that creating an inclusive and diverse workplace and reflecting societal diversity in our customer engagement is essential to delivering on our company purpose: to give a voice to people’s loves. We dedicate ourselves to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and diversity where everyone feels respected and valued.

Title: Expert Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job ID: 27380

Are you ready to help shape the future of AI & Generative AI at Scandinavia’s largest bank, working alongside a dynamic, fast-paced team?

The Group AI Center of Excellence is an established unit within Group Data Management focusing on delivering and enabling generative AI use cases across the organisation. The unit provides reusable AI Assets that are developed in conjunction with business stakeholders to be leveraged by a wide variety of use cases.

We are now looking for an Expert Data Scientist who is interested in working in the field of Generative AI with use-cases across the bank. You will work closely with data scientists, ML engineers, and business stakeholders to take AI and Generative AI applications from concept to production, ensuring they are developed in an ethical, safe, and sustainable way.

About This Opportunity

Welcome to the Applied Data Science team. Your passion for working with people from both a technical and a business background, coupled with your curiosity for AI and new innovations like Generative AI, makes you well-suited for this position. As Nordea pioneers its way into an AI and Gen AI driven future, you will thrive by embracing a dynamic environment, fostering collaboration, and maintaining an open and adaptable mindset.

What you will be doing:


Design and build scalable, reliable AI solutions, using existing assets or creating something new from scratch
Ensure our Generative AI applications are developed from idea to production, meeting all necessary requirements for smooth and successful deployment
Design and build internal and reusable AI Assets and Services to leverage in multiple use case development projects, accelerating its time to market
Integrate our systems with external tools, like vector databases, LLMs, and AI services. Your work will make sure everything plays nicely together!
Stay on top of cutting-edge technologies by exploring and recommending the latest and greatest AI tools and services. Your insights will keep us ahead of the curve!


Our AI team culture is built on collaboration, continuous learning and innovation. We foster an open environment where diverse ideas thrive, encouraging everyone to push the boundaries of technology while supporting each other´s growth. With a strong focus on well-being, we prioritize work-life balance and encourage open communication.

At Nordea, inclusion and diversity are at the heart of our values. We believe that a diverse workforce drives innovation, fosters creativity and creates a more supportive workplace for all. The role is based in Høje Taastrup, Helsinki, or Stockholm.

Who You Are

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.

To succeed in this role, we believe that you:


Embrace a growth mindset, where you enjoy taking initiative and bringing solutions
Enjoy problem solving, and tackling challenges
Are an awesome team member and you have a strong ability to inspire people to take action


Your experience and background:


BSc, MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Engineering Physics, relevant technical field
10+ years of experience in testing, maintaining, launching AI/ML products, working with MLOps best practices and DevOps environment (CI/CD pipelines, Docker, container orchestration)
Experience in training, evaluation, fine-tuning and deployment of predictive models; including feature selection, hyper-parameter tuning, error analysis and data visualisation
Experience in Generative AI (Large Language Models, Embeddings Models, building RAG and agentic solutions)
Experience working with public cloud providers (AWS, Azure or GCP), especially their serverless, generative AI (e.g., AWS Bedrock), ML (e.g., AWS SageMaker), or data storage services as well as Infrastructure as Code (IaC)
Skilled at transforming complex ideas into clear, engaging explanations—whether you're presenting to a technical team or breaking things down for non-experts


If this sounds like you, get in touch!

Next steps

We kindly ask you to submit your application as soon as possible, but no later than 23/03/2025 . We will ongoingly be reviewing applications and conducting interviews as we receive them, and might close the recruitment process before the posting end date. Any applications or CVs sent by email, direct messages, or any other channel than our application forms, will not be accepted or considered.

If you have any questions about the role or this recruitment process, please reach out to our tech recruiter and main point of contact Anna Dahlström, anna.dahlstrom@consult.nordea.com .

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

Only for candidates in Sweden: For union information, please contact Finansförbundet at finansforbundet@nordea.com or SACO at SacoNordea@nordea.com .

Title: Senior Data Scientist for Performance Management and Analytics
Description:
As a Data Scientist, you will enhance predictive analytics, build automation and drive impactful improvements across the organisation.

Data Scientist specialising in process performance
As a Data Scientist specialising in process performance, you will enhance and automate predictive performance models. You will unlock new potential through AI and machine learning to predict outcomes while ensuring the consistent use of standardised data, methods and measures across the organisation. Additionally, you will support and validate critical KPIs.

Systematic is rated at CMMI Maturity Level 5, a distinction held by only a few companies worldwide. Your work will help maintain this high maturity level through clear and impactful process performance reporting combined with effective measurement of our improvement initiatives.

This is a newly established role, created as part of our ambition to elevate our performance management capability to the next level!

In this role, you will collaborate with teams across the organisation to turn data into actionable insights, ensuring that our processes are optimised and consistent and aligned with business goals. Your key responsibilities include:


Developing and validating process-performance models:
Gathering and validating data to build reliable models that reflect business needs.
Automating and improving reporting:
Enhancing quarterly process-performance baseline reporting and contributing to the Wall of Fame initiative.
Supporting master data quality.
Analysing data to provide the insights needed for precise and quantitative decisions.
Automating and improving prediction through the use of statistical techniques, machine learning and/or AI.
Participating in CMMI Appraisals.



The team
You will be part of a small, dedicated team of highly skilled specialists. Organised within the Finance department, the team collaborates closely with our internal Business Intelligence team and our Business Process Management team. Most importantly, it works across the organisation to support our programme managers in achieving process performance objectives. The team’s mission is to ensure, maintain and enhance a high level of maturity throughout Systematic.

Driven by automation and predictive analysis
We are looking for an experienced and driven candidate with a relevant bachelor’s or master’s degree who is passionate about automation and predictive analysis.

You thrive on working with data, statistics and numbers, and your structured approach ensures high-quality results.
At the same time, you have the curiosity and creativity to think outside the box and find innovative solutions.
We expect you to have several years of experience with R, VBA, robotics or similar, and the ability to leverage these technologies to drive automations.
You are proactive, motivated to push things forward and you enjoy working at the intersection of data, technology and business optimisation.



Please note that you must be able to present a clean criminal record and have lived in a NATO/EU country for the past seven years as we work with security-classified projects. Read more here.

Never stop developing
Systematic is truly international, proudly Danish and uniquely people centric. Together, we write intelligent and innovative code to drive progress and improve lives. We develop IT solutions that make a real difference where it matters most. This is why we never stop developing. Here, there is room to be professional and personal. Systematic is not just a place to work but a place to belong.

You can look forward to joining our Employees Club, which organises almost 100 social/professional events a year – plenty to choose from. Our colleagues also highlight our canteen, which serves a variety of delicious and healthy dishes each day. Finally, we are always up for a friendly game of padel at our padel court in Aarhus!

Start your development here
We will be assessing applications on an ongoing basis as we wish to welcome our new colleague as soon as possible, so click Apply Now and send us your CV today. If you have any questions, you are always welcome to contact us on tel. +45 8943 2000 and ask for Bettina Damm, Senior Specialist.

Get in touch

Sofie Heiner Emborg

Senior Talent Acquisition Consultant


Show more

Title: Projektingeniør - Aalborg
Description:
Er du i dit es, når du programmerer PLC eller SCADA-applikationer og udvikler software? Trives du i et uformelt miljø, hvor godt kollegaskab og samarbejde er nøgleord?

Så er det måske dig, der er vores kommende kollega. På kontoret i Aalborg er vi et team af medarbejdere med stærke specialistkompetencer inden for automation. Vi arbejder med komplekse totalløsninger – fra projektering til aflevering, og oplever høj kundetilfredshed samt stor efterspørgsel.

Din nye hverdag som projektingeniør hos Init

Som Projektingeniør Hos Init Vil Du Udvikle Skræddersyede Løsninger Til Vores Kunder På Både Store Og Små Projekter. Du Vil Deltage i Alle Faser Af Projektet – Fra Det Indledende Kundemøde Til Implementering, Test Og Aflevering. Dine Arbejdsopgaver Vil Bl.a. Omfatte


Design, programmering og implementering af PLC/SCADA-styrede automationsløsninger
Fejlfinding, vedligeholdelse og optimering af eksisterende programmer og udstyr
Tværfagligt samarbejde internt og eksternt for at sikre succesfuld integration af dine automationsløsninger
Udvikling og dokumentation af automationsstrategier og -procedurer


Du vil blive en del af vores projektorganisation, der arbejder inden for forskellige forretningsområder såsom Marine, Energi, Power-to-X og Forsyning. Dine kompetencer og interesser afgør, hvilke af vores forretningsområder du kommer til at indgå i.

Hvem er du?

Vi Leder Efter En Kollega, Der Har En Baggrund Som Ingeniør, Maskinmester, Automationsteknolog Eller Lignende Og Har Erfaring Med PLC-programmering Fra En Tilsvarende Rolle. Du Er God Til At Overskue Selv Komplekse Processer Og Programmering. Er Du Nysgerrig På Ny Teknologi Og Ny Læring, Er Det Bestemt En Fordel. Derudover Ser Vi Gerne, At Du


Er god til at kommunikere med kolleger, kunder og leverandører – både på dansk og engelsk
Kan arbejde både selvstændigt og i teamsamarbejder og går struktureret til dine arbejdsopgaver
Er en holdspiller og en vellidt kollega, som forstår vigtigheden af at sparre og dele ud af din viden


Hvorfor blive en del af Init?

Som Vores Nye Kollega Bliver Du En Del Af En Læringsorienteret Arbejdsplads Med Spændende Automationsprojekter Og Et Stærkt Fællesskab. Vi Tror På At Gode Relationer Og Høj Kvalitet Går Hånd i Hånd. Hos Os Vil Du Opleve


En nærværende ledelse, der prioriterer din trivsel og udvikling
Mulighed for ansvar og indflydelse på projekterne – samt stor frihed til selv at tilrettelægge dit arbejde
En konkurrencedygtig lønpakke
En kultur, hvor der er let til grin og højt til loftet understøttet af diverse sociale arrangementer – for eksempel grillaftener, fredagsbar, teambuilding og skiture


Hvad er det for et team du bliver en del af?

I Init er vi mange forskellige faggrupper der arbejder sammen. Dit team vil, som udgangspunkt, ofte bestå af maskinmestre, ingeniører eller lignende teknikere, der også fungerer som programmører. Aldersspredningen hos kollegerne er typisk 25-65 år, hvilket virkelig giver god grobund for erfaringsudveksling og mentorskab. Alle har kundekontakt og trives med proaktivt og positivt at udfordre kunden, der hvor vi ser muligheder for at forbedre slutproduktet.

Lyder det som noget for dig? Så glæder vi os til at høre fra dig!

Du ansøger stillingen ved at udfylde formularen og uploade dit CV samt evt. en ansøgning.

Hvis du har spørgsmål eller blot er nysgerrig på at høre mere om rollen og Init, er du meget velkommen til at kontakte Afdelingschef Hans Jacob Møller på mail: hajm@initgroup.com eller tlf. +45 25143814.

Om Init

Du bliver en del af Init – en virksomhed i vækst, som har en ambition om at samle de bedste virksomheder og mennesker inden for Industriel IT og Automation. Vi ved Init er summen af vores medarbejdere og kolleger. Derfor værner vi om god kultur og et motiverende arbejdsmiljø, hvor vi vægter trivsel og udvikling. I dag er vi i Danmark ca. 450 medarbejdere fordelt på mere end 20 lokationer. Vores motto – ”We are Init together” – gælder både, når vi samarbejder med kolleger om at gøre Init til en attraktiv arbejdsplads, og når vi samarbejder med kunder for at forme fremtiden inden for Industriel IT og Automation.

Apply

Share in your network
Show more

Aldersspredningen hos kollegerne er typisk 25-65 år, hvilket virkelig giver god grobund for erfaringsudveksling og mentorskab. Alle har kundekontakt og trives med proaktivt og positivt at udfordre kunden, der hvor vi ser muligheder for at forbedre slutproduktet.

Lyder det som noget for dig? Så glæder vi os til at høre fra dig!

Du ansøger stillingen ved at udfylde formularen og uploade dit CV samt evt. en ansøgning.

Hvis du har spørgsmål eller blot er nysgerrig på at høre mere om rollen og Init, er du meget velkommen til at kontakte Afdelingschef Hans Jacob Møller på mail: hajm@initgroup.com eller tlf. +45 25143814.

Om Init

Du bliver en del af Init – en virksomhed i vækst, som har en ambition om at samle de bedste virksomheder og mennesker inden for Industriel IT og Automation. Vi ved Init er summen af vores medarbejdere og kolleger. Derfor værner vi om god kultur og et motiverende arbejdsmiljø, hvor vi vægter trivsel og udvikling. I dag er vi i Danmark ca. 450 medarbejdere fordelt på mere end 20 lokationer. Vores motto – ”We are Init together” – gælder både, når vi samarbejder med kolleger om at gøre Init til en attraktiv arbejdsplads, og når vi samarbejder med kunder for at forme fremtiden inden for Industriel IT og Automation.

Apply

Share in your network

Title: Software Engineer Data Scientist
Place: Rom By, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
CHE COSA CERCHIAMO

Rheinmetall Italia S.p.A sta cercando un/una Software Engineer Data Scientist da inserire all’interno dell'unità Sviluppo Software, per la propria sede di Roma.

Siamo leader mondiale nella Difesa e Sicurezza, operiamo in oltre 60 paesi come parte di uno dei principali gruppi industriali europei, Rheinmetall AG e siamo l’unica azienda nel settore della Difesa nel novero dei 40 titoli tedeschi a maggiore capitalizzazione e liquidità quotati sul segmento “Prime Standard” della Borsa di Francoforte (Dax 40).

Siamo un'azienda che sta affrontando un processo di evoluzione e trasformazione digitale in grado di creare opportunità di carriera in un ambiente di apprendimento e sviluppo continuo.

Etica, integrità, sostenibilità, inclusione, customer-centricity e innovazione sono i nostri valori da cui discende l'impegno per le nostre persone.

Sei una persona innovativa che ricerca il miglioramento continuo in tutto quello che fa?

Ti piace lavorare in team per migliorare i processi e le prestazioni della funzione in cui lavori?

Vuoi avere un ruolo attivo, che ti venga riconosciuto, nella crescita aziendale?

Vuoi lavorare con i migliori tecnici e/o ingegneri presenti nel mercato della difesa?

Vuoi acquisire nuove competenze e soft skills?

In qualità di Software Engineer Data Scientist sarai inserito/a in un team rivolto alla ricerca dell’eccellenza, e sarai coinvolto/a nello sviluppo e nell’implementazione di soluzioni AI e di analisi avanzata dei dati, che assumono un ruolo strategico e mission-critical in una molteplicità di contesti. Lavorerai a stretto contatto con ingegneri e altri professionisti del settore, all’interno di team multidisciplinari, seguendo le pratiche Agile per la progettazione e realizzazione di modelli e pipeline di data processing.

Il Software Engineer nella funzione di Data Scientistsarà responsabile della raccolta, elaborazione e modellazione dei dati, nonché dell’implementazione di soluzioni di Machine Learning/Deep Learning di alta qualità, garantendone la validazione e la manutenzione. Collabora con il team, documenta il lavoro per assicurare la consegna di prodotti e analisi efficienti e funzionali, infine apprende costantemente nuove pratiche, framework e algoritmi di Intelligenza Artificiale.

La posizione prevede la progettazione e l’implementazione di modelli predittivi, di pipeline di elaborazione dati robuste, di alta qualità, che assicurino affidabilità, efficienza, sicurezza e manutenibilità. Verrà curato l’intero ciclo di vita dei progetti di AI: dall’analisi dei requisiti e della qualità dei dati, attraverso la definizione dei modelli e la loro validazione, fino all’integrazione su infrastrutture di calcolo on-premise o cloud.

Le tue principali attività saranno:



Analisi dei requisiti di sistema e studi di fattibilità;
Sviluppo e progettazione di applicativi di Data Science e non solo;
Realizzazione di pipeline dati (ETL/ELT), scripting e automazione di processi di data cleaning e feature engineering;
Redazione della documentazione tecnica in conformità agli standard aziendali e alle best practices;
Progettazione di suite di test per la validazione di modelli di Machine Learning/Deep Learning;
Ottimizzazione delle prestazioni, tuning degli algoritmi e delle pipeline di elaborazione dati, utilizzo di profiler e tool di analisi di performance;
Utilizzo di tools di gestione del ciclo di vita del software e di Continuos Integration/Delivery;
Garantire la qualità dei prodotti secondo gli standard aziendali.



CHE COSA DEVI PORTARE CON TE

Valutiamo con interesse:



Laurea Magistrale in Informatica o Ing. Informatica con focus su Intelligenza Artificiale;
Buona conoscenza della Iingua inglese parlata e scritta (livello B2);
Ottima conoscenza dei principali standard di analisi e progettazione del software O.O;
Ottima conoscenza di tutto il ciclo di vita del software e dei progetti di AI;
Ottima conoscenza di Python, Java e/o C++;
Ottima conoscenza dei framework/librerie TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, LangChain;
Ottima conoscenza dei DB sia SQL che NoSQL;
Buona conoscenza dei principali strumenti di analisi dei dati: Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib;
Buona conoscenza dei principi di TDD e Unit Testing per il test e la validazione del software prodotto;
Buone capacità di ottimizzazione del software attraverso l'uso di profiler e tools per l'analisi del codice statica e dinamica.



CHE COSA TI OFFRIAMO

Cosa offriamo:



Ambiente internazionale e caratterizzato da sfide e dinamicità
Opportunità di sviluppo professionale
Programmi di alta formazione
Un contesto lavorativo inclusivo, che abbraccia e valorizza l'unicità in tutte le sue forme
Retribuzione in linea con i maggiori players, proporzionata alle competenze e alla seniority possedute, che sarà compresa fra i 35k e i 40k
Programmi di Welfare innovativi e costruiti intorno alle persone
Assicurazione sanitaria
Ristorante Aziendale
Parcheggio per i dipendenti
Servizio Concierge
Modello di lavoro ibrido
Flessibilità oraria



Valutiamo con estremo interesse le candidature appartenenti alle categorie protette ai sensi degli artt. 1 e 18, legge 68/99.

Il presente annuncio è rivolto ad entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91, e a persone di tutte le età e tutte le nazionalità, ai sensi dei DL 215/03 e 216/03.

Le persone sono il nostro ASSET aziendale e rappresentano un patrimonio imprescindibile per l’innovazione del nostro business. I continui cambiamenti tecnologici e le trasformazioni del mercato richiedono flessibilità di pensiero, apprendimento rapido e mobilità. Invece della standardizzazione di massa, noi abbracciamo l'unicità di massa e la centricità umana.

_______________________________________________________________________

N.B.: Thank you for attaching your cv.

This announcement is addressed to both sexes, in accordance with Laws 903/77 and 125/91, and to people of all ages and nationalities, in accordance with DL 215/03 and 216/03.

We undertake to evaluate candidates belonging to the protected categories pursuant to art. 1 and 18, law 68/99.

PER INFORMAZIONI



migliarini@rheinmetall.it

Title: Junior Analytics Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you have a passion for Sports & Outdoor?

Do you know how to adapt to a challenging environment?

Do you love finding ways to make complex processes simpler through data?

Apply now and become part of our great team at DANISH ENDURANCE®!

We are looking for a talented and ambitious Junior Analytics Engineer to contribute to the continuous development and growth of our brand of endurance and outdoor gear.

Who is DANISH ENDURANCE®?

DANISH ENDURANCE® is a global endurance & outdoor brand within e-commerce. With a focus on Danish design and sustainable manufacturing in Europe and Asia, we are a young high-growth company, with a flat structure and a friendly, dynamic working environment. We are a truly international team consisting of 60 professionals with 25 different nationalities based in Copenhagen at Holmen and Gramrode near Horsens.

We have a scalable and unique business model, our ambitions are rocket-high, and we strongly believe that everything is possible. That is why we need you!

What can you expect from the job?

As Our Junior Analytics Engineer, You Will


Build and maintain data models and ETL pipelines
Create dashboards and automated reports
Support financial processes including VAT reporting and month-end closing
Perform regular data analytics and ad-hoc analysis
Drive process optimization and automation initiatives
Ensure data quality and maintain documentation
Participate in ML/AI projects


What do we expect from you?


Transform complex business requirements into efficient technical solutions
Build and optimize SQL models for various reporting needs
Optimize and automate reporting processes
Identify opportunities for process improvement and implement solutions
Collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams
Take ownership of assigned projects and deliver high-quality results


Qualifications


Degree in Data Science, Business Analytics, Computer Science, or a related field
Strong SQL modelling and data warehouse knowledge
Experience with data analysis and visualization tools
Understanding of basic financial concepts
Experience with dbt and version control is an advantage
Experience with Python
Business process optimization experience
Passion for sports is a bonus


Additional Facts

Weekly working hours: Full time

Location: Copenhagen Holmen, at Talent Garden Rainmaking

Deadline: We will review applications on an ongoing basis, the sooner you apply, the better

Start date: As soon as possible

How To Apply

Feel free to contact Elias Fischer in case you have any questions

One applications via the Hub will be considered.

Read more about DANISH ENDURANCE® at www.danishendurance.com

KEEP YOUR PERSONAL DATA SAFE

Danish Endurance take responsibly for the protection of your personal data. Accordingly, upon receiving your job application and additional material you choose to submit, we keep it in a safe and secure environment and ensures confidentiality.

You also have a role to play in keeping your personal data safe. We request you only submit personal data about yourself in your job application, CV or other relevant material you choose to provide to us that is relevant for the specific position you are applying for.

(Please consider whether there is personal information you are about to submit, such as health information, that is not necessary for our recruitment process or the position you are applying for. Please also be aware of certificates or other documents that are not necessary for the vacancy.

Title: Junior Consultant - AI & Automation
Description:
The life sciences industry plays a significant role in advancing healthcare and improving the quality of life - in many cases, saving millions of lives globally. At BASE life science, this is the motivation for everything we do, aimed at pushing boundaries, seeking excellence, and making a lasting difference through consulting expertise and data-driven solutions.




Who is BASE life science?

Founded in 2007, BASE life science is a business and technology consulting enterprise working exclusively in the life sciences industry.




From our headquarters in Denmark and offices in France, Germany, Italy, Spain, Switzerland, the United Kingdom, and the United States of America, we serve customers across the globe. With a deep understanding of the life sciences industry, we work hand in hand with customers to identify, develop, and implement strategic initiatives that drive growth, efficiency, and overall success through tailored solutions.




Our partnership with industry-leading solution providers, including Veeva, Salesforce, IQVIA, Benchling, and MediSpend ensures that our clients harness the full potential of the most innovative solutions on the market.




About the role

Are you a passionate student in STEM eager to apply your skills in solving real-world challenges?




BASE life science is looking for 3-4 driven STEM students, currently in their 3rd year of undergraduate or 1st year of a master’s program, to join our AI and automation team on a part-time basis. This is a unique opportunity to work on innovative proof-of-concept projects within the life science industry, dedicating 12-20 hours per week with flexible scheduling around your exams. We are looking for the team to span the capabilities of a data scientist, data engineer and software developer.




As part of a small, dedicated unit, you will gain hands-on experience with a multitude of different technologies. Additionally, you will have the opportunity to interact with project managers, life science consultants, data scientists, cloud engineers, and software engineers across the globe, accelerating the development of state-of-the-art proof of concepts for the Life Science industry.




The right candidate will also get the opportunity to work directly on customer projects. This is a great opportunity to gain practical experience in cutting-edge technology and contribute to innovative projects in the Life Science field.




As a Junior Consultant your responsibilities include:

Develop and improve AI solutions and products we deploy at our customers.
Design and develop new innovative solutions together with our Life Science consultants that bring value to the Life Science Industry.
Collaborate with our Cloud and Software Engineering teams to set up cloud services and develop production-grade solutions.




We offer this position in Copenhagen, Denmark.




What makes you the best person for this job?




To be successful in this role, you have the following competences:

Experience developing software or performing data science tasks in Python.
Experience with other programming languages (e.g., Java and bash).
Experience or a keen interest in working with LLMs (OpenAI/Google) and generative AI.
Great problem-solving skills.
Work with complex problems in a structured way and being a part of a team.
Ability to communicate complex problems in a concise manner.
Strong verbal and written communication skills in English.




What makes us the best employer for you?

BASE life science has been recognized as an outstanding workplace, earning us the Great Place To Work certification in Denmark, France, Germany, Italy, Spain, Switzerland, and the United Kingdom.




We are proud to represent 35+ nationalities among our colleagues, and firmly believe in the power of diverse perspectives and characteristics to drive truly innovative solutions and achieving excellence.




At the heart of our organization lies a foundation grounded in five core values: team spirit, trust, openness, ambition, and execution. We cultivate an environment that champions flexibility, placing confidence in our employees to successfully complete tasks while upholding a healthy work-life balance. Additionally, we place significance in cross-functional collaboration, where niche skills and specialisms are valued and challenging the status quo is encouraged.




Additionally, we offer you:

Health insurance.

Remote work friendliness.

Ongoing learning and development.

Flexible schedules to fit your work to your routine.

Contributions to physical, social, and emotional health.

Home office setup with laptop and other electronic devices.

The chance to help make a difference for patients around the world.




Interested?

If you find this position intriguing, don't delay—submit your application in English at your earliest convenience. We are continuously reviewing and assessing all incoming candidates and eagerly await your application.




By submitting your application, you consent to the processing of your personal data by BASE life science for the purposes of recruitment and selection. This includes the collection, storage, and use of your personal data as outlined in our Privacy Policy.

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer til Data Foundation
Place: Odense, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Vil du forme fremtidens ML-platform hos TV 2 Danmark?

Vi søger en dygtig specialist inden for machine learning engineering, der er passioneret omkring at sætte machine learning-modeller i produktion og vil være med til at videreudvikle TV 2s ML-platform, som understøtter TV 2s digitale vækst. Her får du muligheden for at bringe dine tekniske evner i spil og bidrage til et miljø kendetegnet ved høj faglighed og samarbejde.

Om afdelingen og teamet

I Data Foundation bliver du en del af Data Platform-teamet, som arbejder målrettet på at gøre data tilgængeligt og værdiskabende for hele TV 2. Teamet består af seks erfarne data engineers og en ML engineer, der sammen skaber løsninger til både store strategiske projekter og daglige udfordringer. Her får du mulighed for at arbejde i et miljø med høj faglighed, hvor samarbejde med eksperter inden for data science, analyse og visualisering er en del af hverdagen.

Rollen – vær med til at sikre TV 2 lykkes med machine learning og AI

Som ML engineer får du en central rolle i videreudviklingen af vores ML-platform, der bidrager til at vores data scientist kan få modeller fra udvikling til produktion. Derudover vil du blive ansvarlig for at skabe løsninger, der er skalerbare, effektive og klar til at understøtte TV 2s ambitioner inden for machine learning og AI.

Dine primære opgaver vil være at:



Produktionssætning af ML-modeller: Arbejd tæt med data scientists for at sikre robuste og værdiskabende løsninger.
Udvikling og vedligehold af ML-platformen: Udnyt Databricks og Azure-services til at skabe morgendagens ML-platform i TV 2, der understøtter fremtidige behov inden for ML og AI.
Byg CI/CD-pipelines: Design og implementér workflows med GitHub Actions.
Overvågning og sikkerhed: Sørg for stabil drift og høj kvalitet af produktionssatte løsninger.
Teknisk sparringspartner: Definér udviklingsprincipper og vær en teknisk sparringspartner på tværs af organisationen.



Dit arbejdssted kan være i København eller Odense.

Om dig

For at lykkes i denne rolle forestiller vi os, at du:



Har en teknisk baggrund inden for matematik, datalogi, data science eller et beslægtet felt.
Har et par års professionel erfaring med machine learning engineering eller beslægtede felter.
Forstår machine learning-projekters livscyklus – fra dataforberedelse til implementering.
Er velbevandret i Python og har kendskab til frameworks som MLflow og scikit-learn.
Erfaring med at arbejde på cloud-platforme som Azure, AWS eller Google.
Fortrolig med software engineering best practices og CI/CD-pipelines.
Har kendskab til containerization og REST API’er.



Det vigtigste er, at du har interesse i at udvikle dig og bidrage til videreudviklingen af vores ML-platform i et miljø, hvor samarbejde og faglig udvikling er i fokus

TV 2 som arbejdsplads

I TV 2s teknologiske område arbejder mere end 350 medarbejdere dedikeret med at understøtte og realisere den koncernstrategiske målsætning om 1,3 millioner Play-abonnenter i 2025.

Målsætningen, der udspringer af 2025-strategien 'TV 2 Play til alle', forudsætter et solidt teknologisk fundament, der gør det muligt for TV 2 også i fremtiden at levere dansk kvalitetsindhold og public service, som danskerne har let adgang til og interesse i at samles om.

TV 2 investerer derfor i disse år massivt i udviklingen og driften af hele den teknologiske værdikæde fra medieteknologi og tv-produktion til digital produktudvikling. Alt sammen med det formål at sikre, at vi imødekommer danskernes behov og forventninger i et omskifteligt marked med stigende, international konkurrence.

Teknologiorganisationen er placeret i både Odense og København, og vi beskæftiger blandt andre Software Engineers, UX-designere, Product Managers, Solution Architects, produktionsspecialister og Data Scientists.

Søg rollen

Du sender din ansøgning med CV via formularen nedenunder. Vi holder løbende samtaler, og lukker stillingen når de rette kandidater er fundet.

Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig!


Show more

Title: CA Gen Developer
Company: Trilogy International, A Korn Ferry Company
Description:
CA Gen Developer Role Overview

We are seeking a CA Gen Developer with hands-on experience using the CA Gen (formerly IEF and COOL: Gen ) 4th generation model-driven development tool.

Required Skills and Experience:

· CA Gen Expertise:

o Comprehensive understanding of CA Gen Model concepts.

o Proficiency with the CA Gen toolset, including:

§ 3270 CA Gen screens.

§ Windows-based CA Gen clients.

§ Com-proxies and Java-proxies.

§ CA Gen Batch applications.

· COBOL Knowledge:

o COBOL programming skills to be able to support the CA Gen programs with external functionality (External Action Blocks (EABs)).

· Mainframe Experience:

o General Mainframe MVS knowledge.

o Including knowledge and experience working with the following technologies:

§ DB2 database management.

§ SDSF (System Display and Search Facility).

§ CICS (Customer Information Control System).

§ JCL (Job Control Language).

§ MQ Series
