Title: Freelance AI Security Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Cybersecurity, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:


Generate prompts that challenge AI
Define comprehensive scoring criteria to evaluate the accuracy of the AI's answers
Correct the model's responses based on your domain-specific knowledge



How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements

Required Qualifications:


Strong Linux administration and automation skills (Bash, Python, PowerShell).
Hands-on experience with penetration testing tools (Metasploit, Burp Suite, Nessus, Nmap)
Knowledge of AI security risks, including prompt injection, adversarial attacks, and AI red teaming.
Experience in automating security tasks, securing DevOps workflows, and integrating security into CI/CD pipelines
Cloud security expertise (AWS, Azure, Kubernetes, Terraform, CI/CD security)
Relevant security certifications (OSCP, CEH, CISSP, OSWE, API Security Architect).
Proficiency in English: advanced (C1) or above
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong communication skills for reporting findings and collaborating with teams
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge



Preferred Skills:


Experience in AI red teaming, adversarial ML, LLM security testing.
Deep understanding of networking protocols, OS security, and web application security
Knowledge of OWASP Top Ten, MITRE ATT&CK, and other security frameworks.
Experience with web security (HTTP, API security, web scraping, DOM manipulation).



Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise
Show more

Title: Senior Software Developer
Description:
About the Company - Do you love programming and problem-solving? Join us in challenging the life and pension sector! We are looking for a Senior Software Developer who, like us, is driven by building solid exciting products using strong software methodologies. What you will join At Festina Finance, we deliver solutions to the biggest pension funds in Denmark and the Netherlands and 30+ banks in Scandinavia and the UK.




You will join a fast-growing and ambitious company, driven by making the best solutions while having fun together as a team. We have a flat and informal organization, which gives you lots of individual responsibility and freedom in your work.




About the Role - Do you enjoy complex challenges? We have a variety of exciting and challenging projects and different tasks for you to be working with, such as:




Working with our business specialists to implement solutions
Programming asynchronous message flows
Helping with integrating components into a large system landscape
Implementing REST APIs
Contributing to our internal tools such as code generators, localization, etc.
Working with testing and performance
Improving our software standard to maintain maximum productivity for the developer team
Working with automatic testing and performance




Responsibilities - Being a good programmer is a must-have for this role, but in addition, there is room for other tasks such as design, build and deployment, testing, documentation, and infrastructure.




Qualifications - Needed skills:




You are driven by software development
Solid programming skills. You have experience with Java, C#, or other languages. We use Java. Maybe you have experience with functional programming.
You may have a good understanding of the financial sector from banking, pension, or investment
You have a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, IT Engineering, or alike.
You are driven to take responsibility and influence others
You are a team player and like collaborating with others on complex solutions.

Title: Software Engineer, Launch Graduate Program 2025 - Copenhagen, Denmark-R-228710
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Our Purpose

Mastercard powers economies and empowers people in 200+ countries and territories worldwide. Together with our customers, we’re helping build a sustainable economy where everyone can prosper. We support a wide range of digital payments choices, making transactions secure, simple, smart and accessible. Our technology and innovation, partnerships and networks combine to deliver a unique set of products and services that help people, businesses and governments realize their greatest potential.

Title And Summary

Software Engineer, Launch Graduate Program 2025 - Copenhagen, Denmark

Mastercard works to connect and power a sustainable and inclusive global economy. We are a vehicle for commerce, a connection to financial systems for the previously excluded, a technology innovation lab, and the home of Priceless®. We ensure every employee has an opportunity to be a part of something bigger and to change lives. We believe in connecting everyone to endless, priceless possibilities.

About The Team

Mastercard software engineering teams are obsessed with security, reliability, performance, and are driven to deliver solutions that delight our customers. We are looking for talented software engineers to develop advanced technologies and applications that are revolutionizing payments. Software engineers at Mastercard build the systems that process transactions, analyze data, and detect fraud to gain insight into the direction of the economy on behalf of our customers. We are focused on building simple, safe, and smart solutions that instill trust in every interaction. Our industry expertise is enhanced by our commitment to being a force for good in the world and to doing well by doing good.

Launch Program

Role

The Launch program is a development program that is supplemental to the role and is designed to help you transition from being a student to being a Mastercard employee. In this program, you will participate in:


Four-day orientation focused on getting to know Mastercard, building your skills, and be a force for good (Mastercard’s culture)
Technical orientation focused on an introduction to tools, policies, and processes that are key to your role
Professional skills workshops
Launch innovation week
Social impact – pro bono team challenge
Global volunteer challenge



Role Description

As a Software Engineer I, you will have the opportunity to:


write high-quality code with a focus on security, design, and maintainability.
contribute to all phases of software development from design through rollout.
find real-life solutions for our clients and the world.



Software engineers working on Mastercard's open banking platform play a key role in the development and maintenance of the products that secure high quality connectivity to banks across Europe. Building on the strong foundation of our state-of-the-art bank connectivity APIs, the engineers create turn-key solutions that take the burden of handling account information and payment initiation services from customers that want to spend their efforts building great products that leverage the full potential of the open banking standard.

Open banking engineers work at the bleeding edge of the account information and payment initiation technologies, often solving problems that are yet to be tackled within the industry in areas of API security, data accessibility, processing, and analysis. You will be joining a group of highly skilled individuals working together as a team to push the limits of what is possible to achieve with open banking.

You will have many colleagues around different countries, with your nearest peers being located primarily in Denmark, Ireland, Poland, and Romania.

You will be spending most of your time in the Microsoft domain, meaning APIs built in C# with .NET (latest version) and ASP.NET deployed to the cloud (Azure). Knowledge of at least some of these areas is a great benefit. However, we believe that learning is a part of the job, so do not hesitate to apply even you have not worked with these technologies before. After all, we are looking for talented engineers, regardless of background.

What you’ll need


To be available for start from September 2025
To be a Final Year Masters/Undergraduate Student or to have graduated no earlier than September 2024
Studying Computer Science, Engineering or similar
Strong verbal and written communication skills in English
Passion for solving problems



Application Process


Submit your application
If eligible, receive invitation for a coding assessment
If recommended to advance, receive invitation for final round interview(s); you will have the opportunity to meet with us virtually to learn more about our business and culture



This role is not eligible for Mastercard’s work authorization sponsorship. As such, candidates must be eligible to work in Denmark, now as well as in the future, without employer sponsorship.

Corporate Security Responsibility

All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:


Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.

  • To be a Final Year Masters/Undergraduate Student or to have graduated no earlier than September 2024
  • Studying Computer Science, Engineering or similar
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills in English
  • Passion for solving problems


Application Process

  • Submit your application
  • If eligible, receive invitation for a coding assessment
  • If recommended to advance, receive invitation for final round interview(s); you will have the opportunity to meet with us virtually to learn more about our business and culture


This role is not eligible for Mastercard’s work authorization sponsorship. As such, candidates must be eligible to work in Denmark, now as well as in the future, without employer sponsorship.

Corporate Security Responsibility

 All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:

  • Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
  • Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
  • Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
  • Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.


R-228710

Title: Machine Learning Engineer, Computer Vision
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to develop computer vision and machine learning solutions for closing the gap between plan and reality for large scale construction projects, with the goal of minimizing waste through digitalization?

Your new role

Bringing data from offices to the construction site using 3D BIM models has long been part of our core expertise here at Dalux. Now, as one of the next steps in our effort to digitalize the construction industry, we are working to bring data from the construction site back into the office using modern Computer Vision techniques.

As a Machine Learning Engineer in our Computer Vision section, you will be a key part in delivery of the solutions into production. You will participate in the full lifecycle of the ML systems we build, while spearheading the model deployment, performance monitoring and maintenance, to ensure the reproducibility of our experiments and traceability of our pipelines in production. As part of the R&D team, you will be expected to keep up to date with the state-of-the-art in the ML/CV area as well as new techniques and processes.

Your background

We believe you…


Have 3+ years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, MLOps Engineer, or similar.
Have a proven track record of bringing machine learning models to production.
Have a solid theoretical foundation from a degree in computer science, engineering, IT or similar.
Can work both independently and as part of a team.


Most important is your problem-solving attitude, passion for software craftmanship, and the ambition to participate in the full lifecycle of our machine learning solutions.

Our tech...


Python
PyTorch
C++
OpenCV
AWS
MLFlow
Kubernetes


We are focused on using the right tools for the job, and as such the list of technologies may change depending on our needs and new offerings.

What To Expect As a Daluxian

In our organization the way from idea to product is short, combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.

You will become a part of a highly skilled team of passionate individuals driven by the wish to explore new and reshape existing technologies. As Dalux is a software company, we want half of the company to consist of Software Developers. All our software development happens at our head office at Vibenshuset in Copenhagen.

We offer...


Central location in Copenhagen, focus on work/life balance without any overtime, and no dress code.
An active social environment with monthly events and social clubs.
Flat communication in our organization, where the way from idea to product is short combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.
You’ll join a highly specialized, international team with room for creativity and professional growth.
Strong focus on diversity and inclusion – your ideas are heard, and opportunities are available to all.
Attractive employee benefits such as health insurance, lunch plan, coffee and fruit, free fitness facilities, and parking garage.
Focus on your development and well-being, with support for both professional goals and personal growth.


Ready for the next step

If Dalux sounds like a place where you could develop and contribute to the high-quality software, we would gladly accept your application. We will be having ongoing interviews.

If you have any questions, feel free to contact Simone Jena Berg Christensen.

Who Is Dalux

Dalux is a Danish software company founded in 2005 by Ph.D. Bent Dalgaard and Torben Dalgaard. Dalux’ products are aimed at making the construction industry smarter and more effective as it is the world’s 2nd largest industry and amongst the least digitalized. Our user-friendly digital tools and Building Information Modelling-technology (also known as BIM) is used in more than 160 countries globally.

We are crazy about cool technology and have experience being first movers on new tech. Our products are based on our unique 3D BIM-technology and makes use of AR - all developed entirely by Dalux.

HTML:
Do you want to develop computer vision and machine learning solutions for closing the gap between plan and reality for large scale construction projects, with the goal of minimizing waste through digitalization?

Your new role

Bringing data from offices to the construction site using 3D BIM models has long been part of our core expertise here at Dalux. Now, as one of the next steps in our effort to digitalize the construction industry, we are working to bring data from the construction site back into the office using modern Computer Vision techniques.

As a Machine Learning Engineer in our Computer Vision section, you will be a key part in delivery of the solutions into production. You will participate in the full lifecycle of the ML systems we build, while spearheading the model deployment, performance monitoring and maintenance, to ensure the reproducibility of our experiments and traceability of our pipelines in production. As part of the R&D team, you will be expected to keep up to date with the state-of-the-art in the ML/CV area as well as new techniques and processes.

Your background

We believe you…

  • Have 3+ years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, MLOps Engineer, or similar.
  • Have a proven track record of bringing machine learning models to production.
  • Have a solid theoretical foundation from a degree in computer science, engineering, IT or similar.
  • Can work both independently and as part of a team.

Most important is your problem-solving attitude, passion for software craftmanship, and the ambition to participate in the full lifecycle of our machine learning solutions.

Our tech...

  • Python
  • PyTorch
  • C++
  • OpenCV
  • AWS
  • MLFlow
  • Kubernetes

We are focused on using the right tools for the job, and as such the list of technologies may change depending on our needs and new offerings.

Title: Data Scientist, Computer Vision
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to develop computer vision and machine learning solutions for closing the gap between plan and reality for large scale construction projects, with the goal of minimizing waste through digitalization?

Your new role

Bringing data from offices to the construction site using 3D BIM models has long been part of our core expertise here at Dalux. Now, as one of the next steps in our effort to digitalize the construction industry, we are working to bring data from the construction site back into the office using modern Computer Vision techniques.

As a Data Scientist in our Computer Vision section, you will develop and deploy deep learning models to improve the understanding, alignment and correspondence between 3D models of the construction site and video data gathered using our vSLAM system. As part of an R&D team, you will work on discovery of new solutions through research and rapid prototyping, and translating the findings into delivery of high quality solutions to complex computer vision problems.

Your background

We believe you…


Have a solid theoretical foundation from a degree in computer science, engineering, IT or similar.
Have a hands-on experience with software development using C++, Python or C#. It is important that you have reached solid coding standards and strive for continuous improvement.
Have a machine learning experience or trained in the area. Hands-on experience with PyTorch and MLFlow is a plus.
Have computer vision experience or trained in the area. Hands-on experience with OpenCV is a plus.
Can work both independently and as part of a team.


Most important is your problem-solving attitude, passion for software craftmanship, and the ambition to participate in the full lifecycle of our machine learning solutions.

Title: Vision Engineer
Place: Birkerød, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Vision Automation A/S fortsætter sin positive vækst, og derfor søger vi en kundeorienteret Vision Engineer, der besidder solid viden om automation og integration af automationsprodukter. Kendskab til Vision-løsninger samt optiske- og belysningsprodukter er en stor fordel. Din primære opgave vil være at styrke applikationsafdelingen ved at løse opgaver, integrere produkter hos Vision Automations kunder og efterfølgende yde support på produkterne. Du bliver en vigtig brik og bindeled mellem udviklingsafdelingen og vores kunder. For den rette kandidat er der gode personlige og faglige udviklingsmuligheder.




Virksomheden:

Vision Automation A/S er pionerer indenfor industrielle visionsystemer og har specialiseret sig i dette felt siden grundlæggelsen i 1988. Virksomhed blev etableret af fire visioningeniører, der tilsammen har mere end tre årtiers erfaring inden for udvikling af visionsystemer.

Vision Automation A/S opererer fra moderne faciliteter i Birkerød, hvor virksomheden designer, udvikler og leverer løsninger både nationalt og internationalt. Kunderne inkluderer typisk maskinbyggere og slutbrugere inden for en bred vifte af industrier. Især i den farmaceutiske sektor har virksomhedens systemer gjort sig bemærket, hvor de anvendes til at opnå den højeste produktionskvalitet og sikkerhed.

Vision Automation A/S har haft en kontinuerlig vækst med stor anerkendelse for den økonomisk succes. Vision Automation A/S eksporterer 90 % af visionløsningerne til andre europæiske lande og stræber konstant efter at forbedre samt udvide produktsortiment for at imødekomme kundernes skiftende behov.




Organisation:

Vision Automation er en teknologivirksomhed i vækst med 14 ansatte, og hvor medarbejderstaben løbende udvides.

Organisationen er kendetegnet ved en dynamisk virksomhedskultur med stærk fokus på kunder, kvalitet, teknologi og et højt fagligt niveau blandt engagerede kolleger.

Som ny medarbejder vil du modtage grundig træning og oplæring i virksomhedens produkter og løsninger.




Stillingen:

Du vil være en del af afdækningen af kundens behov og definere den rette løsning både teknisk og økonomisk.
Det indebærer sammensætning af den kundetilpassende løsning vedrørende kameraer, optik og belysning.
Installation af systemer hos maskinbyggere og/eller slutbrugere, både nationalt og internationalt.
Idriftsættelse og SAT (Site Acceptance Test) hos kunderne.
Test, service og support på eksisterende installationer på verdensplan.
Du vil fungere som Point of Contact (PoC) vedrørende support og kvalitetssager.




Kandidaten:

Du har sandsynligvis en teknisk baggrund og måske en uddannelse som ingeniør, automationsteknolog eller automatiktekniker.
Du har nogle års erfaring med Vision-systemer eller en stærk interesse for at arbejde med Vision-systemer.
Du udviser en systematisk og analytisk tilgang til problemløsning.
Du besidder gode kommunikationsevner på både dansk og engelsk, både mundtligt og skriftligt.




Øvrige kvalifikationer:

Du er ambitiøs, flittig og trives både med selvstændigt arbejde og samarbejde i teams.
Du er udadvendt med en empatisk tilgang til andre mennesker.
Troværdighed, pålidelighed og ansvarlighed er centrale egenskaber.
Du er struktureret og i stand til at formidle tekniske budskaber til både kunder og kolleger.
Da en del af jobbet indebærer rejseaktivitet, forventes du at kunne rejse i omkring 60 dage.




Benefits:

Et spændende og selvstændigt job med udviklingsmuligheder i professionelle og uformelle omgivelser. Hertil attraktive ansættelsesvilkår.

Lyder det som noget for dig?

​Send din ansøgning og dit CV allerede i dag via linket ansøg. Tiltrædelse er snarest muligt, men vi venter naturligvis på den rigtige kandidat.

Show more

Lyder det som noget for dig?

​Send din ansøgning og dit CV allerede i dag via linket ansøg. Tiltrædelse er snarest muligt, men vi venter naturligvis på den rigtige kandidat.

Title: Natural Language Processing (NLP) Researcher
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to impact a highly-skilled team that uses cutting edge techniques in Natural Language Processing and Algorithmic Trading? We are looking for an NLP Researcher that will help us greatly improve the text-processing behind our models.




At Alipes Capital, we have been the market leader in automating the financial markets since we started back in 2008, shaping a fully automatic natural language processing system for reading and interpreting financial news.




Your work

Your work will support turning massive data sets of unstructured financial information into structured datasets and mathematical models that accurately predict movements in the equity markets. In doing so, you will:

Redesign and introduce new text-processing techniques to extract additional and more accurate entities from the text-sources that underlie our trading algorithms
Maintain and curate new and existing text data sources for our analyses
Automate monitoring and benchmarking of the trading strategies




You will enjoy a wide degree of autonomy and responsibility to optimize our machine-learning pipelines, from data-ingestion to live-model performance. There is no red tape, no sales people to consult and there is ample room for creativity.




The team

All of this will happen in an informal atmosphere where technical discussions are valued and you are encouraged to take ownership of, and pride in, your work. You will impact the direction of the team, prioritize your work and choose the tools that get the job done. We are a tight-knit modeling team with fourteen passionate quantitative researchers covering six nationalities – eleven PhD’s and three MSc’s- with expertise in statistical analysis, mathematical modeling and machine learning (seven of us working directly on the text-based equity models).




We enjoy collaboration, lending a helping hand and discussing the business cases built upon our data-sets. You will be working alongside a team of software developers and a team of traders who implement and conceive the trading models with us. All team members write code and are not afraid to discuss technical details.




Need to have

Skilled in extracting signals from texts using embeddings to enhance prediction model
Proficient in entity-extraction from text, e.g. using modern Transformer-based Large-Language Models
Solid understanding of machine learning techniques and their practical applications
Aptitude for programming in a numerical scripting language (we primarily use Python)
A meticulous and detail-oriented mind




Nice to have

Experience using RAGs (Retrieval-Augmentation-Generation)
Working with financial/trading data
Experience with C#, C/C++ or Java
Familiarity with software engineering (version control, unit testing, object oriented-design)
Degree in Computer Science / Engineering




What we can offer you

Flat hierarchy and high levels of trust and autonomy
Exciting problems to solve
Collaborative team made up of really smart and curious people
Nice office in central Copenhagen with a hybrid work model
Pension, Health Insurance and 30 days of vacation




Practicalities

To apply, please send us your CV and a cover letter telling us why you think this role is a great fit for you. In your cover letter, if applicable, please describe a project where you extracted structured or unstructured information from text - including the techniques, tools, models used and how those extractions informed further decisions/predictions.

If you're selected for an interview, we will be very interested in discussing technical details with you about this project!

Should your profile look like a good match, we will get in touch to coordinate an online technical test as a first step in the interview process.

Title: Data Science Konsulent
Description:
Brænder du for data og analyser? Drømmer du om at blive en del af et ungt og dynamisk team? Bliv en del af Dataminds, et innovativt konsulenthus med stor erfaring inden for Data Science, Business Intelligence og Analytics.

Hos Dataminds er vi på jagt efter passionerede Data Science-konsulenter til at styrke vores team. Med en solid baggrund inden for dataanalyse og en uudslukkelig nysgerrighed, får du muligheden for at sætte dit præg på udviklingen af databaserede løsninger, der dagligt hjælper vores kunder og kolleger med at nå deres forretningsmål.

 

Du vil være med til at:

Løse komplekse forretningsmæssige problemstillinger med en datadrevet tilgang.
Udvikle og implementere analytiske modeller og BI-løsninger, der skaber indsigt og værdi.
Arbejde tæt sammen med kunder og kolleger for at sikre skræddersyede løsninger.

 

Vi forestiller os, at du:

Vi forestiller os, at du er uddannet cand.merc, cand.oecon, eller lignende.
Har erfaring med SQL, Power BI, Excel, R eller lignende værktøjer.
Har en analytisk tilgang og kan formidle komplekse data på en forståelig måde.
Er vant til at arbejde agilt og trives i både selvstændige og teamorienterede roller.
Praktisk erfaring fra tidligere stillinger, relevante kurser osv. er en fordel, men ikke et krav.

 

Det vil være en fordel, hvis du:

Er systematisk, struktureret og kvalitetsbevidst i opgaveløsningen.
Forstår vigtigheden af overholdelse af aftaler og deadlines.
Demonstrerer en proaktiv tilgang og er direkte og vedholdende, når idéer skal formuleres, udveksles og afprøves for at nå løsninger.
Har lyst til at udvikle dig fagligt.
Er i stand til hurtigt at sætte dig ind i og anvende nye teknologier.
Er i stand til at strukturere din egen arbejdsdag og tage ansvar for dine opgaver.
Er klar til at tage dialogen direkte med kunder.

 

Vi tilbyder: 

En karriere hos Dataminds, der byder på mere end bare et job. Vi tilbyder en karrierevej, hvor du kan udvikle dine faglige og personlige færdigheder i et miljø, der værdsætter innovation, samarbejde og vidensdeling. Et fællesskab, hvor vi altid stræber efter at være de bedste. Vores dynamiske og ungdommelige arbejdsmiljø byder på alt fra bordtennis til sociale arrangementer, og vi understøtter din trivsel med gode arbejdsforhold, frokostordning, pension, sundhedsforsikring, m.m.

 

Er Dataminds din næste destination? 

Arbejdspladsen er beliggende centralt i Ankersgade, tæt på byens puls og i gåafstand til Aarhus Hovedbanegård.

Hvis du er klar til at tage skridtet fuldt ud og blive en nøglespiller i vores succes, så send din ansøgning til mail@dataminds.com og vedlæg dit CV og karakterblad. Vi ser frem til at høre, hvordan du kan bidrage til vores team hos Dataminds.

Kontakt Kim Lillesøe på +45 25 16 19 59 for en uforpligtende snak om mulighederne.

Bliv en del af vores rejse mod succes og innovation - ansøg nu!

Show more

Brænder du for data og analyser? Drømmer du om at blive en del af et ungt og dynamisk team? Bliv en del af Dataminds, et innovativt konsulenthus med stor erfaring inden for Data Science, Business Intelligence og Analytics.

Hos Dataminds er vi på jagt efter passionerede Data Science-konsulenter til at styrke vores team. Med en solid baggrund inden for dataanalyse og en uudslukkelig nysgerrighed, får du muligheden for at sætte dit præg på udviklingen af databaserede løsninger, der dagligt hjælper vores kunder og kolleger med at nå deres forretningsmål.

 

Du vil være med til at:

  • Løse komplekse forretningsmæssige problemstillinger med en datadrevet tilgang.
  • Udvikle og implementere analytiske modeller og BI-løsninger, der skaber indsigt og værdi.
  • Arbejde tæt sammen med kunder og kolleger for at sikre skræddersyede løsninger.

 

Vi forestiller os, at du:

  • Vi forestiller os, at du er uddannet cand.merc, cand.oecon, eller lignende.
  • Har erfaring med SQL, Power BI, Excel, R eller lignende værktøjer.
  • Har en analytisk tilgang og kan formidle komplekse data på en forståelig måde.

Title: Join Deloitte as a Software Developer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Company Description

With more than 3000 employees Deloitte is the largest audit and consultancy firm in Denmark. We tailor solutions across Audit, Tax, Financial Advisory Services, Enterprise Risk Services, and Technology & Transformation.

Are you curious about modern software development and looking for your next challenge? At Deloitte Engineering, we are seeking recent or soon-to-be graduates, who want to take an active role in improving their technical and problem-solving competencies while growing our Engineering practice.

About The Team

We, the Engineering offering of Deloitte Technology & Transformation Denmark, are on the lookout for additional team-players for our quickly growing practice of software engineers, architects, cloud consultants, and IT management consultants. We assist our clients, some of the largest companies, agencies, and organizations in Denmark and the Nordics, on the implementation of new cloud-native systems as part of their digital transformation – and we need you to help build their opportunities and meet their challenges!

Together, we will accelerate your career towards becoming a proficient software developer. At Deloitte, we are committed to empowering you throughout your career development. As a new employee, you are assigned a talent manager to support your career aspirations and development. You will also be part of a tech community with monthly meetings in which we share knowledge, investigate new topics, and upskill within relevant technologies and methodologies.

Job Description

As a software developer at the Engineering offering, you will work with many different aspects of development, from writing code to testing it. You will work closely with both clients and internal stakeholders to ensure that our solutions meet their business needs and technical requirements. Our client assignments can vary greatly, but common for all of them are that we strive to work with the technologies that the client prefers. Regardless of the technology, we provide you with the opportunity and tools needed to learn and grow within all of them.

In this role, you will make an impact by:


Developing applications and solutions of all sizes, frequently in Agile settings (SAFE/Scrum). This includes both backend and frontend development.
Assisting in the implementation of CI/CD pipelines, infrastructure as code (IaC), and adopting DevOps practices to streamline development workflows.
Building internal capabilities through community tasks, maybe within new business areas.
Joining in on workshops and sales pitches and contributing to proposals for new client projects.


Qualifications

You hold or will hold a Master’s degree, preferably with a focus on Computer Science, Engineering, or other relevant fields such as Information Technology or Software Development. Perhaps you have experience from previous part- or full-time software development positions, utilizing your analytical and problem-solving skill set. Furthermore, you are either a native Danish speaker or highly proficient in written and spoken Danish.

What you bring to the team:


Experience in Java, C#/.NET, JavaScript, TypeScript, or one or more other widely used programming languages.
Some experience with modern DevOps practices such as CI/CD, Infrastructure as Code, and test automation.
You have strong analytical skills and a focus on quality and detail.
You are a positive-minded teammate with the ability to work and solve problems in a structured way.
You can communicate and express yourself clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing.


Even if you do not see yourself in all the bullets above, we still encourage you to apply if you believe your skills can make an impact on our team.

What we can offer you:

We highly appreciate the knowledge, experience, and perspectives our consultants bring, and in exchange, we make sure they develop professionally, meet their career goals, and enjoy their time with Deloitte. Therefore, other than an incredible social calendar, we offer our consultants:


Enrollment in the Consultant Academy, which is our training program for building essential Consultant skills. The Academy takes you to exciting locations to learn from leading professionals in their respective fields.
Focused career development by assigning you a talent manager who acts as your mentor and guides you in your professional journey in Deloitte.
The opportunity to participate in projects and internal work with our different market offerings to find the right fit for you.


On the social aspect, Deloitte Technology & Transformation is second to none. We offer everything from various sports communities to festivals – not to mention the yearly Trip where all our colleagues come together off-site to create lasting memories. Additionally, we have a strong sense of belonging and community in Engineering, and we support each other every day to make an impact with our clients and to promote personal and professional development.

Additional Information

Do you want to be part of our team?

Click the "I am interested" button above if you are ready to join our team.

Send your application, CV, and other relevant documents by 09.05.2025. We process applications and arrange interviews continually, so we recommend that you apply as soon as possible.

Expected start date: 01.09.2025.

Please do not hesitate to contact Sophus Benee Olsen at +45 30 93 61 88 if you have any questions about the position.

We encourage all candidates to apply for the position regardless of, e.g., age, gender (gender identity and gender expression), sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, nationality, or disability.

By applying for this job, you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We have designed these standards to provide a consistent and exceptional Deloitte employee experience globally.

We look forward to connecting with you!

In Deloitte, you will find passionate, caring people who are curious by nature and striving to evolve. We value our different skills, perspectives and experiences and foster an environment where innovative powers thrive. To us, success is the feeling that the work we are doing will outlast us. The impact we make is not about what we achieve as individuals, but how we enable those around us to be their very best. From professional development to leadership opportunities, we empower our people to be extraordinary by playing to their strengths – because that is how we can make a difference.
Show more

Title: Principal Data Scientist - Computational Precision Health
Place: Måløv, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you enthusiastic about driving the next generation of real-world data solutions that will change the lives of patients with cardiometabolic diseases? Are you a knowledge leader in applying novel statistical and machine learning methods to drive collaborative evidence generation in drug discovery? If yes, then this opportunity could be right for you!

The position
The department of Computational Precision Health supports decision-making and drug discovery in Research & Early Development. As the Principal Data Scientist, you will contribute with statistical, analytical and advanced programming expertise to a team of research scientists, statisticians, machine learning experts and epidemiologists that, together with stakeholders from across the organisation, create actionable insights and evidence from real-world data. Our data comes from academic-industry partnerships, in-licensed databases of electronic medical records or health insurance claims, observational cohorts, and other sources.

Your main responsibilities will be:



Apply state-of-the-art methods within statistical, ML and AI analysis, programming, and visualisation to generate real-world evidence.
Drive innovation and application of novel methods and current trends in real-world data analyses for research and drug discovery.
Develop and lead educational and scientific activities to further strengthen our advanced analytical expertise within the real-world data space.
Engage with research scientists, pharmacologists, medical doctors, epidemiologists and other stakeholders to identify real-world evidence gaps in the preclinical pipeline and suggest appropriate and innovative analytical solutions to address these gaps.
Participate in designing, planning, developing, and documenting studies to make informed business decisions based on data.
Analyse data for scientific publications and support the publication process in collaboration with epidemiologists, cross-functional collaborators, and external partners.
Implement and maintain local and cloud-based data and computational environment to integrate data and solutions from different sources.
Write, document, and maintain code in R and Python to transform, standardise and aggregate data to create analysis-ready data sets from large amounts of raw data.
Strengthen partnerships with leading data science knowledge centres in industry and academia.




Qualifications

We realize that few people are experts at everything. But if you can nod your head at the following attributes, then you could be the person we are looking for:



PhD in Biostatistics, Bioinformatics, Mathematics/Mathematical Modelling, Physics, Data Science, or equivalent quantitative fields, combined with hands-on experience in the pharmaceutical industry, consultancy or startup in the medical/biological field.
Extensive experience in classical statistical methods, including model design, comparison and validation, regression analyses and survival analyses with competing risk.
Experience with machine learning methods, such as clustering and/or classification problems.
Significant experience working with real-world data (RWD), such as medical records or health insurance claims.
Strong programming skills with the ability to write clean, maintainable code in R and Python and experience with version control (e.g. Git).
Experience managing large data (e.g. transforming tabular data with millions of rows), including writing performant, scalable software and optimizing queries.
Proven ability to manage stakeholders effectively by quickly understanding their needs and communicating complex statistical and data science concepts, while translating these insights into actionable solutions through programming and analysis.
Proven track record of project ownership and informal leadership.




Additionally, it could be beneficial if you bring experience with:



Epidemiology (RWD/RWE) and translation of epidemiological questions into advanced data analysis solutions.
Statistical methods on causal inference.
Advanced machine learning techniques (e.g. transformers, deep learning) and foundation models (e.g. large language models, retrieval augmented generation).
SQL, creating dashboards using R/Shiny or other software.
Cloud computing environments (AWS / Microsoft Azure), Linux, shell scripting (e.g. Bash), and/or high-performance computing services.
Databases, data lakes and similar storage solutions, including writing SQL queries and managing database connections.
Project management and scientific writing.




We prioritize accountability and achieving goals through teamwork. Therefore, it's crucial that you leverage your strong interpersonal and communication skills to collaborate effectively with others. You thrive on responsibility, are prepared to take on informal leadership roles and complete your tasks proactively and within deadlines.

About The Department

The Computational Precision Health department operates in Måløv/Hellerup (Denmark) and London (UK). This position is based in Måløv/Hellerup (Denmark).

As part of the Artificial Intelligence and Digital Research (AIDR) area within the broader Digital Science & Innovation (DSI) organization, Computational Precision Health plays a crucial role in supporting the digital journey across all therapy areas in Novo Nordisk Research and Early Development. The department focuses on deriving insights and understanding causal relationships from real-world data using advanced statistical and machine learning methods. By analyzing various data sources, we generate evidence to support drug discovery and preclinical drug development projects.

Working at Novo Nordisk
At Novo Nordisk, we don’t wait for change. We drive it. We’re a dynamic company in an even more dynamic industry, and we know that what got us to where we are today is not necessarily what will make us successful in the future. We embrace the spirit of experimentation, striving for excellence without fixating on perfection. We never shy away from opportunities to develop, we seize them. From research and development, through to manufacturing, marketing, and sales – we’re all working to move the needle on patient care.

Contact
For further information, please contact Suvi Hokkanen, Senior Director, Computational Precision Health, at RSXH@novonordisk.com.

Deadline
March 16th, 2025.

If you see yourself in the description above, please apply sooner rather than later, as we review applications and schedule interviews on an ongoing basis.

You do not need to attach a cover letter to your application, but please include a few sentences about why you are applying in your resume or CV. To ensure an efficient and fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo to your CV.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we’re life changing.
Show more

Title: Application engineer
Description:
https://cambio.teamtailor.com/jobs/5576314-application-engineer-within-ehealth




As an Application Engineer, you will join a dynamic and highly skilled team where your work will directly impact both healthcare professionals and patients. Our products require exceptional availability, performance, and utmost patient safety, and you will play a critical role in ensuring smooth operations and high-quality service delivery.

In this role, you will serve as an essential liaison between our customers and internal teams, contributing to projects and activities with both existing customers and partners. Your expertise will be pivotal in applying optimal solutions, providing guidance to technical staff as necessary, and supporting IT environments tailored specifically for healthcare applications. You will also be a key member of our 24/7 support team, collaborating with customers to restore services when required.

Your responsibilities will also include addressing technical requests related to system deployment, integrations, and system configurations. You will support existing customers by managing and resolving incoming issues and collaborating with various departments, including product management, development, implementation, service and support, and sales and marketing. Many of these tasks will be technically complex and require a deep understanding of software and hardware architecture, business processes, and usability. 

At Cambio, we encourage taking initiatives that contribute to the development of the company and ourselves. For us, it is important that you should have the opportunity to grow, both as a person and as an employee. Our culture is described through the words “Trust”, “Care” and “Together” which permeate everything we do. 




About you

You are a curious, solution-oriented individual who enjoys learning new technologies and has the ability to explain complex topics in a simple and comprehensive manner. With a structured and detail-focused approach to your work, you take pride in supporting both customers and colleagues. You are proactive, independent, and driven by the desire to improve processes and solutions. You thrive in a fast-paced environment, able to adapt and manage unexpected tasks with ease.

Requirements

A relevant technical degree.
Strong technical proficiency in deployment, integration, networking, and server configuration.
Eagerness to acquire new skills and embrace unexpected challenges.
Experience with some of the following:
- IT system servicing- Microsoft-based infrastructure- IT system integrations- MS SQL- Scripting skills- Troubleshooting IT systems
Fluency in both Danish and English.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to effectively convey technical knowledge in both written and verbal form.




Show more

Our products require exceptional availability, performance, and utmost patient safety, and you will play a critical role in ensuring smooth operations and high-quality service delivery.

In this role, you will serve as an essential liaison between our customers and internal teams, contributing to projects and activities with both existing customers and partners. Your expertise will be pivotal in applying optimal solutions, providing guidance to technical staff as necessary, and supporting IT environments tailored specifically for healthcare applications. You will also be a key member of our 24/7 support team, collaborating with customers to restore services when required.

Your responsibilities will also include addressing technical requests related to system deployment, integrations, and system configurations. You will support existing customers by managing and resolving incoming issues and collaborating with various departments, including product management, development, implementation, service and support, and sales and marketing. Many of these tasks will be technically complex and require a deep understanding of software and hardware architecture, business processes, and usability. 

At Cambio, we encourage taking initiatives that contribute to the development of the company and ourselves. For us, it is important that you should have the opportunity to grow, both as a person and as an employee. Our culture is described through the words “Trust”, “Care” and “Together” which permeate everything we do. 


About you

You are a curious, solution-oriented individual who enjoys learning new technologies and has the ability to explain complex topics in a simple and comprehensive manner. With a structured and detail-focused approach to your work, you take pride in supporting both customers and colleagues. You are proactive, independent, and driven by the desire to improve processes and solutions. You thrive in a fast-paced environment, able to adapt and manage unexpected tasks with ease.

Requirements

  • A relevant technical degree.
  • Strong technical proficiency in deployment, integration, networking, and server configuration.
  • Eagerness to acquire new skills and embrace unexpected challenges.
  • Experience with some of the following:
- IT system servicing- Microsoft-based infrastructure- IT system integrations- MS SQL- Scripting skills- Troubleshooting IT systems
  • Fluency in both Danish and English.
  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to effectively convey technical knowledge in both written and verbal form.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer til Data Foundation
Place: Odense, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Vil du forme fremtidens ML-platform hos TV 2 Danmark?

Vi søger en dygtig specialist inden for machine learning engineering, der er passioneret omkring at sætte machine learning-modeller i produktion og vil være med til at videreudvikle TV 2s ML-platform, som understøtter TV 2s digitale vækst. Her får du muligheden for at bringe dine tekniske evner i spil og bidrage til et miljø kendetegnet ved høj faglighed og samarbejde.

Om afdelingen og teamet

I Data Foundation bliver du en del af Data Platform-teamet, som arbejder målrettet på at gøre data tilgængeligt og værdiskabende for hele TV 2. Teamet består af seks erfarne data engineers og en ML engineer, der sammen skaber løsninger til både store strategiske projekter og daglige udfordringer. Her får du mulighed for at arbejde i et miljø med høj faglighed, hvor samarbejde med eksperter inden for data science, analyse og visualisering er en del af hverdagen.

Rollen – vær med til at sikre TV 2 lykkes med machine learning og AI

Som ML engineer får du en central rolle i videreudviklingen af vores ML-platform, der bidrager til at vores data scientist kan få modeller fra udvikling til produktion. Derudover vil du blive ansvarlig for at skabe løsninger, der er skalerbare, effektive og klar til at understøtte TV 2s ambitioner inden for machine learning og AI.

Dine primære opgaver vil være at:



Produktionssætning af ML-modeller: Arbejd tæt med data scientists for at sikre robuste og værdiskabende løsninger.
Udvikling og vedligehold af ML-platformen: Udnyt Databricks og Azure-services til at skabe morgendagens ML-platform i TV 2, der understøtter fremtidige behov inden for ML og AI.
Byg CI/CD-pipelines: Design og implementér workflows med GitHub Actions.
Overvågning og sikkerhed: Sørg for stabil drift og høj kvalitet af produktionssatte løsninger.
Teknisk sparringspartner: Definér udviklingsprincipper og vær en teknisk sparringspartner på tværs af organisationen.



Dit arbejdssted kan være i København eller Odense.

Om dig

For at lykkes i denne rolle forestiller vi os, at du:



Har en teknisk baggrund inden for matematik, datalogi, data science eller et beslægtet felt.
Har et par års professionel erfaring med machine learning engineering eller beslægtede felter.
Forstår machine learning-projekters livscyklus – fra dataforberedelse til implementering.
Er velbevandret i Python og har kendskab til frameworks som MLflow og scikit-learn.
Erfaring med at arbejde på cloud-platforme som Azure, AWS eller Google.
Fortrolig med software engineering best practices og CI/CD-pipelines.
Har kendskab til containerization og REST API’er.



Det vigtigste er, at du har interesse i at udvikle dig og bidrage til videreudviklingen af vores ML-platform i et miljø, hvor samarbejde og faglig udvikling er i fokus

TV 2 som arbejdsplads

I TV 2s teknologiske område arbejder mere end 350 medarbejdere dedikeret med at understøtte og realisere den koncernstrategiske målsætning om 1,3 millioner Play-abonnenter i 2025.

Målsætningen, der udspringer af 2025-strategien 'TV 2 Play til alle', forudsætter et solidt teknologisk fundament, der gør det muligt for TV 2 også i fremtiden at levere dansk kvalitetsindhold og public service, som danskerne har let adgang til og interesse i at samles om.

TV 2 investerer derfor i disse år massivt i udviklingen og driften af hele den teknologiske værdikæde fra medieteknologi og tv-produktion til digital produktudvikling. Alt sammen med det formål at sikre, at vi imødekommer danskernes behov og forventninger i et omskifteligt marked med stigende, international konkurrence.

Teknologiorganisationen er placeret i både Odense og København, og vi beskæftiger blandt andre Software Engineers, UX-designere, Product Managers, Solution Architects, produktionsspecialister og Data Scientists.

Søg rollen

Du sender din ansøgning med CV via formularen nedenunder. Vi holder løbende samtaler, og lukker stillingen når de rette kandidater er fundet.

Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig!


Show more

Title: CA Gen Developer
Company: Trilogy International, A Korn Ferry Company
Description:
CA Gen Developer Role Overview

We are seeking a CA Gen Developer with hands-on experience using the CA Gen (formerly IEF and COOL: Gen ) 4th generation model-driven development tool.

Required Skills and Experience:

· CA Gen Expertise:

o Comprehensive understanding of CA Gen Model concepts.

o Proficiency with the CA Gen toolset, including:

§ 3270 CA Gen screens.

§ Windows-based CA Gen clients.

§ Com-proxies and Java-proxies.

§ CA Gen Batch applications.

· COBOL Knowledge:

o COBOL programming skills to be able to support the CA Gen programs with external functionality (External Action Blocks (EABs)).

· Mainframe Experience:

o General Mainframe MVS knowledge.

o Including knowledge and experience working with the following technologies:

§ DB2 database management.

§ SDSF (System Display and Search Facility).

§ CICS (Customer Information Control System).

§ JCL (Job Control Language).

§ MQ Series

Title: Freelance AI Security Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Cybersecurity, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:


Generate prompts that challenge AI
Define comprehensive scoring criteria to evaluate the accuracy of the AI's answers
Correct the model's responses based on your domain-specific knowledge



How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements

Required Qualifications:


Strong Linux administration and automation skills (Bash, Python, PowerShell).
Hands-on experience with penetration testing tools (Metasploit, Burp Suite, Nessus, Nmap)
Knowledge of AI security risks, including prompt injection, adversarial attacks, and AI red teaming.
Experience in automating security tasks, securing DevOps workflows, and integrating security into CI/CD pipelines
Cloud security expertise (AWS, Azure, Kubernetes, Terraform, CI/CD security)
Relevant security certifications (OSCP, CEH, CISSP, OSWE, API Security Architect).
Proficiency in English: advanced (C1) or above
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong communication skills for reporting findings and collaborating with teams
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge



Preferred Skills:


Experience in AI red teaming, adversarial ML, LLM security testing.
Deep understanding of networking protocols, OS security, and web application security
Knowledge of OWASP Top Ten, MITRE ATT&CK, and other security frameworks.
Experience with web security (HTTP, API security, web scraping, DOM manipulation).



Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise
Show more

Title: Computer Vision Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join us to shape the future of endoscopy!

Do you want to be part of bringing the cutting-edge application of computer vision and deep learning to the medical field and building a new market within single-use endoscopy? 

Then this might be your defining moment. Join Ambu's Algorithms team and play a pivotal role in revolutionizing healthcare imaging!

Key Responsibilities As Computer Vision Engineer

In this role, you will be part of a team that explores computer vision and AI opportunities, from concept to final product. Your main responsibility will be to design and implement algorithms utilizing computer vision and deep learning. You should expect that a large part of your work will be centered around prototyping, data collection in the lab and getting the software to a production ready state.

Your main tasks will be focused on, but not limited to:


Algorithm development and implementation
Data handling, processing and quality assurance
Data management on servers and in databases, including cleanup
Documentation


Suggested candidate profile

Role

Setting you up for success is one of our cornerstones. In order to do so, we imagine, you have in-depth knowledge of deep learning theory and applications. This role is flexible and can be tailored for both recent graduates and experienced professionals. You are likely to succeed in this position if you have:


An educational background within software, image processing (computer vision), physics, or similar fields
3-10 years of experience working with computer vision, e.g. camera calibration, stereo vision etc.
Experience in real-time image processing e.g. denoising, sharpening etc.
Experience in image quality analysis and with cameras, sensors, or lenses
Experience with C++/python and Pytorch/Tensorflow and with using CUDA or other GPU-programming libraries
Experience in G-streamer and Linux
Accustomed to working with git or similar versioning tools


You are highly motivated with a strong sense of detail. You have the ability to cross-collaborate with different teams. You have a proactive and flexible mind-set combined with the ability to plan, execute, and meet deadlines. You manage to focus, prioritize, and document your results.

 

It is essential that you have excellent communication and English skills, both written and oral, and that you are willing to travel approximately 5-10 days per year when feasible and safe. In this position you are allowed to work from home up to 2 days per week.

How To Apply 

We will invite candidates for interviews on a continuous basis so don't hesitate to apply. 

You can get more information about the job and about Ambu by Head of Algorithms, Andreas Härstedt Jørgensen at ajor@ambu.com
Show more

Title: Senior Software Developer
Description:
About the Company - Do you love programming and problem-solving? Join us in challenging the life and pension sector! We are looking for a Senior Software Developer who, like us, is driven by building solid exciting products using strong software methodologies. What you will join At Festina Finance, we deliver solutions to the biggest pension funds in Denmark and the Netherlands and 30+ banks in Scandinavia and the UK.




You will join a fast-growing and ambitious company, driven by making the best solutions while having fun together as a team. We have a flat and informal organization, which gives you lots of individual responsibility and freedom in your work.




About the Role - Do you enjoy complex challenges? We have a variety of exciting and challenging projects and different tasks for you to be working with, such as:




Working with our business specialists to implement solutions
Programming asynchronous message flows
Helping with integrating components into a large system landscape
Implementing REST APIs
Contributing to our internal tools such as code generators, localization, etc.
Working with testing and performance
Improving our software standard to maintain maximum productivity for the developer team
Working with automatic testing and performance




Responsibilities - Being a good programmer is a must-have for this role, but in addition, there is room for other tasks such as design, build and deployment, testing, documentation, and infrastructure.




Qualifications - Needed skills:




You are driven by software development
Solid programming skills. You have experience with Java, C#, or other languages. We use Java. Maybe you have experience with functional programming.
You may have a good understanding of the financial sector from banking, pension, or investment
You have a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, IT Engineering, or alike.
You are driven to take responsibility and influence others
You are a team player and like collaborating with others on complex solutions.

Show more

  • Helping with integrating components into a large system landscape
  • Implementing REST APIs
  • Contributing to our internal tools such as code generators, localization, etc.
  • Working with testing and performance
  • Improving our software standard to maintain maximum productivity for the developer team
  • Working with automatic testing and performance


Responsibilities - Being a good programmer is a must-have for this role, but in addition, there is room for other tasks such as design, build and deployment, testing, documentation, and infrastructure.


Qualifications - Needed skills:


  • You are driven by software development
  • Solid programming skills. You have experience with Java, C#, or other languages. We use Java. Maybe you have experience with functional programming.
  • You may have a good understanding of the financial sector from banking, pension, or investment
  • You have a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, IT Engineering, or alike.
  • You are driven to take responsibility and influence others
  • You are a team player and like collaborating with others on complex solutions.

Title: Software Engineer, Launch Graduate Program 2025 - Copenhagen, Denmark-R-228710
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Our Purpose

Mastercard powers economies and empowers people in 200+ countries and territories worldwide. Together with our customers, we’re helping build a sustainable economy where everyone can prosper. We support a wide range of digital payments choices, making transactions secure, simple, smart and accessible. Our technology and innovation, partnerships and networks combine to deliver a unique set of products and services that help people, businesses and governments realize their greatest potential.

Title And Summary

Software Engineer, Launch Graduate Program 2025 - Copenhagen, Denmark

Mastercard works to connect and power a sustainable and inclusive global economy. We are a vehicle for commerce, a connection to financial systems for the previously excluded, a technology innovation lab, and the home of Priceless®. We ensure every employee has an opportunity to be a part of something bigger and to change lives. We believe in connecting everyone to endless, priceless possibilities.

About The Team

Mastercard software engineering teams are obsessed with security, reliability, performance, and are driven to deliver solutions that delight our customers. We are looking for talented software engineers to develop advanced technologies and applications that are revolutionizing payments. Software engineers at Mastercard build the systems that process transactions, analyze data, and detect fraud to gain insight into the direction of the economy on behalf of our customers. We are focused on building simple, safe, and smart solutions that instill trust in every interaction. Our industry expertise is enhanced by our commitment to being a force for good in the world and to doing well by doing good.

Launch Program

Role

The Launch program is a development program that is supplemental to the role and is designed to help you transition from being a student to being a Mastercard employee. In this program, you will participate in:


Four-day orientation focused on getting to know Mastercard, building your skills, and be a force for good (Mastercard’s culture)
Technical orientation focused on an introduction to tools, policies, and processes that are key to your role
Professional skills workshops
Launch innovation week
Social impact – pro bono team challenge
Global volunteer challenge



Role Description

As a Software Engineer I, you will have the opportunity to:


write high-quality code with a focus on security, design, and maintainability.
contribute to all phases of software development from design through rollout.
find real-life solutions for our clients and the world.



Software engineers working on Mastercard's open banking platform play a key role in the development and maintenance of the products that secure high quality connectivity to banks across Europe. Building on the strong foundation of our state-of-the-art bank connectivity APIs, the engineers create turn-key solutions that take the burden of handling account information and payment initiation services from customers that want to spend their efforts building great products that leverage the full potential of the open banking standard.

Open banking engineers work at the bleeding edge of the account information and payment initiation technologies, often solving problems that are yet to be tackled within the industry in areas of API security, data accessibility, processing, and analysis. You will be joining a group of highly skilled individuals working together as a team to push the limits of what is possible to achieve with open banking.

You will have many colleagues around different countries, with your nearest peers being located primarily in Denmark, Ireland, Poland, and Romania.

You will be spending most of your time in the Microsoft domain, meaning APIs built in C# with .NET (latest version) and ASP.NET deployed to the cloud (Azure). Knowledge of at least some of these areas is a great benefit. However, we believe that learning is a part of the job, so do not hesitate to apply even you have not worked with these technologies before. After all, we are looking for talented engineers, regardless of background.

What you’ll need


To be available for start from September 2025
To be a Final Year Masters/Undergraduate Student or to have graduated no earlier than September 2024
Studying Computer Science, Engineering or similar
Strong verbal and written communication skills in English
Passion for solving problems



Application Process


Submit your application
If eligible, receive invitation for a coding assessment
If recommended to advance, receive invitation for final round interview(s); you will have the opportunity to meet with us virtually to learn more about our business and culture



This role is not eligible for Mastercard’s work authorization sponsorship. As such, candidates must be eligible to work in Denmark, now as well as in the future, without employer sponsorship.

Corporate Security Responsibility

All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:


Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.
