R-228710

Title: Sr Solutions Engineer, Nordics
Description:
About Us

At Cloudflare, we are on a mission to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the world’s largest networks that powers millions of websites and other Internet properties for customers ranging from individual bloggers to SMBs to Fortune 500 companies. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare all have web traffic routed through its intelligent global network, which gets smarter with every request. As a result, they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was named to Entrepreneur Magazine’s Top Company Cultures list and ranked among the World’s Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company.

We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills, and we are ready to help you do that. We cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. We hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at Cloudflare. Come join us!

Location: Copenhagen

What You’ll Do

Cloudflare’s solutions engineering function is responsible for collaborating with clients from early-stage ideation through to planning for production. Being much more than an expert solely in Cloudflare’s services, our Senior Solutions Engineers are expected to sit alongside our peers in our clients, and to contribute their energy, ideas and opinion on solving the hard problems we face in our industry today. Often this means deep work on the art-of-the possible (and sometimes being willing to put aside preconceptions on the impossible!).

On any given day, the role will provide both a challenging and rewarding opportunity to develop adjacent technology expertise as well as mastering key skills relating to technical and industry advocacy on behalf of our clients. A key aspect will be offering good* practice guidance and adopting a deploy-to-production mindset, where it is as much about the operational process as it is about the product.

As part of our broader solutions engineering community, you will be working alongside peers with deep subject-matter expertise and industry knowledge upon whose insights will support your own. Of course, as a senior member of the team, you will also be in a position to contribute to a body-of-knowledge across key domains of networking, cybersecurity and edge computing, as well as industry analyses and perspectives.

For this role, our Solutions Engineering team members focus on large clients for whom we are able to develop deep understanding and partnership to collaborate with. Building on a track-record of success, this role has an emphasis on supporting our clients in both local and central government, as well as select private sector clients where appropriate. Previous experience in supporting the public sector is beneficial, however not mandatory.


As an SE, there will often be more than one way to solve a problem - hence what might be a best practice in a given context might not be true in another!. This is where your experience will help.



Who We Are

The problems that our clients face are both diverse and unique - which is reflected in how we think about our Solution Engineering team. Building on the benefit of the hive-mind, our SE team is made up of individuals from a wide range of backgrounds - from end-customers to other vendors, Financial Consulting to Product Management, Customer Support to Software Engineering. In short, if we are to solve complex problems we need a diverse, curious and collaborative team.

Cloudflare’s mission is one which is both simple and timeless, to help build a better Internet. This requires a broad set of services and associated knowledge of Internet performance and security technology. We recognise many of our team usually join us with one or two core domains of expertise, however key to success is the curiosity to maintain and develop new knowledge which is essential to keeping up with the high rate of product innovation at Cloudflare.

In our aim to support your success, all the resources and training required to build a custom personal development plan to be effective for the role, will be provided.

As mentioned, the emphasis on working with public sector clients would benefit from having previously held Security Clearance (SC) status, however this is not mandatory.

Examples Of Desirable Skills, Knowledge And Experience

Our Solutions Engineers come from a wide range of backgrounds: IT, engineering, software development, product management, financial consulting, customer support & project delivery. We're serious about building a diverse team. When hiring we look for diversity of experience combined with genuine curiosity for our technology.

Ultimately, you are passionate about technology and have the ability to explain complex technical concepts in easy-to-understand terms. You are naturally curious, and an avid builder who is not afraid to get your hands dirty. You appreciate the diversity of challenges in working with customers, and look forward to helping them realise the full promise of Cloudflare. On the Solutions Engineering team, you will find a collaborative environment where everyone brings different strengths and jumps in to help each other.

You will have a good fundamental understanding on how to manage technical validation projects so that customers can have an informed opinion on the best solution to a given problem - with an eye on what could come next.

Additional experience might include a combination of the skills below:


Showing up in the right-way: bringing a positive attitude, open-minded to new ideas and bringing your energy and ideas to help our clients and our team succeed.
8+ years of experience in the IT industry (mid-level or senior engineering level experience).
Ability to manage a project, work to deadlines, and prioritise between competing demands.
Demonstrating empathy with customers and quickly identifying challenges and pain points they face.
Understanding of “how the internet works”. For example:
Know the differences between TCP & UDP, and understand what kinds of applications may favour one over the other;
Can explain the difference between authoritative DNS & recursive DNS?;
You understand the role of a firewall, why TLS (SSL) plays an increasingly important role on today's Internet, a solid understanding of HTTP and a willingness to dive deeper into the quirks of clients & servers alike;
Understanding of how customers make buying decisions, how to explain ROI.
A knowledge of the competitive landscape for one or more of: DDoS, CDN, Performance, DNS, Developer platform or Zero-Trust/SASE service providers.
You're OK with some in-region travel (15:30 days per quarter): eg. Being next to our clients means that we need to travel to customer offices, conferences and/or events.
Located within commuting distance from Copenhagen for customer meetings


Bonus!


Previous experience in a pre-sales SE or consulting role. (note: doesn't have to be in tech);
Demonstrated experience with a scripting language (e.g. Python, JavaScript, Bash) and a desire to expand those skills;
Exposure to emerging technical landscape trends such as machine learning, GenAI, DevOps, security operations etc.



What Makes Cloudflare Special?

We’re not just a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company. We’re a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company with a soul. Fundamental to our mission to help build a better Internet is protecting the free and open Internet.

Project Galileo: Since 2014, we've equipped more than 2,400 journalism and civil society organizations in 111 countries with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work, technology already used by Cloudflare’s enterprise customers--at no cost.

Athenian Project: In 2017, we created the Athenian Project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free, so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration. Since the project, we've provided services to more than 425 local government election websites in 33 states.

1.1.1.1: We released 1.1.1.1 to help fix the foundation of the Internet by building a faster, more secure and privacy-centric public DNS resolver. This is available publicly for everyone to use - it is the first consumer-focused service Cloudflare has ever released. Here’s the deal - we don’t store client IP addresses never, ever. We will continue to abide by our privacy commitment and ensure that no user data is sold to advertisers or used to target consumers.

Sound like something you’d like to be a part of? We’d love to hear from you!

This position may require access to information protected under U.S. export control laws, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations. Please note that any offer of employment may be conditioned on your authorization to receive software or technology controlled under these U.S. export laws without sponsorship for an export license.

Cloudflare is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all people and place great value in both diversity and inclusiveness. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their, or any other person's, perceived or actual race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, or any other basis protected by law. We are an AA/Veterans/Disabled Employer.

Cloudflare provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job. Examples of reasonable accommodations include, but are not limited to, changing the application process, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job, please contact us via e-mail at hr@cloudflare.com or via mail at 101 Townsend St. San Francisco, CA 94107.

Title: Software Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Software Engineer og Azure udvikler




Har du evnen og interessen for at prøve kræfter med udvikling af komplekse Azure cloud-løsninger? cVation søger erfarne software udviklere til at indgå i vores voksende team, hvor høj faglighed, innovation og udviklerglæde er i højsæde.




cVation er et dansk udviklings- og konsulenthus, som bygger avancerede cloud-løsninger på Azure med afsæt i markedets hurtigste og mest agile metoder. cVation blev stiftet i 2014, har modtaget tre Børsen Gazeller og vundet Microsofts Partner Award for App Innovation tre år i træk. Vi arbejder dedikeret med agile arbejdsmetoder, DevOps og Test Driven Development, og er på forkant med mange af de nye teknologier, herunder IoT. Vi sætter desuden en ære i at levere software af den højeste kvalitet.

Hvilken rolle får du?




Du vil blive en del af et team, der designer og udvikler avancerede cloud-løsninger på MS Azure. Din rolle bliver bl.a. at rådgive om valg af Azure services, implementere og vedligeholde værktøjer, der sikrer continuous integration og continuous delivery og understøtter applikationsudviklingen. Vi har en meget høj release-frekvens i vores projekter, da brugen af vores egenudviklede tool CADD resulterer i ekstremt agile IT-projekter.




Udviklerne i cVation er samlet i teams på 5-8 udviklere. Du vil have fuldt fokus på et projekt/team af gangen. Ud over de hyppige releases til produktion har vi en ekstrem høj grad af automatisering af alt fra unit tests til integrationstests og UI-tests. Det betyder, at de repetitive processer er fjernet, så der er luft til at tænke innovativt, hvilket kommer vores kunder til gode. Kort sagt får de hurtigere udviklede løsninger af højere kvalitet og med en større forretningsmæssig værdi – og du får mulighed for faglig fordybelse og udvikle dig indenfor de nyeste teknologier.




Vi har også etableret et CCoE (Cloud Center of Excellence), som løbende vurderer nye cloud services og opdaterer værktøjskassen med relevante opdateringer. CCoE arbejder tæt sammen med de enkelte udviklingsteams, som har fingeren på pulsen ude på kundeprojekterne.

Hvad forventer vi af dig?




Erfaring med cloud udvikling og særligt PaaS services fra MS Azure, vil være en klar fordel.

Kandidat i softwareudvikling
Du er erfaren i C#, og at du går op i kodekvalitet og at skrive testbar kode
Du vil gerne arbejde med de nyeste teknologier i Azure med hovedfokus på PaaS
Du har erfaring med at arbejde med automatisering af byg og test af applikationer
Du har erfaring med softwareudvikling og gerne webudvikling
Du vil gerne indgå i et agilt setup, hvor krav og retning hurtigt kan ændres, men hvor medbestemmelse og frihed er i højsædet
Du har arbejdet med automatisering af test, build og release pipelines samt Infrastructure as code
Du er vant til at arbejde med versionskontrol, gerne Git
Du taler/skriver flydende dansk, og taler/skriver engelsk på et medium/højt niveau.

Som person er du ansvarsbevidst, initiativrig, eksekverende og resultatorienteret. Du gør dig umage med dine opgaver og trives med at løfte i flok som del af et team. Hvis du også er engageret, nysgerrig, drevet af at lære nyt og sætter en ære i at dygtiggøre dig passer du perfekt ind hos os. Du må også gerne gå op i at forbedre både kode, værktøjer samt processer.

Hvad tilbyder vi?




Du kommer til at indgå i vores voksende team, hvor høj faglighed, innovation og arbejdsglæde er i højsæde. Det høje faglige niveau blandt dine kollegaer giver en unik mulighed for at arbejde med de bedste, og vi tager din faglige udvikling alvorligt. Vi har en flad organisation med et minimum af administration, hvor ledelsens døre altid er åbne, og der er god plads til både bordfodbold, fredagsbar, frokost på kajen og et aktivt liv udenfor arbejdstid. Flere gange om året afholder vi hackathons, hvor vi i teams dykker ned i præcis de emner, som udviklerne finder interessante. En del af vores kultur er også, at vi gerne ser alle komme med input til hvordan vi kan optimere, forbedre og udvikle cVation.

Hvorfor vælge os som din nye arbejdsplads?




Vores fundament er løsninger bygget på Microsoft Azure Cloud. Alle vores medarbejdere mestrer cloud-native udvikling og DevOps. Vi arbejder i projekter og engagerer os hands-on i fælles teams med vores kunder for at sikre kvalitet og effektiv videndeling.




Vi er passionerede omkring at hjælpe vores kunder med at få det maksimale ud af cloudteknologien. For os er cloud ikke blot infrastruktur eller et nyt datacenter i skyen. Teknologien giver virksomheder mulighed for at skabe væsentligt mere værdi og arbejde med agilitet og innovation på en helt ny måde.




Vi har været med fra starten, da cloud blev udviklet og tilgængeligt. Vi tilbyder således vores årelange erfaring og dybe cloud ekspertise samt en værktøjskasse med alle vores best practices i form af accelerationsplatformen CADD. Den dækker over gennemprøvede værktøjer, rammeværk, effektive udviklingsmetoder og færdige automatiseringskomponenter. Alt dette for at sikre, at projekter kommer hurtigt og sikkert fra start.




Du vil få kollegaer, der er interesseret i at lære og har ønske om at blive de bedste til det, de gør. Vi tilbyder derfor gode muligheder for at udvikle dig. Du vil blive en del af en virksomhed, som tror på, at alle har betydning, og at det skal være sjovt at gå på arbejde hver dag.

Interesseret?




Klik på Easy Apply knappen, hvis du vil arbejde med de nyeste teknologier. Vi behandler din ansøgning fortroligt og arrangerer løbende interviews.




Har du spørgsmål til jobbet, eller vil du høre mere om cVation, er du meget velkommen til at kontakte:




Maiken Pelby, Head of People & Culture, T/ 42612828, map@cvation.com




Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig!

Show more
HTML:
Software Engineer og Azure udvikler


Har du evnen og interessen for at prøve kræfter med udvikling af komplekse Azure cloud-løsninger? cVation søger erfarne software udviklere til at indgå i vores voksende team, hvor høj faglighed, innovation og udviklerglæde er i højsæde.


cVation er et dansk udviklings- og konsulenthus, som bygger avancerede cloud-løsninger på Azure med afsæt i markedets hurtigste og mest agile metoder. cVation blev stiftet i 2014, har modtaget tre Børsen Gazeller og vundet Microsofts Partner Award for App Innovation tre år i træk. Vi arbejder dedikeret med agile arbejdsmetoder, DevOps og Test Driven Development, og er på forkant med mange af de nye teknologier, herunder IoT. Vi sætter desuden en ære i at levere software af den højeste kvalitet.

Hvilken rolle får du?


Du vil blive en del af et team, der designer og udvikler avancerede cloud-løsninger på MS Azure. Din rolle bliver bl.a. at rådgive om valg af Azure services, implementere og vedligeholde værktøjer, der sikrer continuous integration og continuous delivery og understøtter applikationsudviklingen. Vi har en meget høj release-frekvens i vores projekter, da brugen af vores egenudviklede tool CADD resulterer i ekstremt agile IT-projekter.


Udviklerne i cVation er samlet i teams på 5-8 udviklere. Du vil have fuldt fokus på et projekt/team af gangen. Ud over de hyppige releases til produktion har vi en ekstrem høj grad af automatisering af alt fra unit tests til integrationstests og UI-tests. Det betyder, at de repetitive processer er fjernet, så der er luft til at tænke innovativt, hvilket kommer vores kunder til gode. Kort sagt får de hurtigere udviklede løsninger af højere kvalitet og med en større forretningsmæssig værdi – og du får mulighed for faglig fordybelse og udvikle dig indenfor de nyeste teknologier.


Vi har også etableret et CCoE (Cloud Center of Excellence), som løbende vurderer nye cloud services og opdaterer værktøjskassen med relevante opdateringer. CCoE arbejder tæt sammen med de enkelte udviklingsteams, som har fingeren på pulsen ude på kundeprojekterne.

Hvad forventer vi af dig?


Erfaring med cloud udvikling og særligt PaaS services fra MS Azure, vil være en klar fordel.

  • Kandidat i softwareudvikling
  • Du er erfaren i C#, og at du går op i kodekvalitet og at skrive testbar kode
  • Du vil gerne arbejde med de nyeste teknologier i Azure med hovedfokus på PaaS
  • Du har erfaring med at arbejde med automatisering af byg og test af applikationer
  • Du har erfaring med softwareudvikling og gerne webudvikling
  • Du vil gerne indgå i et agilt setup, hvor krav og retning hurtigt kan ændres, men hvor medbestemmelse og frihed er i højsædet
  • Du har arbejdet med automatisering af test, build og release pipelines samt Infrastructure as code
  • Du er vant til at arbejde med versionskontrol, gerne Git
  • Du taler/skriver flydende dansk, og taler/skriver engelsk på et medium/højt niveau.

Som person er du ansvarsbevidst, initiativrig, eksekverende og resultatorienteret. Du gør dig umage med dine opgaver og trives med at løfte i flok som del af et team. Hvis du også er engageret, nysgerrig, drevet af at lære nyt og sætter en ære i at dygtiggøre dig passer du perfekt ind hos os. Du må også gerne gå op i at forbedre både kode, værktøjer samt processer.

Hvad tilbyder vi?


Du kommer til at indgå i vores voksende team, hvor høj faglighed, innovation og arbejdsglæde er i højsæde. Det høje faglige niveau blandt dine kollegaer giver en unik mulighed for at arbejde med de bedste, og vi tager din faglige udvikling alvorligt. Vi har en flad organisation med et minimum af administration, hvor ledelsens døre altid er åbne, og der er god plads til både bordfodbold, fredagsbar, frokost på kajen og et aktivt liv udenfor arbejdstid. En del af vores kultur er også, at vi gerne ser alle komme med input til hvordan vi kan optimere, forbedre og udvikle cVation.

Hvorfor vælge os som din nye arbejdsplads?


Vores fundament er løsninger bygget på Microsoft Azure Cloud. Alle vores medarbejdere mestrer cloud-native udvikling og DevOps. Vi arbejder i projekter og engagerer os hands-on i fælles teams med vores kunder for at sikre kvalitet og effektiv videndeling.


Vi er passionerede omkring at hjælpe vores kunder med at få det maksimale ud af cloudteknologien. For os er cloud ikke blot infrastruktur eller et nyt datacenter i skyen. Teknologien giver virksomheder mulighed for at skabe væsentligt mere værdi og arbejde med agilitet og innovation på en helt ny måde.

Interesseret?


Klik på Easy Apply knappen, hvis du vil arbejde med de nyeste teknologier. Vi behandler din ansøgning fortroligt og arrangerer løbende interviews.


Har du spørgsmål til jobbet, eller vil du høre mere om cVation, er du meget velkommen til at kontakte:

Title: [EXPIRED] A 3-year Postdoc in Neuroimaging with focus on Cerebral Blood Flow and Metabolism
Company: Danish Research Centre for Magnetic Resonance (DRCMR)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
If your interest lies within MRI sequence optimization and development and you have a talent for image processing and data analysis, you might be the postdoc we are looking for!

As a postdoctoral researcher at the Danish Research Centre for Magnetic Resonance (DRCMR) you will develop multi-parametric MRI sequences and/or processing methods specifically designed for neuroscientific applications within cerebral blood flow and metabolism assessment e.g. in the form of calibrated BOLD, resting state fMRI, blood brain barrier integrity (DCE/DP-pCASL) and other upcoming methods. You will be involved in a particular study aiming at pharmacological improvement of cerebral blood flow and cognition in patients with cerebral small vessel disease.

You will contribute to an exciting field with opportunities to develop advanced MRI techniques and new computational methods in a multidisciplinary team of biomedical and clinical experts. You will be part of the Ultra-high-field MR group and the Brain Body Interaction group and you will also have a strong interaction with the Stroke Unit at Herlev hospital.

DRCMR is one of the leading research centers for biomedical MRI in Europe (www.drcmr.dk). We are an interdisciplinary research centre and our mission is to triangulate MR physics, basic physiology, and clinical research. Approximately 70 researchers from a diverse range of disciplines work together to pursue basic and clinically applied MR research with a focus on structural, functional, and metabolic MRI of the human brain and its disorders. Collaboration is key at DRCMR – we do not expect any researcher to be able to do everything alone, but we expect everyone to be interested in sharing knowledge with colleagues.

The DRCMR is embedded in the Center for Functional and Diagnostic Imaging and Research, a large diagnostic imaging department including all biomedical imaging modalities at Copenhagen University Hospital Hvidovre. DRCMR has close interaction with clinicians and radiologists and a state-of-the-art MR-research infrastructure, which includes a pre-clinical 7T MR scanner, six whole-body MR scanners (one 7T, three 3T and two 1.5T scanners), a neuropsychology laboratory, an EEG laboratory, and two laboratories for non-invasive brain stimulation.

Your Profile

You should be a self-motivated, creative and enthusiastic researcher with:


A PhD degree in engineering, physics, biomedical sciences or a related field.
A clear interest in MRI image acquisition and image analysis.
Affinity with medical applications.
Expertise in software development is essential, preferably in Matlab/Python/C++
It is desirable to have experience in MRI sequence programming
Strong communication and collaborative skills.
Previous experience with MRI acquisition and data analysis is a requirement.


Your Tasks


To work directly with neuroimaging researchers to ensure that our research studies, in particular our small vessel disease studies take full advantage of the clinical information available in the multi-parametric MRI images (structural, functional and metabolic) as well as from the cognitive and functional tests.
To develop novel sequences and imaging analysis methods.
To advance the field through your own research.
To engage in internal education, grant writing, knowledge dissemination, and publication of results in international, recognized scientific journals.


Your Position

You will be employed for a three-year period at the Danish Research Centre for Magnetic Resonance where you will be part of the Ultra-high-field MR group.

Salary And Terms Of Employment

Salary, pension and terms of employment are in accordance with the agreement between the Danish Regions (Danske Regioner) and the relevant professional organization. The salary depends on background education and seniority. Further, supplements can be negotiated. Note that candidates coming from abroad may be eligible for tax reductions. The position is open for candidates of all nationalities. We see diversity as strength and encourage everyone regardless of gender, age, ethnicity, disabilities or religion to apply.

Applications should include a cover letter, CV and list of publications. Applications must be submitted online through the Region H job portal. Click HERE.

Application deadline: 1 December 2021 at 08:00 (CET)

For further information regarding the position, please contact Associate Professor Esben Thade Petersen. Phone: +45 60577205; Email: esben.thade.petersen@regionh.dk

Title: Industry Master: Python developer for "working smarter”
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to be part of a fantastic development team that thrives on innovation because they can? And can you see yourself working in a market-leading company developing engines for the propulsion of large ships? Can you imagine having the opportunity to improve the daily work of nearly 40 engineers? If yes, we look forward to having you on board at MAN Energy Solutions.

In recent years, there has been a significant focus on reducing the environmental impact of engines and increasing the flexibility of engine control through digitalization. You will play a key role in this latter aspect.

You Will Play An Important Role In

We are looking for a highly committed student assistant to join our groups responsible for designing solutions for the electronic control of our engines. Your mission is to make the day-to-day life more efficient for our control engineers in these groups by using all the good tricks up your sleeve to develop some kickass scripts and applications.

More Specifically, Our New Python Master Will


Write scripts for automating various processes (Python)
Handle scripts and small GUI applications for automatic software tests (Python)
Develop applications for automatic software updates of physical test systems (Python)
Further develop various helper tools for data processing and plotting (Python)
Maintain and further develop build server setups and scripts (Jenkins)
Make minor adjustments in application code and simulation environments (embedded C++)


We Imagine That You

This position is specifically for individuals enrolled in an industry master’s program. The industry master is a 4-year part-time master’s degree that combines academic studies with practical work experience in the industry, allowing you to earn a salary while studying. To be eligible, you must be enrolled in a master’s program and able to work at least 25 hours per week. Working hours will be structured to align with your educational schedule.

We Imagine You Are a Computer Science Student Or Similar, Interested In Enrolling In The Industry Master’s Program. Additionally, You


Are among the top of your class
Have a good understanding of Python script programming – preferably also involving GUIs
Are self-driven, have an analytical approach, and the ability to create good long-term solutions
Enjoy social interaction and collaboration with colleagues
Possess a high level of English proficiency, both written and spoken


It Would Be An Additional Advantage If You


Have programming experience in one or more of the following:
C++
MATLAB
Jenkins
Are interested in mechanics/electronics/engines, especially within the maritime sector

Welcome to the department Tools and HILS

You will become part of the Automation & Control department. This department is responsible for delivering the software that controls the world's largest two-stroke engines and consists of about 40 highly engaged engineers. We are divided into smaller groups, and you will join the TOOLS team. A cornerstone of the team's methodology is transparency and the belief that multiple heads think better than one. This is reflected in our frequent discussions about our tasks. We make an effort to present tasks clearly and are open to input from others. We also have a strong team spirit and host several social events throughout the year, which we hope you will enjoy being part of.

What can you expect from us?

At MAN Energy Solutions, we offer challenging tasks, an inspiring work environment, and extensive interdisciplinary collaboration - both locally and across borders. We have a high ceiling and many highly qualified and skilled colleagues working in over 120 locations around the world. We offer competitive salaries with pensions and a range of other benefits, including:


An exciting and challenging job in an international environment
The perfect part-time job with adjustable workload according to study commitments
An informal work atmosphere with a great vibe and widespread helpfulness
Excellent cafeteria and Friday bar
Student network
High flexibility
Health insurance, access to physiotherapy, etc.


Unleash your potential: Join us towards a carbon-neutral future

At MAN Energy Solutions, we offer you an opportunity to shape the future while achieving your career goals.

We understand that balancing work life and personal life can be a challenge. This is why we prioritize providing our employees with the best opportunities to achieve this balance. In addition to flexible working hours, the option to work from home, and a focus on brain breaks during the day, we also offer over 7 weeks of paid time off distributed across vacation days, extra days off, and flex days.

We focus on diversity and equality to create a creative and inclusive culture and believe that a mix of gender, nationalities, and different perspectives, drives innovation, creativity, and productivity in our organization. We are committed to our employees’ well-being, and you will get the opportunity to join different social activities clubs from yoga and fishing clubs to creative clubs.

At MAN Energy Solutions you can create, drive, build, and be a part of improving innovative energy solutions while achieving your personal career goals. Here you have opportunities for growth, development, and mentorship. 

In 2027, MAN Energy Solutions will move to Trekroner in Roskilde. Here we will consolidate all our current locations on Zealand into one large site.

About The Student Network

The MAN Student Network is a community made for students by students at MAN Energy Solutions Denmark. The network has the purpose of connecting students in Denmark with the benefit of establishing strong academic and social relationships across group departments, but also as an opportunity to expand the academic network, which ultimately may prove to provide the first full scale step toward a future career at MAN Energy Solutions.

The students within the network have the opportunity to provide recommendations and improvements and actively affect the concept of this network.

About MAN Energy Solutions


250 years of experience in advanced engineering
We deliver a unique portfolio of technologies and opportunities in the development of engines for use on ships and in power plants across the globe
We operate under the motto "Future in The Making" as it reflects our dedication to developing sustainable solutions and actively contributing to a carbon-neutral economy
We have over 15,000 employees worldwide. In Denmark, we are 2,200 passionate employees with more than 40 nationalities


Build your own future

If this job sounds right for you, we look forward to hearing from you! Please submit your application to us and please remember to attach a motivated application, CV, and relevant documents such as grades transcripts. There will be a final deadline of the 1st of June, but we will conduct interviews on an ongoing basis and hope to find the right candidate before the application deadline. We expect to start the screening of candidates and initial interviews during Q2 of 2025. If you have any questions, you are welcome to contact Head of Dept. For Tools and HILS, Bjørn Eskildsen at email: bjoern.eskildsen@man-es.com. More information about the company can be found at www.man-es.com .

At MAN Energy Solutions, we strive for an inclusive and fair recruitment process for our job applicants based on equity. We encourage all qualified candidates, regardless of gender, age, religion, disability and ethnic background to apply for this position. Therefore, please refrain from attaching a photo to your CV or cover letter. Furthermore, assistive tools will be available when needed, for example for dyslexia.

Title: [EXPIRED] Postdoc in Deep Learning based MRI Image Analysis and Outcome Prediction
Company: Danish Research Centre for Magnetic Resonance (DRCMR)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Your Profile

You should be a creative and enthusiastic researcher with:


A PhD degree in computer science, data science, engineering, physics, biomedical sciences or a related field.
A clear interest in image analysis using machine learning and deep learning.
Affinity with medical applications.
Expertise in software development is essential, preferably in Python/C++.
Strong communication and collaborative skills.
Previous experience with MRI acquisition and data analysis is advantageous but not a requirement.


Your Tasks


To work directly with neuroimaging researchers to ensure that our research studies, in particular our aging, Dementia and Parkinsonism studies take full advantage of the clinical information available in the multi-parametric MRI images (structural, functional and metabolic) as well from the cognitive and functional tests.
To develop novel imaging analysis methods rooted in deep learning algorithms.
To advance the field through your own research.
To engage in internal education, grant writing, knowledge dissemination, and publication of results in international, recognized scientific journals.


Your Position

You will be employed for a three-year period at the Danish Research Centre for Magnetic Resonance where you will be part of the Ultra-high-field MR group and the Computational Neuroimaging group.

Salary And Terms Of Employment

Salary, pension and terms of employment are in accordance with the agreement between the Danish Regions (Danske Regioner) and the relevant professional organization. The salary depends on background education and seniority. Further, supplements can be negotiated. Note that candidates coming from abroad may be eligible for tax reductions. The position is open for candidates of all nationalities. We see diversity as strength and encourage everyone regardless of gender, age, ethnicity, disabilities or religion to apply.

Applications should include a cover letter, CV and list of publications. Applications must be submitted online through the Region H job portal. Click HERE.

Application deadline: 16 August 2020 at 24:00 (CET)

For further information regarding the position, please contact Associate Professor Esben Thade Petersen. Phone: +45 60577205; Email: esben.thade.petersen@regionh.dk

Title: Quality Assurance Engineer
Place: Aarhus Municipality, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
TeqLink søger QA Engineer til Aarhus og Midtjylland

Vores kunde, Q Nation er en konsulentvirksomhed med 65 fastansatte specialister indenfor softwaretest og kvalitetssikring, og vi arbejder med både store private og offentlige organisationer i Danmark.




Vi søger nu en erfaren QA Engineer, der brænder for kvalitetssikring og teknologisk udvikling.




Hos Q Nation bliver du en del af Danmarks stærkeste team indenfor softwaretest og kvalitetssikring, og tilbyder enestående muligheder for faglig udvikling. Q Nation tror på, at det skal være både enkelt og motiverende at være medarbejder hos dem.




Som konsulent hos Q Nation kommer du til at arbejde på projekter hos en af de faste kunder, primært i Aarhus og Midtjylland. Du vil have mulighed for at udvikle dig professionelt, da opgaverne varierer, og du vil få erfaring med forskellige teknologier, brancher og arbejdsmetoder.




Typisk varer en opgave 6 - 12 måneder eller længere, hvilket giver dig stabilitet og mulighed for at dykke ned i komplekse problemstillinger hos kunderne. Konsulentrollen kræver, at du er omstillingsparat og trives i et dynamisk arbejdsmiljø, hvor du løbende lærer nyt og tilpasser dig forskellige kunders behov.




Dine arbejdsopgaver:

Som QA Engineer får du en central rolle i kvalitetssikring og testaktiviteter i agile udviklingsprojekter. Dine opgaver vil blandt andet omfatte:

Strukturering og design af tests
Testautomatisering og performance/loadtest
Arbejde med en eller flere af følgende teknologier og værktøjer:
API test, fx REST / SOAP med Postman
UI test, fx med Playwright eller Cypress
CI og Pipelines, fx med Jenkins eller Github Actions
Opsætning af testmiljøer og testdata




Kvalifikationer:

Vi forventer, at du har:

Minimum 5 års erfaring med test og kvalitetssikring
Gerne ISTQB-certificering på avanceret niveau eller vilje til at opnå det
Erfaring med både testprocesser, struktureret test, testdesignteknikker, system- og integrationstest samt agile udviklingsmetoder
En analytisk og struktureret tilgang til testarbejde




Om Q Nation:

Hos Q Nation lægges der stor vægt på et stærkt fællesskab – både fagligt og socialt. Virksomheden tilbyder:

Attraktive løn- og ansættelsesforhold, der matcher dine kompetencer
Et uformelt arbejdsmiljø med kort vej til beslutningstagning (kun to niveauer i organisationen)
Mulighed for op til 70 timers årlig uddannelse
Fokus på din udvikling og specialisering, så du kan arbejde med det, du brænder for




Er du klar til at blive en del af Danmarks stærkeste team inden for softwaretest? Kontakt Louise Mærsk fra teqLink på Louise@teqlink.dk eller send dit CV allerede i dag!

Show more

Title: Senior Scientist for Mammalian Expression Engineering
Place: Måløv, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Novo Nordisk is at the forefront of expanding research in both core and emerging therapeutic areas. We are on the lookout for a seasoned Senior Scientist with expertise in protein design and mammalian expression to boost our discovery pipeline.

If you thrive in an international scientific environment that values empowerment, employee well-being, and data-driven decision-making, we want to hear from you. Join us in our mission to improve lives through innovative pharmaceutical solutions. Apply today!

The position
As a Senior Scientist in Mammalian Expression Engineering, you will play a crucial role in advancing our early project portfolio. Our work is facilitated by multidisciplinary project teams, wherein you will offer your scientific expertise in designing proteins for successful mammalian expression.

Your responsibilities will include:



Expressing proteins for early proof-of-concept activities, many of which are challenging to express and require modifications and optimizations to be successful.
Designing and expressing the proteins necessary for developing therapeutic products.
In project teams, collaborating with other scientists on designing, analyzing, evaluating and developing recombinant therapeutic proteins.
Designing and expressing potential recombinant therapeutic lead candidate proteins and generating cell lines for the subsequent production of selected lead candidates.
Facilitating the transfer of these lead candidates for further development within CMC.




Innovation and scientific development are key parts of your role. Working alongside talented colleagues, you will share ideas and inspiration, demonstrate good stakeholder management and cross-collaboration, and be flexible and adaptable in an often-changing research environment.

Qualifications

You hold a PhD in biotechnology, molecular biology, mammalian cell biology, or a related field with 3-5 years of experience in protein design and expression, focusing on mammalian protein expression. Alternatively, you have a relevant Master’s degree combined with 6-10 years of research experience in the field as described above.

To thrive and succeed in the role, you have:



Solid experience with recombinant protein design and a thorough understanding of mammalian protein expression.
In-depth insight into mammalian cell cultivation.
Experience working in the pharmaceutical or biotech industry is beneficial.
Experience with working in high throughput with liquid handlers and automation, including programming, will be considered an advantage.
A strong drive to optimize and further develop ongoing processes.




As a person, you are driven by using your skills in protein design and expression to bring potential medicine to patients. You apply your creativity to find solutions to the scientific challenges you encounter, and you share knowledge and experience freely with other scientists, lab technicians, and researchers to further our common cause. You possess excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with multidisciplinary teams. Being proactive and a dedicated team player are some of the key attributes we are seeking in potential candidates.

About The Department

The Mammalian Expression Engineering department is part of the Expression Engineering Research area, which includes three departments focused on microbial and mammalian expression technologies. These departments handle recombinant protein engineering and expression, strain development, and cell line development. Our diverse capabilities enable us to tackle complex research challenges and develop innovative solutions in protein expression and engineering.

The Expression Engineering Research area is part of the Recombinant Drug Research area (RDR), where we collaborate across the full research value chain to discover and advance innovative recombinant protein and peptide therapeutic candidates. RDR fosters a vibrant scientific culture and seamlessly connects broad competencies across multidisciplinary teams, all motivated by revolutionizing the development of therapies for a wide range of serious chronic diseases.

Working at Novo Nordisk
At Novo Nordisk, we do not wait for change. We drive it. We are a dynamic company in an even more dynamic industry, and we know that what got us to where we are today is not necessarily what will make us successful in the future. We embrace the spirit of experimentation, striving for excellence, without fixating on perfection. We never shy away from opportunities to develop, we seize them. From research and development to manufacturing, marketing, and sales – we’re all working to move the needle on patient care.

Contact
For further information, please contact Christina Andersen, Department Manager of Mammalian Expression Engineering at +45 3075 3960.

Deadline
March 16, 2025.

If you see yourself in the description above, please apply sooner rather than later, as we review applications and schedule interviews on an ongoing basis.

You do not need to attach a cover letter to your application – just include a few sentences in your CV explaining why you are applying. Please also avoid the use of photos in your CV to ensure a fair and unbiased process.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we’re life changing.
Show more

Title: Senior Software Engineer
Description:
At Concordium, we're on a mission to pioneer groundbreaking technology and shape the future. Join our Core Blockchain team as a Senior Software Engineer and be part of a team that's dedicated to pushing the boundaries of innovation to create solutions that make a lasting impact.

Our core blockchain development team works in close cooperation with leading scientists and researchers to implement the next-generation trusted blockchain protocols.

➡️The work will cover all aspects of blockchain technology (including implementation of a smart contract language, cryptographic primitives and protocols, networking, consensus protocol, and databases) using technologies such as Haskell and Rust. It is an advantage if you have experience with one of these or similar technologies and languages.




🗝️Key Responsibilities:

✔️Contributing to the design, architecture, standards, code and operating processes that support our blockchain infrastructure including:

The Concordium blockchain node
The protocol, APIs and smart contract engine
SDKs
Blockchain scanners and other supporting tools

✔️Developing technical specifications and system architecture documentation

✔️Ensuring security, scalability, and performance of blockchain solutions

✔️Collaborating with stakeholders to translate requirements into technical solutions

✔️Providing technical mentorship and expertise within the team




🎓Qualifications:

Our ideal candidate has some of the following abilities and experiences:

Excellent communication and documentation skills
Strong problem-solving and analytical abilities
Experience of working in teams using agile methodologies
The ability to explain complex concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Understanding of distributed computing
A good general understanding of programming languages and compiler tooling
Strong understanding of distributed systems, P2P networks and consensus mechanisms
Experience with building and maintaining automated CI/CD pipelines
Working knowledge of Haskell or Rust or similar languages
Team leadership and mentoring capabilities




🏢We Offer:

Work on solving deep problems with a friendly and ambitious team
The opportunity to work with cutting-edge blockchain and decentralized ledger technology
An exciting, and intellectually challenging environment where you can learn, grow, and thrive
Opportunities to go to conferences, enhance your professional profile, and expand your network
A competitive remuneration package




About Concordium:

Concordium is a public blockchain platform designed for security, privacy, and scalability. It offers a unique identity layer at protocol level to ensure verified and private user interactions enabled via zero-knowledge proof technology. Enterprises & Developers can leverage Concordium’s fast and affordable transactions, along with its robust programmable money capabilities, to build innovative decentralized applications, while ensuring accountability and compliance as required by new regulatory frameworks.




#SeniorSoftwareEngineer #SoftwareEngineering #BlockchainJobs #CryptoJobs #Web3Jobs #TechJobs #EngineeringJobs #SoftwareDevelopment #DecentralizedTech

Title: 2025 Software Engineering Internship, Aarhus
Description:
About The Role

The Uber Engineering Internship presents a unique opportunity for passionate individuals pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree to gain practical experience while working alongside our community of engineers.

If you are studying software engineering and want to be part of one of the fastest-growing and exciting startup companies in the world, if you are enthusiastic about achieving massive scalability and expanding our excellent technology to international markets, and if you aspire to make valuable contributions to Uber's success, then we want to have a conversation with you.

At Uber, we believe that people are our most valuable assets, and we foster an inclusive environment that welcomes diverse perspectives. We are actively seeking sharp and tech-savvy junior engineers to join our team as we continue to expand our global footprint. This is an opportunity to work with an outstanding team on the daily functions that lie at the heart of Uber's engineering endeavors.

What You'll Do


Work with a dynamic and supportive team of backend and frontend engineers, along with product managers, designers, data scientists, and user researchers.
Propose ideas, implement solutions, experiment, and launch your ideas to Uber's millions of users
Influence other engineers, teams, and product managers, impacting the full product lifecycle
Collaborate with teams in different offices
Keep the bar high on sustainable engineering by following best practices, producing best in class of code, documentation, testing, and monitoring


Basic Qualifications:


Actively pursuing a Bachelor's (3rd/4th year) or a Master's in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical field
Prior exposure to software engineering best practices through hackathons, coding challenges, university projects or previous internships
Available for a 6 month full-time internship
Work authorization in Denmark


Start date: 7th July

What You'll Gain


A competititve monthly internship allowance along with housing support
Monthly Uber Credits for Rides and Eats purchases plus a discount
The rare opportunity to change the world such that everyone around you is using the product you built - we're moving real people and assets and reinventing transportation and logistics globally
Strong mentorship and the opportunity to learn from Senior Software Engineers that will guide you through your internship experience
The opportunity to build personal network with smart and hardworking interns and Uber Employees who share your passion for technology in an international work environment
A variety of learning opportunities designed for interns
The possibility of joining the team permanently in the future and building an exciting career at Uber
Show more

Title: Python Engineer (APIs,Pandas, NumPy) REMOTE, £35k plus bonus
Description:
About

Python Engineer (APIs,Pandas, NumPy) Tech firm. REMOTE, £35k plus bonus.

I'm proud to be working exclusively with a growing technology business who are truly a force to be reckoned with, within their chosen industry. They're looking for a true Python enthusiast to join their tech team at what couldn't be a more busy and more exciting time for them.

These guys produce software that essentially helps companies save £££ using state-of-the-art systems and only the best technology choices. They have built and shipped an application that is already utilised by some huge, well-known organisations yet they haven't even scratched the surface of where they want to take it.

You're gonna work across all phases of the Dev life-cycle from planning and design through to operation and maintenance. What I LOVE about this role is that you will be able to really get your teeth stuck into deploying exciting new solutions working closely with clients to help them achieve their perfect solution!

Tech wise you'll love coding in Python and have exposure to Pandas and NumPy. Your database experience will be in MySQL and you'll also be a Cloud enthusiast using AWS as a platform (Lambda and CloudTrail).

You'll join a cracking team and rub shoulders with some super talented Python Engineers who really know their stuff. The best part of this role is undoubtedly the people you will be working for. The Directors are fantastic with a real vision for the evolution of the company and they look after their people incredibly well.

ALSO!... They have just received a huge £££ investment which will result in numerous new hires into the business and overall tech investment into their amazing product.

You can work remotely - with one day a month within their West Midlands based office and in return you will receive up to £35k DOE plus bonus!) and much more.

Apply now for immediate consideration by emailing (url removed)

Modis International Ltd acts as an employment agency for permanent recruitment and an employment business for the supply of temporary workers in the UK. Modis Europe Ltd provide a variety of international solutions that connect clients to the best talent in the world. About

Python Engineer (APIs,Pandas, NumPy) Tech firm. REMOTE, £35k plus bonus.

I'm proud to be working exclusively with a growing technology business who are truly a force to be reckoned with, within their chosen industry. They're looking for a true Python enthusiast to join their tech team at what couldn't be a more busy and more exciting time for them.

These guys produce software that essentially helps companies save £££ using state-of-the-art systems and only the best technology choices. They have built and shipped an application that is already utilised by some huge, well-known organisations yet they haven't even scratched the surface of where they want to take it.

You're gonna work across all phases of the Dev life-cycle from planning and design through to operation and maintenance. What I LOVE about this role is that you will be able to really get your teeth stuck into deploying exciting new solutions working closely with clients to help them achieve their perfect solution!

Tech wise you'll love coding in Python and have exposure to Pandas and NumPy. Your database experience will be in MySQL and you'll also be a Cloud enthusiast using AWS as a platform (Lambda and CloudTrail).

You'll join a cracking team and rub shoulders with some super talented Python Engineers who really know their stuff. The best part of this role is undoubtedly the people you will be working for. The Directors are fantastic with a real vision for the evolution of the company and they look after their people incredibly well.

ALSO!... They have just received a huge £££ investment which will result in numerous new hires into the business and overall tech investment into their amazing product.

You can work remotely - with one day a month within their West Midlands based office and in return you will receive up to £35k DOE plus bonus!) and much more.
